OCC MP Reports - Financial Help

Reports submitted: 1031

Seventh-day Adventist Church

24832573 / 1

Your help to young mothers has been a very good support. Because there was a need for baby food, diapers and more. We bought and distributed all this for newborns

Seventh-day Adventist Church

24832573 / 2

I give help to some of them at work, we go to others because they live in nearby villages and do not have a car. It's nice to receive good feedback from them. And we have already given help to some, but it was 40 days ago, when the war started, and they have already eaten everything - they are asking for more.

Ternopil?s?ka oblasna blahodiyna orhanizatsiya «Sertse myloserdya»

33455876 / 3

Thank God! In the dark, bright people are very visible. In His Sermon on the Mount, Christ called his disciples and followers to be a light to the world. At this difficult time, it is important for our country to receive help and support from sincere people and those who care about Ukraine. On behalf of TOBO "Heart of Mercy" we express our sincere gratitude to the sponsors and partners of PRD. We are pleased to understand that in this trouble we are not alone, but you are with us in your prayers and material support. We directed our work in several directions: 1. Providing assistance to people affected by hostilities personally 2. Cooperation with churches and other public organizations to help and support refugees from military aggression. For many years, our charity has been providing humanitarian aid to socially vulnerable groups in Ukraine. This experience contributed to the establishment of mechanisms in these difficult times of war. Several testimonies about the people we met and helped as much as possible: 1. Eugene, a resident of Kharkiv in the past participated in the anti-terrorist operation, living in Kharkov had a car, house, apartment, his wife had his own dentistry. In a few days he lost everything, got by evacuation train to Ternopil and was at the refugee reception point on the street. Textile, all he had left was the clothes he was wearing (sports pants, torn sneakers, a thin jacket) and a small backpack with documents without finances for subsistence, he had only 200 hryvnias. And the opportunity to be at the refugee reception center 3 days. What was done: Clothes were provided: new sneakers (autumn-winter), winter jacket, new jeans, personal hygiene products (toothbrush, toothpaste, deodorant, shaving products), financial assistance for travel to Lviv with further arrival to Novovolynsk, Volyn region. In a few days he had the opportunity to go abroad where he met his wife and will build a new life without war. 2. Many people responded to help for IDPs and were ready to receive them in their homes. Since most migrants do not have the finances for their livelihood, buying food, clothing, etc. decided to support them with food kits that included basic foods (rice, pasta, cereals, stews, flour, sugar, etc.). 3. Together with the Local Church "Druzhba" in Ternopil, assistance was provided in the reception, nutrition, spiritual and psychological support of people affected by the war. Every night, 50 to 200 refugees are received at the House of Prayer. 4.. Together with the Church in Zbarazh, material assistance was provided to more than 40 migrants from Mariupol who left the blockade. Clothes and food were provided, a house was rented, cosmetic repairs were made to improve living conditions, mattresses and utensils were provided for comfortable living.

Cerkva evangelskih hristian-baptystiv «Fimiam» m. Lutsk

26120871 / 4

Since the beginning of the war, our church has not shied away from the needs and problems of the people. After the first explosions in our city, we opened the doors of the church building as a shelter for the locals during air raids. We tried to support everyone morally and spiritually. When evacuated people from the battlefields began to arrive in the west, we made dozens of flights to bring them to Lutsk. For their temporary stay, we turned the classrooms of our private school, which is located in the church building, into living rooms. We are also actively evacuating people by church transport from hotspots. We have already made four passenger bus flights to Dnipro and Druzhkivka and evacuated more than 200 people. By the way, one flight costs us approximately 35 thousand UAH. Now we accept from 50 to 100 people in the church. We provide them with three meals a day, help them find housing, and transport those who want to go abroad. Also, every week we provide migrants with food kits, help with medicines and personal hygiene products. With your help, we have the opportunity to refuel for regular travel, buy groceries and help the displaced. As the front line is constantly changing and the flow of migrants does not stop, we are ready to continue to serve and help people, not only physically but also in their spiritual needs. We are sincerely grateful for your love for Ukrainians and care for us in this difficult time. Thank you for not staying away, but for finding the opportunity to serve our needs. Your love and faith in practical help is inspiring.

Ukrainska evangelska tserkva “ dzherelo zhuttia”

25989489 / 5

Purchased 400 food packages which were taken to the Kiev region, from Zdvizhivka, with. Andriyivka, distributed to people who survived the occupation

More than 90 refugees have received assistance, 45 people have remained in temporary residence on the church grounds, and others have been helped to cross Ukraine's borders.

RO "Hristianska misia "Kovcheg spasinnya"

38503316 / 8

Church of Spaniards. Our church prepares finished products and delivers them to hotspots in newly liberated territories, as well as to the military. We also pack food packages and humanitarian aid, which we send on our own buses to Kyiv, Chernihiv, etc. We accept refugees, try to resettle them, look for houses, pay for communal services, support financially. On the territory of the church we have places for migrants, where they temporarily live. Accordingly, we feed them. We also feed breakfast and lunch daily to soldiers-instructors who have come from abroad and teach maintenance. We are sincerely grateful for your help. May the Lord bless you abundantly.

Baptist Church of Nova Odessa

23616123 / 11

Today is a difficult time for our country and for our region. But God is still good to us at this time. We are very grateful for your help. For two weeks in the city of Nikolaev and with. Snow Maiden has no water. People needed to draw water from the river to use it for their own needs. We were able to buy barrels and water to bring to these areas and help people with drinking and industrial water. May the Lord bless you for your generous heart.

UCHVE Velykyj Bereznyj

25446406 / 12

Our local church in Velykyi Bereznyi, the pastor and the whole team of volunteers are sincerely grateful to the brother of the President of the Samaritan Bag Project Franklin Graham for the timely financial support provided to us. We used the funds for their intended purpose, namely to feed and heat the IDPs on the border of the Ublya checkpoint, which is a few kilometers from the location of our church. We transported (evacuated) and organized the entry of migrants to other European countries (Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Norway and others). We continue to work. We provide living space (temporarily and permanently, with all the conditions, food, heat.) Distribute food kits to all those in need. We hold entertainment classes with children, meetings with women. We provide assistance to the Armed Forces. We hold daily prayer meetings in the church. We are sincerely grateful to God for our country Ukraine, for His mercy, for faith and hope that we will be Jesus in heaven????????????

And also children from an orphanage in the city of Kherson, they live in the basement - they paid for the purchase of food and medicine the city of Sumy - paid for a minibus for the evacuation of refugees, and also paid for the services of a truck for delivering products and paid for part of the products to fill this truck. Sumy and Kherson are also hot spots. People cry with joy and God's love, we thank the Samaritan's Bag mission for sincere help to the people of Ukraine during the war??????

Baptist Church of Nova Odessa

23616123 / 15

Today there are many families in our town who have been forced to leave their homes because they are now under occupation. Last week, three families turned to us for help. We were able to provide them with food, a children's office and medicine. They also bought clothes for the children. Because they came as a family with one backpack. We also then invited them to serve. And they accepted the invitation, and on Sunday all with the children were at the feast of "Jesus' entry into Jerusalem." Even in such difficult times, God works great miracles. Glory to Him for everything! We are sincerely grateful for your heart that cares about the people of our country

Baptist Church of Nova Odessa

23616123 / 16

For we are His creation, created in Christ Jesus for the good works that God intended us to do. (Ephesians 2:10) Each of us today can be a testimony of practical service to people with a mission proclaimed by the Samaritan Bag Project to "show love in tangible form with the local churches." During the war, since our church received funds from the project, we have been able to help about 1,000 people in various forms of help: medicine, evacuation, clothing, food, prayer, study of God's word, just keep quiet and listen to the pain a person has experienced. . God is wonderful! For He opens your hearts to help hundreds of thousands of people, and to show His love for them in a tangible way. Thank you for a wonderful example of service. We saw the shining eyes of children rejoicing in the gift, we saw tears in the eyes of grandparents who were left alone in distant villages and needed help, we prayed with those who were able to leave the occupied city and moved to our town in search of temporary accommodation. we helped expectant mothers who could not gather at the maternity hospital, we felt the strong hugs of those who were evacuated, prayed for our defenders at the checkpoints, giving them hot drinks, food, cried with the women whose husbands went to protect and with them lost touch ... it was all possible thanks to your open heart and the financial help you gave us. May the Lord preserve and bless you!

22574836 / 18

With these finances, food packages were made which were delivered to hot spots, after deoccupation, and beads were refueled to deliver this help! During this time, 1,500 people were accepted and sent away (fed, given clothes, food and delivery to the border)! People who received food packages are Chernihiv, Kharkiv, Kherson, and Kyiv regions (in the first days after deoccupation)! This report is written in a bus that is currently delivering aid (in the amount of 200 food packages, two such buses) in the village of Bashtanka, 15 km from the fighting! May the Lord reward

GO "Rodyna Ponad Use"

44365764 / 21

Many thanks to God and the mission of the Samaritan Bag, for the funds that were sent to our organization to help other people in this difficult time for Ukraine. Thanks to these funds, our public organization "Family Above All" was able to evacuate many people from Kyiv, Kherson from the Mykolaiv region, most women and children. Also at the expense of these funds many products and medicines were purchased and transported to the occupied territories, where, unfortunately, there is already a shortage of medicines, and the prices are high, it is difficult for people who lose their jobs to buy them. pass on help. We are currently serving the people with clothes, homes and food. Our center served as a shelter, during the heavy shelling, many unbelievers came there, we had the opportunity to testify to people about God and some of them accepted this Good News, Glory to God! Thanks to the funds received, we were able to cover the expenses that were spent to serve the people in the shelter. God bless you!

Baptist Church of Nova Odessa

23616123 / 22

When we heard the news that about 50 families with children had been resettled in our kindergarten, who were forced to leave their homes due to the occupation of Snihurivka, we immediately knew what to do - go there. We prepared a children's program, bought children sweets, apples and took gifts and went to kindergarten. The emotions we saw there are incredible. One girl opened the gift, saw a spoon and began to kiss her, as if it were the most precious treasure in her life. Another girl rejoiced at her gift, telling her mother, "Look at my towel and comb." Such simple things brought such sincere emotions to the children who left home without toys, things, to a safer place ... It was a wonderful day ... parents of children be ready to communicate, we prayed together for them. Unfortunately, we could not spend more time together, because the next day these people were evacuated to safer cities in Ukraine. But thanks to these gifts, we were able to show the children almost how much Jesus loves them

Çàâåò Áëàãîäàòè

34992436 / 23

Assistance provided by the Mission was received by 73 people. Some of these people are members of the local Christian church Covenant of Grace. The second part is people from the world with whom there is a connection and relationship. All people receiving assistance live in the city of Nikolaev. Mostly they are family people and pensioners. Retirees living alone. Because of the war, each of these people faced a deep state of material need. People are younger, have lost their jobs and have no or limited livelihoods. Older people are under intense pressure to struggle both with health problems and with the ability to support themselves in matters of subsistence. As an example, the first three weeks of the war dealt such a blow to the life of the city of Nikolaev that people could not go out because of fear. There were no supplies of food and medicines to the city. Some pensioners could not afford food for several days. It was also a problem for couples with small children. Shrapnel from shells crawled into the houses of several people after shelling the city. Windows were shattered, doors were broken. Experiencing a strong pressure of fear, people were on the verge of despair. The situation with help brought much encouragement and revived the hearts of the people in the hope of God. Since everyone is asking for His mercy and help. Coming to people and bringing them food, we witnessed tears and prayers of gratitude. Constant assistance with food, medicines is extremely important for people in the city of Nikolaev and its environs. The city is at the forefront of hostilities. Every day people face shelling. Food, clothes, medicines give hope for survival and preservation of the life given by God. with respect and prayer Pastor Vladimir Mikita Church Testament of Grace

Kristian Mission “ Grace” c. Odessa

23205785 / 24

Can help to keep orphans at our organization

Christians of Evangolikal Faith, Varah

Thank you for your help. She is really needed at this time. Our church works in two directions: preparing food for soldiers, as well as sending food to the east and center of Ukraine. And also helps migrants who came to our town.

Jesus Christ

24117994 / 26

greet you dear friends, brothers and sisters, with gratitude in my heart I pray for you to the Lord Jesus Christ for financial assistance and your support, for your loving heart to the people of Ukraine and to the Church, which today is under occupation and under pressure from Russian troops, but we are not discourage. Today, there are a lot of people who, with tears in their eyes, are waiting for help in medicines and food, and in prayer for encouragement and inspiration. Thanks to your financial assistance, we were able to help people who were cut off from electricity, water, gas and public transport, without mobile communications. We had the opportunity to refuel volunteers' cars, purchase food products and medicines, and also evacuated people from places of particular danger. And much more. Praise the Lord for your work For the Glory of the Lord.

Tserkva EHB s.Sadiv

37004110 / 27

With the beginning of the war, the life of Ukrainians changed, before and after. Many people were forced to leave their homes and find a safe place for their families. Churches in the western regions of Ukraine have become actively involved in helping refugees. Many thanks to the Samaritan's Bag Charitable Foundation for the funds provided to help people affected by Russia's aggression against Ukraine. Much work has been done during the war with the tangible support of the foundation. The premises of the House of Prayer became a temporary shelter for hundreds of migrants, and shuttle bus trips to hotspots became a way of life. Several bus trips to the East of Ukraine were made. We delivered food and clothes to the residents of the hotspots. On the way back, we took away those who had fled the war. The prayer house's classrooms have become the living quarters of people evacuated from the East. The sisters in the church canteen organized a daily shift in the kitchen and fed the settlers three times a day. The church distributed food kits several times to those who rented accommodation. For the children, the children's ministry team held a celebration with the distribution of Samaritan Bags. Every evening our church prays for peace in Ukraine and an end to the war. We thank the foundation for its important help in such a difficult time. May God bless you abundantly and reward you for your sensitive heart.

Good afternoon, thank you for your help at this time, your financial blessings were used to evacuate people, purchase and deliver medicines to those in need, as well as distribute food packages. God bless you

Thank you very much for the opportunity you gave us! We were able to buy medicines, food packages, we were able to distribute them in the city and in villages where people did not have the opportunity to buy all this, we were able to help bring people to safe places. They prayed for people, talked about salvation and about the Savior in Nikolaev, Bashtanka, Bereznegovatoe, Krasnogorsk and in the villages of the Nikolaev region. Thank you for your support and prayers, we know and feel the unity of the Church!

Poklykani peremagaty

42552385 / 30

There are not enough words of gratitude to those people who supported our Ukraine in such difficult times. We are infinitely grateful to the Samaritan Bag team for this financial assistance, which has sheltered thousands of people and, most importantly, fed them. The "Called to Win" public association has been actively volunteering since the first days of the war. Every day we receive newcomers in various educational institutions of Rivne region, give them temporary shelter, feed and clothe them. And these are thousands of people who come to us every day from the hot spots of Ukraine. You worry about them. And thanks to your help, we were able to put together food packages for families affected by the war. Thanks to your financial help, our volunteers were able to bring these people to us. Therefore, may God continue to abundantly bless your generous hearts and may He return to you a hundredfold all that you will do for our Ukraine. I write, and tears in my eyes, I can not find words of gratitude for you, my dears! I have not stopped thanking you for mentioning you in my prayers. Ephesians 1:16

Dear brothers and sisters, our Church sincerely thanks you for the money you have given us for people who are forced to leave their homes. Thanks to your funds, we have been able to help many families and churches that accept refugees. Many families came to our village, some families from the church took us into their homes, also in our village they took refugees to kindergarten, we bought them everything they needed. We also have elderly people and widows in the Church who could not earn money, we also bought them everything they needed. In the city of Chernivtsi, the church also accepts refugees and we also decided to help them and bought everything they needed, products and hygiene products. Thank you very much, thanks to you we have helped many people. May the Lord bless you abundantly.

Cerkva XVE celo Rozvazh

24176904 / 32

First of all, we would like to express our sincere gratitude to Franklin Graham and the entire NLK. You have really been able to show God's love in a tangible way to those who are in difficult situations right now. Our volunteer team has been helping people since the first days of the war, and your contribution has helped us a lot. On the 20th day of the war, a car from our church went on a volunteer trip again. This time it was the city of Kyiv. More than 1000 pieces of fresh bread. At the checkpoint in the city itself, one of the representatives of the territorial defense asks: "Guys, can you buy bread from you?" A conversation ensued about who we are and where we come from. The biggest surprise was when they were given 5 loaves of bread and did not take money for it. They were interested in who we are and why we do it for free, so 2 representatives got in the car and followed us. Arriving at the church while unloading bread, they had the opportunity to communicate and testify to them about God. The boys took contact with the church, have fellowship with local brothers, who continue to tell them about God. Another story… 67-year-old pensioner Anna from Okhtyrka, who was forced to leave the city due to the shelling, came to the church to ask for help. She was prompted by people who were already in the church. Having received a full package of food, necessary medicines and the Gospel, she could not contain her emotions. She was infinitely grateful for her kindness and mercy. A phrase I remembered from her speech: "Your church smells like God… I will definitely come to you for service." Briefly about what the money was spent on: - Evacuation of people from Kyiv region (refueling) - Humanitarian aid (bread baked in our village in the bakery) in Kyiv - Humanitarian aid (food kits, stews, and food prepared in church) for civilians and TerOboron in the liberated towns and villages of Sumy region. - Food aid and medical care for displaced people in our area. - Partially covered the costs and helped one old woman, who is sick, lonely, to buy a used washing machine. - Now we are buying food again and after Easter we are going to help people again. Thank you very much again! We pray every day for you and for our Ukraine. We believe that we will soon continue our ministry in peace!

Hrista Spasitelya

21411262 / 33

Hello, my little Church and I see a great miracle of God in your financial help. The fact is that we bought land for the construction of 12 townhouses (95-115 sq.m.) for IDPs because many families have lost their homes and have nowhere to return Thank God we have already managed to do a lot of preparatory work on our own. We have the opportunity to involve migrants in this construction. and God is strong to help in this project. Thank you very much for your generous support. Together we are moving towards victory!

The village of Hiiche

25544451 / 39

Thank God! Dear partners of the Samaritan Bag! We would like to express to you, sincere thanks, that in such a difficult time for our country, you have shown true MERCY! Thank you very much for seeing the need to help us. Funds sent by you Served and still serve for people who were forced to leave their place of residence and were relocated to our area in connection with the war. Due to the fact that we live near the border with Poland, hot lunches, tea and sweets were distributed to people who left our country and stood in line for 2.3 days. Products were purchased for the families who moved and food packages were formed. 35 packages were distributed. And other things necessary for living (electric tiles, beds, blankets, pillows, towels, buckets, utensils) We also decided to distribute food packages to families who lost their jobs due to the war. On the eve of the holidays, food was purchased and distributed to families - migrants, and invited to the holiday services! We believe that this work is not in vain! In the future we will continue to help these people! God bless you !!!

HVEP s.Kolky

36970519 / 40

The war came to us suddenly, bringing destruction, pain, tears, and the physical deaths of many civilians. But at the same time, sacrifice, kindness, compassion, and love for the neighbor of many, many Christians, not only in Ukraine, but in the whole world, became abundant with this misfortune. Every good deed requires finances. Our church is very grateful to the Good Samaritan Mission for the significant monetary donation, because thanks to this we were able to form and deliver food packages to people in the occupied territories, refuel trucks carrying humanitarian aid, prepare hot lunches for soldiers guarding strategic sites. , sew bulletproof vests, help refugees in their needs. Thank you very much, dear brothers and sisters from abroad, for not standing aside from our misery, you are truly good Samaritans! Be blessed !!!

Baptist Church Emmanuel

40048006 / 44

Thank God for your material help. We, as the Church, work with displaced people and help them in their needs. They also helped them find housing. In those apartments where there was no connection water, electricity, heating. It was also necessary to make cosmetic repairs in one apartment, because there was a fungus. . We went to the market with them in March, sang to people about God's mercy over Ukraine, prayed with them, handed out gospels and brochures. We also make an English club with them and non-believers come from the city and the district… and we make social packages with food for them. and we also invite immigrants and everyone .. the hall is crowded… and since a lot of people started coming and we started to gather more often in the Church, we used your money to provide some furniture, such as a cupboard so that there was a place to put cups, sugar, coffee, napkins and everything you need .. because very often they drink water or tea or coffee., after all these services we have time to communicate and who wants to drink tea or coffee… so we needed a small hanger where you can put the top clothes, because a lot of children come with immigrants… Our neighbor is also a believer and she has two sons in the army and she lives with her daughter and is very poor… she lost water in the house in the pump and my forehead age Valera, he called a master and hammered a new pipe and connected the water .. This woman's name is Zina. She asked for food and shoes for her sons… Her daughter and she started going to meetings… The other day in Novoselytsia we went to a dormitory where many mothers with children live and who come to our Church, we learned that they do not have an iron, and we went and bought an iron and ironing board .. all these moms were very happy… also for the fact that our room is not very big and we as church members are also not many and we had a problem with chairs we went and bought 12 chairs from us was 50 òàêå This is what we could do and will continue to help with God's help and yours… Thank you for everything. May the Lord help you and bless you… There is still money. And we want to continue to help everyone who needs this help…

RO "Ukrayins?ka khrystyyans?ka tserkva"

43333438 / 45

Thanks to this financial assistance, we were able to help a large number of people. Here are some stories: 1. There are a lot of soldiers in our community who have had problems with their teeth. Many froze due to bad weather and all the problems became inflammatory. The local dentist treated them for free, but over time she ran out of materials and she asked us to help her in some way or something. Thanks to financial help, we were able to order and pay for dental supplies and the dentist continued to help the boys overcome the pain before they went to the hot spots. 2. We are looking for and delivering rubber aid to migrants and thanks to our help we have the opportunity to buy fuel and continue to help people. 3. After 1.5 months of war, the bus that was constantly carrying aid, people broke down, which stopped all work, because in our time without a car as without hands. And thanks to the funds, we were able to help repair the beads and continue to serve the people. Thank you for supporting and helping us and our citizens in such a difficult and difficult time.

Slovo Istyny

25314900 / 46

would like to begin the testimony with a great gratitude to God and the team for the sacrifice and blessing of our local church. During the war with Russia, the Church began to work actively to help the settlers in our area, as well as for defense. In the future, they began to actively help our army and people in the hot spots of our country. In the Zaporozhye region, our church helped buy potatoes for five large families. Many products were purchased and packaged. These kits were distributed to needy people. The church team works with the production of various salads, cookies, cakes for people in the central and eastern regions of our Ukraine. Lunch is delivered every day for the defense of our area. All the settlers who are attached to our church and live in the homes of our brothers and sisters are provided with food and hygiene products. At the moment, our resource is still inexhaustible. We continue to work without stopping. Thank God we can do a great job together.

Church "Grace" Mukachevo

33852846 / 47

Our church is engaged in several areas of service to refugees: providing accommodation for IDPs, as well as providing assistance in the form of food, clothing, hygiene for IDPs. The funds we received gave us the opportunity, first of all, to take care of people living in the homes of our church members as well as in our church building. Most people left in winter clothes almost empty-handed and with small amounts of money in their wallets. That's why we provide people with clothes, shoes and hygiene products. We also take care of their medical needs: visits to doctors, purchase of medicines and payment for prescribed treatment. Everyone can receive food packages, even those who do not live in our church. Also, part of the funds was used to arrange additional accommodation for migrants: beds, mattresses, linen. Given the number of people who pass through our church, all these things require a lot of money. We are sincerely grateful for the help that has opened up many opportunities for our church to serve both Christians and people who do not know God and have encountered Christianity and Christians for the first time.

Cerkva XVE selo Uizdci

39615146 / 48

Our church used these funds to purchase products and personal hygiene products (humanitarian aid) for refugees living in neighboring villages, and also sent them to the occupied and liberated territories. Mykolaiv, Sumy, Kyiv regions.

Vefil

25077848 / 49

Our Church is engaged in refugees and settles on the territory of the Church for the night for a decade of days, approximately 300 migrants are accepted per day, three of them are suitable and help to get to know the place of residence for the last term. Deyak³ s³m¿, yak³ zabazali zabazhalis in our m. Chern³vts³ we helped with the rent and the necessary speeches for pobutu - vicorist koshti, yak³ were given to us. Instead, they appointed 3 stati vitrates: transport, dovgotrivale settlement (rent), provision of food and speeches. We also plan to help the settlers themselves. Below is evidence/interview and a photo dekilka, as we took in our families. #1 I want to say a few words about my family and our move to Chernivtsi. My name is Irina, I was born and lived all my life in the city of Dnipro. Like most people, there was an ordinary life, a house, work, the desire to do something for the family. But on February 24, he made adjustments in the lives of many Ukrainians, and my family did not pass by. At first there was a shock, but due to the fact that in our region there were not as many explosions as in other cities, in principle, she continued to work to the sound of sirens. But on March 11, 2022, our family woke up from terrible explosions that were very close (5 minutes drive from our house), the explosion sounded early in the morning, after a couple of minutes another one, then another iiiiii ....... husband Evgeny said to pack things because you have to leave. Having phoned with some friends, the husband was even more convinced of the decision to go, because. one friend was already halfway to Lviv, and the second, David, after the explosions on 03/11/2022 left the Dnieper an hour later. So, the decision was made, the only thing left to do was to convince my mother to go, who is 78 years old and she was not going to go anywhere. As a result, having cried with my mother in turn, our family on 03/12/2022 under the new terrible sounds of rockets flying over our house one after another with the sound of an airplane that lands such an impression on the house, left somewhere ..... On the way to the side West of Ukraine, my husband called David, who left earlier and advised some moments where to stay, where there is gasoline, etc. We stopped to spend the night in the church in Uman, slept right in the prayer house and were grateful to God, we decided where we would go next, because. we planned to rent the most economical housing in Transcarpathia for a couple of months, but David told my husband that his family was staying in Chernivtsi and advised us to go in this direction. Already at night, while staying in Uman, we decided to go to Chernivtsi, David said that they say that for a couple of weeks at most you can live in the church, and during this time we will look for housing and work or go somewhere further. Already on March 13, 2022, we arrived in Chernivtsi in the evening. Today is 04/16/2022! We continue to be in Chernivtsi. The most important summary ...... for all this time, God led our family as He pleases, we never needed anything. No one kicked us out into the street, we were all the time in abundance, warm, not hungry, and every day we were surprised at the people who serve in all this, of course, the pastor and the ministers who organize people. During the period of stay here, several times each of us (mother, me and Milan's daughter) wanted to return to the Dnieper, especially my mother and I, I wanted to work in non-stop mode, and my mother "was sick" garden ", she lives separately from us , in the suburbs of the Dnieper in a private house and of course I wanted to go home.My daughter, in principle, continues to study remotely and endured the move more calmly, and her husband had to maneuver between our emotions and all the time to say that we are not just in this city. because every day I was convinced of this myself.What I want to say is that my mother Maria, a deeply religious person for many years and is a member of the Pentecostal local church, my husband and I were in the Lord, repented and at one time were baptized, but departed from God and the zigzags of life were sometimes on the verge of death and problems, and each time in the understanding that this was not just so, praying and continuing to be far from God, we lived. with every one the same life tossed us even more (I won’t specify, this is a completely different evidence of God’s mercy). Every day I knew for sure that for some reason we are in this city and maybe someone will find it funny or something philosophical or incomprehensible or deep, BUT everything that happens in Ukraine and the life of each of us is more spiritual things than we think. During this time, our daughter Milana repented, her husband Eugene reconciled with God, he also repented, and for some reason this happened in the Bethel Church in Chernivtsi, and not in Dnipro. By the way, a couple of weeks ago I wanted so much to go out and repent, but my legs were chained to the floor. Now I'm waiting and praying for the same prompting to come out to repent. So no matter how scary everything that happens to each of us, all the experiences, fears and dreams of a good future .... for myself, I understand for sure that for me this is a lesson and an opportunity to trust God, because in life I I like to calculate everything in advance and solve all issues, etc., but such a time has come that I feel helpless in many matters and understand that absolutely nothing depends on a person. And now in my head I remember only one thing, when we left the Dnieper, my husband told me: “Don’t worry, God will provide for everything, don’t be nervous about money, housing, food, etc., you will see we will even have an apartment for free ... Of course, I believe God and at that moment I was glad of my husband’s optimism, but inside there were differences of irony and skeptics .... well, today is 04/16/2022, rockets are firing again in the Dnieper, and we live in a quiet blessed city of Chernivtsi, we live for free , before that we lived in two places together with other settlers and were very happy, we do not need absolutely anything, but all because my husband gave the situation to God and prayed that God would lead us Himself. loved ones and relatives for our salvation brought us to this city, even at such a time, but I know that God has plans for our lives, our family is happy that it is here, goes to this church, communicates with believers and in a certain context, this is a blessed time for us, and all my we will understand what, how and why, probably later, but I understood one thing for sure, to be and to seem are different things, i.e. speaking beautifully and listening to what you need to trust God is one thing, but trusting God and trusting is another, and the first steps of faith, trust that my husband took when leaving the Dnieper provided our family with a peaceful sleep and prosperity in everything, and in our area (and not only) in the Dnieper today, windows and doors swayed with a shock wave and caused fear and horror from what was happening. Glory to the Great God!!!!! Peace and goodness to all. #2 Mayzhe p³v m³lyonne place, in yaky zaledve over 100 thousand houses were lost, none on the verge of life and death. Vibratisya z labet hunger and fear is far from cutaneous. How to unblock the place. Our spy, as you know, was spared: in Chernivtsi, the girl opined with all her homeland, for the wine of children and grandmothers. The day before, I was burning - I could not see the fierce 23, with such a heart, for such conditions, I will abandon Mariupol, - guess Yulia Gorbenko. - At the right place, I came from Kiev, I'm delaying, on the eve of this day of the people. My father is a private student, and my mother works with applicants at the Moscow University. Later, 27 fierce mi z tatom went to the volunteer center. On the territory of the abandoned factory, there were a lot of faceless people, sorting speeches, eating and liking, preparing “Bandera smoothies” thinly. Hromadyanskaya ³n³ts³ativa Bula Shalena. Already at that time there was no open pharmacy near the center! We were carrying medicines from our area. People massively bought up preparations for colds and infections, sickness of the heart, calmness. We bought all the "Lidocaine" and "Diclofenac", standing in thin air 40. Gasoline was brought to the volunteer center, so we took up the "Molotov cocktails". They prepared them in a friendly atmosphere, tested the balls and handed over the boxes to the Viysks. Mariupol willingly went to the defense, but there they took less people with combat proof. On the 16th, a year before the commandant's, my father and I broke home. Tilki passed through the part of the war (they used to smoke often), here, behind, they began to vibrate and felt an automaton black. Qi sound like chills on the back, nibi pidganyayuchi you. Ale, they were afraid of me, they could think that they were saboteurs, and shoot me. We sealed our windows with adhesive tape and hung them with kotsiks. With a skin-covered anxiety, they threw themselves at the front doors - they filed a vicon, closer to the center of the booth. There we had a mattress, pillows and carpets. They didn’t go to the bottoms, because our house didn’t have yoga, but they simply couldn’t reach someone else’s. And another birch near the city there was an electrician, a sound, that water was scorched. Gas is the only thing that was lost in us. How to live in chaos My fathers may call the call to buy food in advance, that potatoes and vermicelli would last for a month. We did not starve, although we wanted to clearly fence ourselves. And it washes the family of tourists, so we had fast brewing (for 9 days), gas burners, cylinders, sleeping bags and lanterns. All this saved us, because soon the apartment was +10, and outside -7. In the evenings, we read Mark Twain's Mysterious Island, played Alias, and sometimes sang. These are the only entertainments that somehow strengthened our spirit. Frightened by the lack of bread. We used to bake it in an electric oven, but now we have mastered the oven. It was used to bake pita bread on flour, water and yeast. When the gas later disappeared, bread began to be cooked on vodka and barbecue, wrapped in fiberglass. All the shops were closed, and looters began to break into them. The neighbor brought us chicken legs in exchange for salt. The legs, apparently, have been lying without cooling for a long time, but we ate them with pleasure. And on March 5, I learned that the police had opened the ATB. When I got there, I saw some boxes scattered on the floor, empty shelves, drunks were looking for something. The spectacle is terrible. You see civilization receding and chaos coming. Water was collected from snow and rain, but it ran out quickly. We not only cooked, but also washed, maintained hygiene and washed dishes. One day my father went to Zintseva Balka to the spring. There a shell hit one of the houses, killing two people. Bodies lay in the middle of the road, their bottles lying around, like things from a house. In the mouth of war Around March 4, we heard the sound of a mortar. These are such deaf babbles that you quickly get used to. Usually it all started at 5 am. The shells landed somewhere very close and it seemed that the next one would definitely fly to your room, break the glass, collect all the sheets in a ball of rags and turn the house into a landfill with everyone who lives here. The house shook as if it were an earthquake. And on March 6, we realized what "Hail" is. He comes with such a roar from which he intuitively wants to hide. This roar grows to a superb level, and then falls on your head and ears (we covered them and opened our mouths to avoid contusion). As it turned out, the shells fell in all neighboring yards, except ours. Only our balcony was hit by a fragment. All nearby streets were damaged by metal blows. Somewhere a funnel, somewhere balconies hanging in rags, somewhere black walls from the fire, and somewhere in general demolished the roof, trees fell and broken wires creep along the road. The gas disappeared that day. Enemy bombers flew several times a day. Two bombs were thrown at a time. People almost didn't pay attention to them, as well as to mortars, went out into the yard to lay fires. Our entrance stood by the fire in a group, discussing the news, sharing food. One day our neighbor did not return: he followed the water to the spring and died during the shelling. People began to be buried just in the park across the street. Although another of our neighbors lay at the bus stop for several days, covered with a blanket. There were corpses in other yards as well, some were buried, some were not. It was nervous without news from Ukraine. But my dad connected the generator from the car to our receiver. In the same receiver turned on the wire of the television antenna. So we quickly caught the wave and listened to a telethon every night. Neighbors also came. In addition to our wave, we came across the enemy. I tried to figure out what they were saying, but the language was encrypted. For the next ten days, we lived with one hope. We hoped for a humanist at least. But the number 12 finally made it clear that the Russians were starving us. I was afraid of him even more than hail. My father offered to pack my backpacks and go to my relatives in the village along the sea. However, we did not agree, as the coast could be mined. The way to life We gathered on the road on March 15. They tried to take everyone they could into their van. My mother simply brought her sister's (my aunt's) family under fire. They lived in the basement for the last few days, they came tired, hungry and dirty, although we all haven't washed for a long time. My younger sister was wearing a dressing gown and a jacket. We waited for them in the car near the Drama Theater - this was the last time I saw him whole. Then a girl with a sick child asked us. We left as follows: seven adults and two children. We moved along the corridor: Melekino - Mangush - Tokmak - Zaporozhye. We spent only two days on the road, because the child had oncology and we were allowed out of the emergency. Other people spent the night in queues in the middle of the fields. Most Russians were in Mangush and near Tokmak. They noticed that in Mangush they are a "model of politeness", but the closer to Zaporozhye, the more nervous they are, the stronger they hold the machines, the more blinded by fear and rage. Not far from Zaporizhia we drove past a burning car. And then they learned that an hour earlier the barbarians had fired on the column. Today, my grandparents remain in Mariupol, with whom I have no connection and whom we could not reach. All we have to do is believe in our victory and the lives of those we love!

RELIGIYNA ORGANIZATSIYA " RELIGIYNA GROMADA TSERKVA YEVANGELSKYUKH KHRYSTYYAN BABTYSTIV"

21362836 / 50

The funds received became an important resource in helping people affected by the war. The church has two directions in terms of help. The first is caring for refugees who have been forced to flee their homes because of the war. It is difficult to say the exact number of people who have now moved to our town, only those who have passed through our church to three hundred. About 20 families are people whom the church directly helped to find housing and equip everything necessary. Other people who ask for help can get food, clothes, medicine ... In fact, there is no day when people do not turn to the church for help. The second direction is humanitarian aid to people who remained in difficult conditions, near the front line (Kharkiv, Lysychansk). From the first days of the war, we prepare food and send it to people who need it. We are cooking because there is no possibility to cook in those areas. During the war we bought 7 pigs, which were processed into stews and porridge with meat. This is not counting pancakes and dumplings. To date, I'm not even trying to count the number of cans we sent. We help with the evacuation of those who wish to leave. What God does these days often causes tears, and it is the means by which God blesses, because from the first days the church simply gave the last means to serve people in need, and then God began to take care of it. These are people who first crossed the threshold of the church and said, "What can we do?" And then we could serve together, share our experiences, pray. This is a packed hall on Sunday for worship. And the most important thing is the repentance of the people. During this time, 5 people accepted Christ into their hearts. It was unbelievable to hear the words of Vicky from Kharkiv, who was forced to flee the war with her family, leave home, work, but with the rest saying "I'm sorry" to God, then saying "thank you for bringing me back to yourself because of the war" Thank God and thank you for being able to cooperate in the commission that Christ left us.

We also have the opportunity to provide targeted assistance to IDPs with children and the elderly. We are very grateful for the opportunity to serve the Lord and the people, for the financial support we have from the Samaritan Bag, refueling and car service.

On the streets, people were found through people who needed help, they bought and distributed food, bread, things. Sent across the border on various paid and charitable transports. And now we work as a transshipment base.

Our hearts are open to help. We understand well that this is the time when it is necessary to save the soul, first of all to save physical life, so that those people can n to see that our Lord is alive, he does not leave us in the difficult circumstances of life. Lishche

36716716 / 56

1. In the first days of the war, our local church did not miss the influx of refugees. At the end of February and the beginning of March, we accepted 3 groups of people from different cities for permanent residence (some of whom were helped to get there by their own transport). Kyiv 10 people, Chernihiv 18 people, Luhansk region 12 people. First, we collected and partially purchased food and hygiene products. 20 people were resettled in the homes of our church members, where they have been living for more than 1.5 months. The rest was settled in apartments in the city of Lutsk, which our brothers and sisters kindly gave for use. Today we use 4 apartments for refugees. In 8 weeks, the Church of the village of Lyshche provides housing, heat, food, hygiene items and basic necessities for more than 40 people. Last week, 10 people helped get to Poland. They were taken to the city of Chelm to the Red Cross because they have hearing and speech impairments. But in their places where they lived with us, we are waiting for new people. 2. Together with the brothers we received from the city of Chernihiv, we decided to immediately collect at least 5 tons of food aid for those who remained in Chernihiv without water and food. A collection of products was announced on the basis of Lyshchenskaya Church. We brought food from the surrounding villages, whose residents were open to help. Patrons were involved, who also donated products. We went to Poland for food and medicine. They brought products from those who wanted to help the churches of our Volyn fraternity. So a miracle happened. Instead of the planned 5 tons, we loaded a truck (truck) of 22 tons! God's mercy! They prayed and sent the truck to Chernihiv, although shots were still heard in some places. 2 days later the truck was at its destination. The local church unloaded, packed and we saw large queues of people who received food kits and water. Products were also distributed at the city's hospitals. 3. In our village there is a Kindergarten where about 50 people live permanently. In the movement stage. Some leave, others come. A member of our church is a social worker in the community, so together with volunteers (also teachers who are in the church) regularly hold classes with children who came with their parents. We use the "Samaritan Bag", read "The Funniest Journey" with them, eat sweets and talk about Christ! 4. In addition, we keep in touch with the military of the Armed Forces. At the request of my friend, they bought and transferred to the "advanced" 1000 meters of telephone cable for communication in the field. Without you, dear friends from the Samaritan Bag Foundation, and without your help, we would not have been able to do so much. Thank you very much for your help and long-term fruitful cooperation! We love and pray for you, with respect, the pastor of the church of the village of Lishche, Alexander Makovsky!

RELIGIOUS ORGANIZATION «CHERVONA SLOBODA EVANGELICAL BAPTIST CHURCH»

26155556 / 57

Hello! I would like to thank the Samaritan Bag for the funds provided. They help us a lot. Our church accepts refugees, we have two houses near the church, built for children in 2021, and since the first days of the war we have been accepting IDPs there. In the first two weeks, more than 200 people passed through these houses, stopping for one night and driving on early in the morning. People from Chernihiv and Sumy oblasts also stayed for a longer period of time. then people returned home from these areas when their cities were liberated from the Russian occupiers, while other people settled in their place (Kharkiv, Kramatrosk). about 50 people live in the houses permanently. We covered all utility costs with YOUR help, for church funds (26082 UAH electricity, pump 8000 UAH). We also organized an additional room for housing, ordered 3 beds (UAH 12,000). We also, in cooperation with the regional association of the ECB on the basis of our church, organized a humanitarian aid hub. Our premises are currently under construction (we already dream of completing it) and it now serves as a hub, where products, household chemicals, medicines, clothes in the Cherkasy region and in the church serve people. We also load small cars, buses that go to places closer to the front line, sometimes even beyond the line and carry aid. We try to effectively use the resource provided to us - to meet real needs. The organization and maintenance of this hub also costs money (materials for tables, fuel, sometimes we pay for the delivery of goods by truck and more ... already about 70,000 UAH). We also help the military, military medics, there are military brothers who are at the front. We collect everything we need and give them (mats, sleeping bags, first aid kits, protein bars, ankle boots, etc.). 5 bronzels (UAH 40,000) were purchased for field physicians. We also have your gifts that we give to children and tell about Jesus Christ. With young people from Kharkiv, we are organizing an EVANGELISM SERVICE on the basis of our church after Easter, because we have more than 500 refugees in the village. In this way we proclaim to the world the face of the Church headed by Jesus Christ and become a living sign of God's presence among the people… Thank you very much for your service and support of our work. WE PREACH CHRIST TOGETHER WITH YOU! THANK YOU. There was no place for people at the evening meeting of the church on Thursday, so we ask you to pray and if there is an opportunity to take part in the completion of our church, which is on the "finish" direct construction and it is located in the CENTER of our village. Blessings. I can also download some photos of some checks, and many other photos of our service!

RELIHIYNA HROMADA POMISNOYI TSERKVY KHVYEP POVCHA

Thank God, dear partners. Today is not an easy time that has forced many to change their usual way of life. And it is today that God has given us the opportunity to work for His glory. Thank God, our church has the opportunity to serve, and thanks to your support, our opportunities have increased, for which we are very grateful to you. May the Lord bless you. We serve by delivering groceries, essentials, social packages and more. While distributing the aid, we meet the gratitude and great surprise of the people of the TPO (temporarily displaced persons). People are surprised that they can get something just like that, useless. By giving help, we have the opportunity to witness and tell of the Lord's mercy, and people who have never served God begin to thank Him. One woman said, "We are very surprised by your kindness and sincerity. we would not help you. But through you we see God. " God has shown these people His love and mercy by using us with you. And for us, God has also shown great mercy to become instruments in His hands. Glory be to Him for this.

Dear Samaritan Bag, we truly thank you for your material help to our church during such difficult times of the war with Russia, for your sacrifice! May God bless you generously. Not only do you pray for us, but you were one of the first to help us financially. The church in the village of Perkivtsi has been actively helping refugees since the beginning of the war, then we received your funds and this made it much easier to work with refugees. Families arrive fast, some stay for a short time, some stay for an unknown period. We use the money for its intended purpose: first of all, the necessary products, clothes and personal hygiene products were purchased. Also, thanks to your funds, beds, mattresses and bedding sets were purchased. Some families needed a washing machine, a washing machine, and a microwave oven. We could have bought it with your donations. We have a pregnant woman who needs treatment, a woman with babies. Some families will need to be transported to the border, so they used the money to buy both fuel and the necessary medicines. We also hold meetings with children in the church, where we talk about God, make handicrafts and distribute delicacies. Thanks to your funds, we are able to bake bread for displaced people not only in our village, but also in the district and region. Thank you again for your help to Ukraine !!! May God bless you abundantly

Blagodat

First of all, we express our sincere gratitude from our Church for the provided funds. At present, our Church has received a total of 32 people from eastern Ukraine. The vast majority of displaced believers who were forced to leave their homes in hot spots. Some of them have nowhere to return (Mariupol). And some have already returned (Kyiv, Irpin). With the provided funds, we hold comprehensive lunches for IDPs, provide funds to families who have accepted IDPs, buy medicine, as some are in serious physical condition. In addition, we use funds for transportation costs for the transportation of food and migrants. We also buy and deliver products and necessary items for the needs of terrorist defense in our area. (However, it is strictly forbidden to take photos there). We also work with children of migrants. As a testimony, I would like to note that very good and friendly relations have been established in our Church with the settlers. During the war we have repentance! Once again, our sincere thanks! Buzivka Church

22802444 / 62

Peace to you brothers and sisters of the national team "Samaritan's Bag"! The Buzov Church of the ECB is sincerely grateful to you for the financial support of the ministry of our church during the war. From the first day of the war, we became involved in active ministry, helping refugees and the needy in combat. Since the beginning of the war, we have received more than 1,300 refugees in Buzivka, about 300 of whom were deported from Kyiv, Irpen, Gostomel, and Bucha. Every day (except Sunday) we send several cars from Buzivka with help to different cities (Kyiv and region, Chernihiv, Sumy, Mykolaiv region, etc.). The other day I went to the Donetsk region with help. Directly at the Prayer House we organized the collection, processing and production of food (meat stews, pate, porridge. To date, processed more than 150 pigs, made and delivered to the needy more than 20,000 cans of finished products. Also on site at the church there is a help center for refugees. Photos and videos attached. We hope for further cooperation. May the Lord bless you in your ministry!

Khreshchatyk

35922794 / 63

They repeatedly refueled buses to send humanitarian aid, bought food for displaced persons, arranged premises for displaced families, sent people in transit abroad, and packed food packages. We truly thank the organization of the Samaritan Bag for providing financial assistance, may God bless you!

Öåðêâà ªâàíãåëüñüêèõ õðèñòèÿí-áàïòèñò³â ñåëà Ëàâêè

38236440 / 64

Thank you very much for your help! There are 18 IDPs living in our house of prayer. Also for 2 months in our house 7 families with children, namely 32 souls found shelter. We helped some of them go abroad and handed them over to volunteers in Germany, the Czech Republic, Slovakia and Hungary. On the territory of the charity fund where we live, there is a large room where we hold camps for orphans, children with disabilities, Roma children, etc. in the summer. In the last two months, about 150 people have lived in this building, including women, children, pensioners, people with disabilities and large families. With the money you provide, we buy food and feed all our guests, buy the necessary things for everyday life, supplies, stationery, household chemicals, hygiene products and pay for utilities (only utilities cost 30,000 UAH per month) we hold Bible classes for children twice a week, daily prayer meetings and Bible study classes. On April 2, a boy, Bohdan, was born at our base to a young family from Kyiv region. In May, we will have a wedding between young people who met under such difficult circumstances! Thank God, because He is truly Good to us and to His mercy forever !!! We feel it through you and other caring people who are ready to lend a helping hand to our Ukrainians at a difficult time for our country!

20847856 / 65

Glory to Jesus Christ! The Brody EBB Church is sincerely grateful to the Samaritan's Bag for providing assistance in the form of funds to help displaced people, who were forced to leave their homes during the war in Ukraine and need support at this difficult time. Our church provided shelter and assistance to refugees from Severodonetsk, Lysychansk, Pologi, Kramatorsk, Kyiv, Mariupol, Kherson, Oleshkiv, Zaporizhia, Dnipro, Pavlohrad, Kharkiv. Assistance was provided by: 1. Products: - 130 food kits of UAH 700 each, a total of 91,000; - potatoes 4 tons at 6 UAH / kg 24000 UAH; - flour 500 kg at UAH 13.5 / kg UAH 6,750; - sugar 500 kg at 22.5 UAH / kg 11250 UAH; These products were sent to Kharkiv and Dnipro. 2. 24 families were provided with housing. 3. Financial assistance of UAH 5,000 was provided. 4. Medicines in the amount of UAH 4,700. 5. Fuel in the amount of UAH 3,500. A total of UAH 146200 was spent on assistance. May the Lord bless you for your sacrifice! "He who gives to nothing will not know lack." Ave. 28:27.

RO "Hromada Ukrayins?koyi Tserkvy KHVYE"Svitlo Khrystove"

23654827 / 66

From the first days of the war, the Church of the Light of Christ has been accepting refugees from Donetsk, Kyiv, Zhytomyr, and Dnipropetrovsk regions. He does everything he can to help those in need. Receives people, feeds (breakfast, lunch and dinner), provides accommodation, searches and relocates long-term migrants to apartments and houses, forms and distributes food packages and clothing to low-income and refugee families, and sends aid to areas fighting where people are sitting in bomb shelters and basements. Buses carry food to them, and from there take people to the city of Kamianets-Podilskyi. We truly thank you for the funds provided by the mission, for which we were able to buy food and feed the migrants who live directly in the House of Prayer "Light of Christ", those who are taken out of the occupied territory by our buses. We meet them, feed them, witness to them about Jesus Christ and relocate them, forge food kits and distribute them to low-income and large families, and send aid to the war zone, where people sit in bomb shelters and basements. Also send food and other necessities to towns and villages that have already been liberated from the occupiers to help them. We truly thank all those involved in this charitable work. May the Lord reward you with His graces and bounties, and may His grace and blessings be multiplied to you and your family! May His protection and peace be with you. "May the Lord bless you, and may He keep you safe!" May the Lord shine upon you with his face, and may he have mercy on you. May the Lord turn his face on you, and may he give you peace! ” (Numbers 6: 24-26)

RO KHOO EXB KHMELNITSKIY

00723997/ 67

Khmelnytsky region Work with refugees in our region is in the following areas: 1. providing short-term and long-term asylum on the territory of houses of prayer and in apartments / houses of believers; 2. assistance in bringing refugees to the border for further travel abroad; 3. receiving / distributing humanitarian aid; 4. search for producers of finished products and purchase of food from them; 5. formation of food kits and their distribution to refugees; 6. organization of assistance to hot spots of Ukraine; 7. non-military assistance to the armed forces (mainly medical supplies and food); 8. providing refugees with spiritual assistance, invitations to worship, etc. Almost all churches in the region are involved in working with refugees, but 21 churches are more active. These are usually the city's churches with the largest number of refugees. Some of them provide places for long-term residence on the territory of houses of prayer, others - in the homes of believers: In the first stage of the war, refugees mostly went to the western regions and abroad. Our churches provided them with places for temporary shelter - for 1-2 days. During this time we received more than 8,000 people (7997 on 18.04.22). But later, people began to come looking for places to live for a long time. Such people usually had no food or clothing. We bring and distribute humanitarian clothing and form food kits. We try to buy products from local manufacturers and wholesale warehouses in our cities. To do this, we collect applications from churches and create a database to then make a wholesale purchase of products. We rent a bus from one of the entrepreneurs, which we use to help around the region. In the future, assistance with clothing and food will become increasingly important for migrants. Some churches have begun building small one-room buildings that will house refugees. We are looking for funds to complete the construction of a building in the village of Korystova, which can accommodate elderly people for a long time. We truly thank you for your help in such a difficult time for our country! Thanks to this, we can help those who are in great need. May God bless you and expand our cooperation with you!

lyubov i ztsilennya

21445054 / 68

We settled in our two refugee rehabilitation centers during the war, and refugees live in the homes of church members. We have refugees from Odessa, Kyiv, Chernihiv, Kharkiv, Mykolaiv, Popasna, and Melitopol. Some have gone abroad, but most still live here. We are infinitely grateful for the help, we help people with food, basic necessities (diapers, baby food, hygiene items, etc.) and also pay for electricity, firewood, etc. We also have the opportunity to preach the gospel and pray for the Jews

Thank you for your care, support and understanding. We are proud of your generosity and mercy to the Ukrainian people in this difficult time. God bless you!

24415480 / 72

Congratulations dear friends! At this difficult time for our people, for our country, our local Church has become exactly the island of security that people so desperately need. And especially those fleeing the hot spots of Kharkov, Mariupol, Kiev, Irpin, Bucha and many more! Hundreds of migrants had the opportunity to get a place to sleep, relax, eat, wash things, get medicine, clothes and take certain food kits on their way! Thanks to our sponsors we were able to buy a washing machine for our Church, it is such a necessary thing for refugees who are not one day on the road, and who are still on their way! We have fed and continue to feed hundreds of people with hot and delicious dinners that come to the door of the House of Prayer! We helped to refuel our refugees, as well as for our volunteers who worked for the Church and addressed many refugee issues. We have harvested many stacks of firewood to keep our Church warm and comfortable. We had the opportunity to provide shoes and clothes for families who came to the door of our Church with one small bag or just a package of documents (just all they managed to take, because most of them gathered in a hurry and under fire). We are sincerely grateful to our partners who so worried about us! Which share our pain, and help! Thank God for you! We are constantly in prayer for our friends. Thanks to these finances, our Church has not only been able to become a refuge for refugees, but has also been able to help us solve the hundreds of issues we had! Our House of Prayer was full of people, and we see in this a great blessing, and the Hand of God. Because it is at this time that people are especially in search of the Lord and the truth! We truly thank everyone whose heart is open to Ukraine. With love, gratitude and prayers, your friends from the Uman House of Prayer.

Church of Evangelical Baptists "Vefil'

3724041 / 76

Dear brothers and sisters, peace be upon you! Welcome to the Church "Bethel" in Vinnytsia. We are grateful to our Lord that we have seen the light of a new day. Because of the circumstances in our Ukraine, God teaches us to appreciate every day and time of the day. God teaches us to leave our homes, hug and kiss our wives, husbands, children, and come home to rejoice that all are alive and well. We have a terrible war going on in Ukraine, we feel it with our hearts, souls and lives, but with our minds, we still can't understand everything and believe in it. A war where modern weapons are used - from which it is almost impossible to hide. Mariupol, Kharkiv, Kyiv, Irpin, Bucha, Chernihiv, Mykolaiv, and Zhytomyr are bombing residential neighborhoods. There are a lot of migrants, people are leaving these cities en masse. Our house of prayer is located on the main street of the city and we receive many people who go further to western Ukraine, abroad or are looking for housing in Vinnytsia. We stay from 150 to 250 people a day. Our mission is to receive people, provide them with food and a place to rest. Sometimes some have nowhere to go, but stay for two or three days in church. Our sisters are on duty in the kitchen around the clock, cooking and baking bread themselves, because it is very expensive to buy so many people every day. Every day 6-8 brothers are on duty day and night, receiving people. We also try our best to provide temporarily displaced persons with everything they need (medicines, personal hygiene items, clothes, etc.). Due to weather conditions (cold spring), the church's heating season was not suspended. After all, immigrants are in church every day. Because of this, most of the money is allocated for utilities. Dear brothers and sisters, We have received $ 5 (five) thousand in financial assistance from you through the Samaritan Bag Mission. The funds have been used to provide for all those affected by the war. The church is engaged in the removal of affected women, children, the elderly, the organization of food and settlement of refugees with their subsequent arrangement. We truly thank you for participating in this ministry as well. May the Lord bless you all abundantly, for your sacrifice, strengthen your strength and give you back a hundredfold. May the Lord bless you and your families! Sincerely, Pastor of the Church Anatoliy Martyniuk.

And the Lord, through the brothers in Christ, gave us the contacts of Pastor Negro Valentin Berezovsky of the ECB Church. Gratitude to the church and to each individual for giving us shelter, providing us with everything we need, moreover, they gave us a place to live, where we still live. From the first days of our location, we feel ourselves in God's family, protected, thanks to pastor Valentine for his service to God. After all, the House of Prayer serves every day not only for the Believers, it feeds the city (APU, territorial defense, kindergartens, ordinary people who need it). Hot, full meals. I thank you that the full potential of material assistance from volunteers, the charitable foundation is used for its intended purpose with love for others. Praise the Lord God Jesus Christ for mercy and grace.

BO BF Development and Charity `New Life

41144287 / 82

RELIGIOUS ORGANISATION "RELIGIOUS ADMINISTRATION "DNIPROVSKA CONFERENCE OF SEVENTH - DAY ADVENTIST CHURCH IN UKRAINE".

25872250 / 83

At the beginning, I would like to sincerely thank you for the funds received, which brought great blessings and real help and support to those people who suffered as a result of the war with Russia. Our territory was originally a transshipment base, a place to spend the night for those people who went to Western Ukraine, who needed to spend the night, eat and wash, which we constantly did and continue to do. About 600 people could take advantage of this opportunity. We also helped evacuate people from dangerous areas in Chernivtsi from Bucha, Irpin, Sumy and the region, a total of about 150 people. Today we deal with those internally displaced persons who have remained in our territory and very often come to them and need basic things: pots, pans, electric stoves, electric kettles, bowls, mugs, spoons, mattresses, bedding, pillows, blanket not to mention food. They have a special need for communication, emotional and spiritual support, and we provide them whenever possible. I want to tell a little experience. Mykola Gololobov's family came to us from Mariupol, with his wife Tatiana, daughter Ulyana and mother Vertylo Ina Oleksandrivna. This family lived in Donetsk before the war. In 2014, due to the war, they were forced to leave their acquired property and move to Mariupol. But on February 24 this year, they had to become refugees for the second time. All the property they bought in 8 years was lost again. Hiding from the explosions, they spent three weeks in the basement of the house. But when their stay in the city became completely impossible, they broke through the encirclement of the enemy in their own vehicles, without green corridors, under bullets and explosions, with prayers to God, and left for the city of Dnipro. Unfortunately, it was not safe to stay there and they decided to go to Cherkasy. We provided assistance for this family in the form of funds, utility bills, clothing and food. May the Good Lord bless you abundantly for your care and help.

We express our sincere gratitude to you for the financial assistance provided to our church at this difficult time. Your financial assistance allowed us to: - Deliver humanitarian aid to the victims of hostilities, villages of Kyiv and Mykolaiv regions, to the mother's and child's home in Zhytomyr region, where a refugee reception center is organized; - Distribution of social packages (products and basic necessities) to migrants from the affected areas; - Delivery and distribution of baby diapers to IDPs, as well as adult diapers to the local hospital; - Purchase of mattresses for the refugee reception point; - Providing evacuation trains with food. We also plan to deliver humanitarian aid to Chernihiv in the near future and continue to provide assistance to displaced persons.

Christ Saviour

25797643 / 85

Our local church has the opportunity to help dormitory kitchens and other institutions that feed refugee people. Therefore, they used financial aid for food, as well as purchased fuel for trucks to send aid to hot spots in Ukraine. There were testimonies of one man who got on the evacuation bus: He did not know who the believers were, he thought that they were being taken to the organs. But when he found himself at the refugee reception site, he noticed in two or three days that the believers were friendly and kind people, which he himself told us about. This boy is an orphan, he has no relatives, so his desire to stay in Rivne, because his house in Irpin was destroyed. His first words about God were, "I don't believe He exists." But after a week of observing and communicating with believers, he began to read the Bible and testified that he already knew who Jesus was, because he had read it and understood it. This is the way the Lord speaks to man. This is our joint work. Hundreds of people fed your finances, paid for the delivery of tens of tons of fuel, dressed dozens of people who were left without clothes. Even we had and still have the opportunity to help the military. More than 100 pillows and dozens of sleeping sets were sewn. May God bless you very, very abundantly, and everything will be fine in your life!

They are provided daily with food, medical care, clothing and footwear. The prayer house has a shower, two hot water boilers, two refrigerators, three washing machines and a dryer, and microwaves. Purchased pots, pans, bowls, spoons, forks, cups and other kitchen utensils. More than 800 refugees were admitted for 1-3 nights. Food aid packages have been distributed to 405 displaced families. We bake bread, make dumplings and send to cities where there is no food.

RKP SW VOITSEHA

14176754 / 100

Our parish has 25 villages. Almost everyone has immigrants that we try to meet. Therefore, there are high transport costs. In the courtyard of our church there is a four-storey house that can accommodate more than 40 people. It is equipped with a prayer hall, a conference hall, a game room ... We try to provide people with everything they need, especially conversation, compassion, love. Your money goes to: fuel, car parts, home heating, electricity, water products, hygiene products, clothing, tools for creative activities (stationery, toys, games, movies) Thank you very much for your financial support! May God bless you all! Peace be upon us all! With prayer Vladimir.

We made food packages for the victims of the war, and also bought bread. We filled the packages with the most necessary products and things that people need in the first place. The funds were also used for the transportation of potatoes for internally displaced persons, as well as for the delivery of bread, pastries and food packages in the area affected by the war. People gratefully accepted the help, because they don't even have anything to eat. Thank God for you, because without your help we would not be able to do what has already been done. Thank you for supporting with money at such a difficult time. May God bless and protect you!
