Thank God !!! Thank you that God himself sent you to us !!! We helped the refugees but all at our own expense and here the Lord has blessed us with you !!! With your help, we have expanded our ministry to displaced people. To date, we have taken the night and fed and sent almost 300 people. We have a small church of 35 members, but we have done and are doing a really great job. Every day our sisters at the House of Prayer bake cookies to the east, make dumplings, cook stews. In the upper hall where the service takes place, we distribute clothes for the displaced. And at night we accept people who go further west. Thanks to you, we have the means to feed these people and buy products for these products. You have no idea what a blessing it is for you and how much work can be done if you have the means and desire to work. Refugees and people from our town began to come to our church to serve, because seeing what work is being done, people are surprised and say that we and the true Church of Christ are truly destined to help others. Thank the Lord for you !!! May God give you 100 times more !!!

EVANGELICAN CRISTIANS BAPTISTS

21443894 / 104

We did not think that such a reality would affect us, but one day we woke up with the news of the war… Then the aggressive policy of Russia, broken cities and villages, disadvantaged and despised residents - and a large number of migrants. This is the reality of today in our country! The sound of sirens and uncertainty about the future are the characteristics of many Ukrainians. For our part, we continue to serve in the village of Kadubivtsi. At this time, God is teaching us greater compassion and humility toward those who are called "newcomers" in Scripture. During this period, we accepted 30 families - some of them stayed, and some have already left in their direction. It was difficult to watch the families who took in, because it is food and hygiene, and their own space. The funds we received are timely support for both IDPs and host families. After all, here and: utilities, food, medicines and personal hygiene products, travel expenses. Also in our area allocated for migrants and a local kindergarten, which housed 20 families. Of course, they were given a roof over their heads, and they have to provide for themselves personally. We, from the local church, decided to support them… It was a timely "generous gift" from you, because these children, men and women were able to get help. We had the opportunity to see how people value what they already have or can get now. Volodya and Yulia's family is raising two boys, they lived in Chernihiv. Julia worked as a saleswoman in a store, and Volodya worked part-time on a construction site. When the war broke out, they hurriedly gathered everything they needed in two suitcases, looking for a safer place. Our sister Olga heard about the needs of the IDPs and decided to shelter them, where 8 people from the occupied territories already lived. Time passed and it was very difficult, we, for our part, tried to financially support this home, we saw all the migrants at our meetings. At the moment, they have nothing to return to, the store was bombed, as it is not clear with housing, and it is extremely scary to return. The second family is Sasha and Marina with their daughter. They are from Kharkiv. At one time they were well-off people: their apartment, work in the energy sector, their favorite city. They could not escape in time, but volunteers helped. We traveled for a very long time, because the curfew is in effect and we are also left with nothing… Thank you for your compassion and understanding in support of this difficult time.

Public Organization "Christian Training Center "Success"

35414627 / 105

Our organization "Christian Training Center" Success "from the first days of the war reformatted its usual activities with children to help people affected by the war, IDPs. We planned to take 10-15 people, but the first night we realized that there is There was a need for many more places, because a lot of people came, so we vacated all our classes and made 60 adult mattresses, people came to us from different cities in Central and Eastern Ukraine, many of them had to hide in cold basements without access to Our Center has not only given people the opportunity to have a warm bed, but thanks to the Samaritan Bag, we have been able to equip a shower room and allow people to wash after a long journey. they just cried because they did not expect such a "luxury". We were also able to provide people with warm food also thanks to the funds received. Thank God and the organization Bag Sa Marian for the opportunity to serve people together!

RELIHIYNA HROMADA KHRYSTYYAN SUBOTN?OHO DNYA

40080034 / 106

Our church is sincerely grateful for the money received by the Samaritan Bag. In fact, a very difficult time! We appreciate that the whole world is with us and helps as much as it can. We received many immigrants and tried to show everyone, first of all: the Christian life - and we saw that more people do not know God and his son Jesus Christ! But, thank God, many people came closer and believed in our Creator. Thanks to the help you have given us, we have been able to provide food, hygiene products and medicines to more than 100 people. Many people did not know God and first heard of our Savior Jesus Christ. Some of them began to attend our services. It is very important to support people, especially those who have lost everything. For example, one family from our church received refugees from Kyiv who moved there from Luhansk in 2014! So they lost everything - a 47-year-old woman came in what she was wearing in a bomb shelter, and that's all she has. Another family lost their house and all their property, but this will not be equal to the loss of the lives of loved ones, we have some. Also, our church joined the collection of humanitarian aid for the military from our village and provided food, it is very difficult for them, as they are now at the forefront! May God bless you and save your families! We thank you very much and glorify our Jesus Christ for you - the Samaritan Bag.

Dim Molytvy

41470155 / 107

On behalf of the whole church, I would like to sincerely thank the Bag Samaritan Mission for your sacrificial service to internally displaced persons. Our church serves these people, prepares food kits, buys essentials, arranges housing for migrants, helps with clothes. Today we have more than one hundred and sixty people, so in order to accommodate everyone we rent housing for many, because many of them do not have basic hygiene items at all, and there is no question of finances. Therefore, the funds we have received from the mission are a great blessing for these people and for our church, because for us it is also a good auxiliary tool in the work of the gospel. Today, as I write this letter, I do so with joy, because an hour ago I witnessed man's conversion to God through the social affliction of the church, and this is not an isolated case. The Samaritan Bag mission also has a great destiny in this matter. We use these funds to buy food, and to buy mattresses for the beds, there are also those to which we give money, because they were left with nothing. Among these people are twelve infants for whom we buy diapers and baby food. May our Lord bless you abundantly, we sincerely thank all the brothers and sisters who sacrificially serve us Ukrainians. And may the Lord of peace himself always give you peace in every way. The Lord be with you all! 2 Thessalonians 3:16

Talne Church of Evangelical Christian-Baptists

22800184 / 111

We want to share with you how the Lord works in people's lives, through your sacrificial hearts. As we transport people from ruined cities, we hear about many different situations that force people to leave their homes. And in some moments we take part. One of which we want to tell you. One day a woman called our pastor Roman and said that she had learned from her friend that it was possible to get to the border for free. The pastor replied that of course we would help. When we met her, we learned that her name is Elena, she has two small children, she is an orphan, because of the danger in her city she is forced to leave her home and flee to safety. Once a child, every summer a family from Germany invited her to their home, and they became a family she had never had. And so Elena decided to go to them. From the beginning, she planned to go to Poland, stay there for a few months and find volunteers to help her cross the border with Germany. Elena was in despair, because she went to a country where no one knows. The Lord already had a plan for her. We brought her to the city of Rivne and the blessing began. Through many phone calls, we found a family in Poland who was ready to shelter them with their children indefinitely. On the same day, we learned that a man was traveling to Ukraine from Poland, who also transported people only abroad. Contacting him, it turned out that he was going to the city where Elena was already waiting. The next day she called from Germany, her joy knew no bounds. She was surprised that in such a short time so many people were involved in her need. Elena thanked us and everyone who responded, but we replied that the Lord had done all this for her, and we were just an instrument in His hands. We are currently in touch with her. Thank God that He is our loving Father and Elena felt it too. Another story of how God works now at such a difficult time. One young family, consisting of two parents and seven children, was leaving Sumy with their friends. Only God saved them. On the way their car breaks down, a car full of children is cold in the yard. They called us and asked us to pick up this family just on the road, because the car is no longer working. We picked them up and took their family to the corodon the next day. Thank God for being able to serve others.

Virtually all members of the Church help those who can. Thanks to the established relations with the Churches in Romania, it is possible to receive humanitarian aid, which we bring ourselves. And in the opposite direction, refugees are transported abroad. A lot of fuel costs. The aid is distributed primarily to migrants and transit refugees who travel further west. Of course, we also help in our Church those who have not gone abroad and need clothes and food. Help is also for those we see around us, locals, who are also important to many now. Many are out of work. We partially buy on our own, food, hygiene items, different packaging and packaging. We did not forget about the animal shelter, a batch of old clothes was sent there, which was collected in the process and it is no longer suitable for people. Importantly, many migrants had to be accepted for temporary and permanent residence. It took time, opportunities, housing, and many different needs for the displaced. Dear brothers and sisters! UPC BLAGODAT of city Tysmenytsia

35300992 / 115

Grace Church in Tysmenytsya became a local haven for many refugees from eastern and central regions of Ukraine who were forced to leave their homes fleeing the war zone. Over one hundred refugees from Kharkiv, Mariupol, Chernihiv, Bucha, Kyiv have found shelter here for a couple of days on their journey west. About 45 adults and children are permanently living on the premises at present. Our church is located in the former shopping mall - the shops here became bedrooms for the refugees while the exhibition hall - a cafeteria. We are very grateful for all your donations that help us to buy all the necessities, including food, clothing, personal hygiene items, washing detergents, as well as to pay for all the utilities (electricity, water, sewer). Your support also helped to purchase a washer and a dryer, and a fridge with a freezer. May God’s blessing continue to be upon you!

BUKOVINA CONFERENCE SDA

21429552 / 127

From the first days of the war, our church opened the doors of our institutions and local communities to shelter internally displaced persons. In the first days of aggression, all people were as sacrificial as possible and brought everything they needed - food, blankets, warm clothes and even money to support our guests, but over time, people's opportunities became smaller and we had a logical question and for what resources we we have to keep a thousand people we sheltered. We are sincerely convinced that the service of the Samaritan Bag is God's answer and not just an answer but a real support during this difficult period for the church and for the whole of Ukraine. Most of the people we sheltered were at our Solomon Christian School, which has been a hub for 2,000 people since the beginning of the war. We also used our sanatorium "Bukovynska Chereshenka" where now live 150 people who have nowhere to go. The Christian sports and improving camp "Your Camp" also didn't stay aside and today about three hundred people live there, one hundred and forty of which children from boarding schools of the Nikolaev area. The road of these children to us was very dangerous and some educators were killed. We do not know how much more time these children will spend in our camp, but our church feels a great responsibility for them and tries to meet not only their physical needs but also their spiritual ones. Thank God that there are people who share Bible truths with them every day. People from many churches in the Chernivtsi region have shown their love for these children. Many thanks to God for the Samaritan Bag!

At the moment, food aid is being delivered to settlements that were previously under the occupation of Sumy and Mykolayiv regions.

Christian church "Vidrodzhennya". (Revival church Ternopil)

21165521 / 130

On February 24, our church became a refuge, food and shelter for refugees from eastern and central Ukraine. All the premises of the church - the hall for worship, children's school, prayer halls, cafe, pastoral room and computer studios have become one big hotel. Our church received up to 100 refugees a day on peak days. There were 3 main waves of refugees. Volunteers of our church met them, organized a visit, brought food, mattresses, beds and household items. A team of senior officials decided to direct all donations from people donated after utilities and other mandatory payments to support refugees, feed them, and help them find permanent housing. We now organize weekly meetings for refugees in our city on Saturdays to preach the gospel, distribute food kits, and serve them to children. We also provide free legal assistance and haircuts. Before Easter, we formed 200 food kits for migrants who live near our church.

They brought a woman from Kharkiv who had an operation and three days later she had to leave the hospital because she was bombed, we were bandaged, provided with the necessary medicines. There are many stories of people who come or live in cities. Thanks to your financial help we can take care about the people who suffered in this war! We truly thank God and you !!!

36363631 / 133

Our area, unfortunately, from February 28 until today, under occupation. The ministry of our brothers and sisters is thousands of compatriots evacuated from the occupation, constant delivery of food, medicine and everything necessary to the occupied territory. Accommodation of evacuees on the territory of Ukraine and abroad. Those brothers and sisters who remained in the occupation constantly visit all the houses in Snihurivka and the surrounding villages. They feed people, find those with whom they have lost contact, etc. For example: recently, evacuated from the village. Tamarino (our partner in the bag of the Samaritan) to Moldova, a mother and three daughters, whom she hid from the invaders by cutting "under the boy". According to her, there are half of the villages of raped women. And for the few days they were with us, my mother cried all the time. Thanks to your help, we have money for fuel, transport repairs, purchase of necessary (which we can not find from other sources). Thank you very much! May the Lord bless you! ECCLESIA CHRISTIANA EVANGELIUM VIVORUM

42739847 / 140

The Church of the Living God, registered in Donskoye, Donetsk region, expresses its gratitude to the entire Samak Samaritan team for the opportunity to serve the people during the war. Thanks to the funds we received from the Samaritan Bag, we as a church were able to evacuate 13 people from Mariupol, help dozens of people with food in the occupied village of Donskoye, as well as help migrants in Western Ukraine who left Kharkiv, Kyiv and Kyiv region and Mariupol food and assistance in purchasing medicines. The elderly, the disabled and all others, sincerely thank you for your help at this time. We do good together. In the near future we will have another report on how people are helped during the war.

The cry of a child's soul

34554105 / 141

Since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, the "Cry of the Child's Soul" NGO has been actively organizing with the help of the Armed Forces. The funds received from the "Samaritan's Bag" were a great miracle, an extraordinary blessing and support for us and an encouragement to the fighting spirit of our defenders. With the funds received, our organization was able to purchase ammunition, various medicines, including painkillers and hemostatics, and significant amounts of food. Thanks to the "Samaritan's Bag" we managed to help the 14th military brigade, which is located on the front line in Kherson. Assistance was also sent to 44 military brigades from the Ternopil region. The special unit that is currently guarding us in Izyum was not left without help. Our organization and the defenders of Ukraine are infinitely grateful to God and the Samaritan Bag for their great support. "A hungry soldier is not a soldier," said one of our defenders. So with new strength and faith in victory, boys and girls are infinitely grateful for their help.

Christ for all

23593899 / 142

Our Church is very grateful to you, the Samaritan Sacrifice Team, for the money we have been able to use to help people in need because of the war with Russia. We helped them find and rent housing, provided bed linen, and bought food. We also handed over a lot of products and various things to the military for their outfitting. The church works closely with the local military unit. Thanks to your financial support, we have the opportunity to hand over food to them every time, as well as the opportunity for transport to go to the combat zone. On the basis of our church, a logistics center has been established and organized to transport products and various medical and hygienic items to the areas affected by the bombings, as well as to the combat zones. We have specially equipped the premises, where every Sunday our church prepares dinner and invites all refugees not only to eat but to communicate with each other. Each time we give them packages of daily necessities and pray for them. Thank you for your kindness and open heart.

Preobrazhenie

25364006 / 143

Peace be with you dear brothers and sisters! We greet you with the love of the Lord Jesus Christ! We received financial assistance from you in the amount of 145,689.40 kopecks. We thank God for your location and participation in helping people and the church who suffered from the hostilities in the Lugansk region. These funds were used to evacuate people from the Luhansk region, as well as to buy food packages and medicines. The following products were purchased: flour, pasta, eggs, bread, sugar, pate, cereals, sunflower oil and much more. Medicines: antipyretics, sedatives, insulin, bandages for the military. God gives opportunities to serve people, and we were able to help 600 families with food, bring 90 people out of them 30 children, and also help bring insulin to 3 people, bring water to 20 families who were left without water in the city. 1 Thessalonians 1:2, 3 “We always give thanks to God for you all, remembering you in our prayers, remembering without ceasing your work of faith and labor of love and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ before our God and Father.” Many thanks to you all and blessings from our Lord. May God supply all your needs. With love Church of the Transfiguration. Sincerely, the minister of the church Alexander Cherneta

POMISNA TSERKVA RELIGIJNOI GROMADY GOSPEL CHRISTIAN BAPTIST Grace Church Ternopil

26198287 / 144

We truly thank Samaritan's Bag for its financial support. This provided an opportunity to assist our church in covering communal expenses to provide accommodation for refugees and temporarily displaced persons. From the very beginning of the Russian aggression, our church has provided shelter for such people. Initially, these were those who needed only accommodation, and later those who needed a long-term stay. The church provides accommodation for such people and also helps church members who receive people from the east and south in their homes. Also, we have the opportunity to help people in difficult life circumstances in our city, people with disabilities. We provide assistance in transporting people from the war zone to safe places.

We also provide assistance in transporting such categories of people in the city and beyond, including other areas.

Our central church and our subsidiary churches, in the early days of the war and to this day, are at the epicenter of hostilities, the destruction of many homes, food problems and basic necessities. Your financial assistance helped us organize the evacuation of people to Western Ukraine. Delivery of food and basic necessities for those people who for various reasons were not evacuated. As well as financial assistance for vulnerable groups. We look forward to any further assistance.

UPC of city Ivano-Frankivsk

20558640 / 147

More than 30,000 internally displaced persons are registered in Ivano-Frankivsk. Many of them have not yet started receiving social benefits. Once a week, our Church distributes food kits to needy migrants. Last week, most of the grocery set was purchased with funds received from the Samaritan's Bag. Thanks to these funds, they were able to include canned meat in the kits. 788 such sets were issued during the day. About 100 sets remain, they were released this week. There was a separate queue for families with children, it was moving fast, but still, it was time to talk to parents and invite children to the club "The Greatest Journey"

At the same time, to date, we have received 70 people who live with us permanently until the end of the war. In addition, our church has organized a service at the train station where we distribute free tea, coffee, water and sandwiches. Every day 5 - 12 evacuation trains pass through our city.

Thank you very much for the money you have received, which is so much needed now, because so many people have suffered from the Russian military action in Ukraine. This help is very important, thanks to you we have helped many people in need with food kits and medicines, because there are almost no medicines in pharmacies. Many people from Marinka, Vuhledar, Slovyansk, Kramatorsk, Pokrovsk have left their homes, we feed them, leave them for the night (if necessary) and then send some by train, others are transported to safe places where there is no fighting. Reconciliation Bible Church

44092698 / 151

First of all, thank you for your help! You are the answer to prayers! When the war broke out, we evacuated the entire church to western Ukraine. This is 63 people, including 28 children. And there we needed funds for food, clothing, medicine. Each of us lost our job, so we needed a livelihood. The second direction is evacuation. During this time, we evacuated about 1,000 people from hot spots in Ukraine. The third area is humanitarian aid. During this time, we have delivered about 100,000 tons of essential products and supplies. We have 17 partner churches that take care of 75 settlements that were under occupation or that are currently under fire. In the last two areas, the costs are spent on fuel, food for drivers, car repairs.

UKRAI'NS''KA CERKVA HRYSTYJaN VIRY JeVANGEL''S''KOI' "NADIJa"

44327582 / 152

During the war on the territory of Ukraine, our church received and continues to receive refugees from the territory of the country where active hostilities are taking place. In the house of prayer in the classrooms where Sunday school was held, we organized beds for the temporarily displaced. Every day we prepare food for them and provide for their needs (accommodation, food, clothing, transport). Since the beginning of the war, our church has received more than 180 temporarily displaced persons, and as of April 23, 2022, 30 people live on a permanent basis. Accordingly, the funds received from the Samaritan Bag are used for various needs, a lot of transportation costs, purchasing food, paying for utilities and various works related to the organization of infrastructure for the reception of people (shower equipment, laundry, heat ... and others). help you! All people living in our church are not only financially secure, but also have the opportunity to hear the Good News of Jesus Christ, and most people volunteer to attend our services. There are people who have accepted Jesus Christ as their Lord and Savior.

RO Nezalezhna Cerkva m. Cherkassy

24355280 / 153

The city of Cherkasy is located in the center of the country and since the beginning of the war many refugees have fled the war across the Dnieper River bridge. Our church serves all people in need of housing, food, medicine, and repairs to their vehicles. If people go further to the west of the country, we equip the road with a set of products, sleeping bags and medicines. If we stay in our region, we are looking for a place where families can live. One of the families from Kharkiv region in a small car with six small children less than two months old, barely reached us refueled with gasoline and solvents, wheels with broken bearings with a stroller just on the roof of the car !!! This family had their car repaired, refueled with gasoline, fed and warmed children, found a house in the village of our region, helped with food. Over the last Sunday, many refugees remain in our region and in our city of Cherkasy alone about eight thousand people. Every day we make grocery kits for them, if we need clothes and bedding we also help people. More than two thousand people received help. Thank you very much to the National Leadership Team of the Christmas Child Project of Ukraine for the provided funds and we are sure that the Lord will reward you for your sacrificial work in the Name of the Lord !!! God's blessing at this difficult time !!! Yours faithfully, Pastor of the Church Pavlo Shepel.

Zorya Ghitya Nova Ushytsia:

43660514 / 154

During the war, the NGO "Help the Child", Church "Dawn of Life" Nova Ushytsya: 1. Provided up to 300 sets of humanitarian aid to the families of IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons), which include: food, personal care products, detergents, detergents, clothes, bedding, blankets, prams, diapers, baby food, medicine, etc. 2. Sunday school children make leaflets to the soldiers once a week. 3. Teenagers weave bases on camouflage nets. 4. Not a one-time purchase of body armor and unloading, to the front, to men from the families we deal with. 5. Transportation of people evacuated from hot spots: Zaporizhia, Kyiv; to their place of temporary residence. 6. Delivery of humanitarian goods to the Front. 7. Delivery of humanitarian goods from other cities to our humanitarian aid center, for further provision to the families of the Internally Displaced.

THE RELIGIOUS COMMUNITY OF THE ADVENTIST CHURCH ON THE SEVENTH DAY OF M.KOLOMIYA

23923090 / 159

From the first days of the war, members of our church have already met migrants and, to the best of their ability, took people into temporary care. Today, the Kolomyia Church takes care of 46 settlers, providing them with shelter and food. The Samaritan's bag helped us to do the work we could not do. At the request of people from Kyiv and Chernihiv regions, when they were released with the funds provided by the Opportunity Charitable Foundation, we formed 300 product kits with basic products, one of which is enough for one person for one month. 50 food kits were left for people who are temporarily in Kolomyia, 100 kits were sent to the village of Nemishayevo, Kyiv region, which was under occupation, and 150 were sent to Chernihiv. Bucha, Irpen and Gostomel received the most attention in this tragedy and in the first days of liberation they were given a lot of help from all concerned people, but such villages as Nemishayevo and others were ignored, so on the advice of local people we helped them . People knowing that we would arrive in advance were waiting for us, when they received help they were very surprised by the generosity of the sets because last time they received help for 300 grams of cereal per family. We can talk a lot about people's emotions, but today everyone who is engaged in the service of charity is familiar with them. Many thanks to God for the Samaritan Bag!

Baptist church Shatava "Forever hope"

25961798 / 162

Our church is very grateful for the help and we want to share the blessings that God has made through it. Since the beginning of the war, 9 families have received assistance and continue to receive it. Some stayed with us only for a while, while others live here temporarily. Families were resettled in the homes of church members. There were quite different needs - from boilers to diapers. Also for one family rented an apartment and pay for it. Another brother from the church was called up for military service and there was a need for medicine and hygiene, and he received everything on time. Families also received financial assistance, which we had and were forced to go abroad. For unbelieving families, this was a great testimony of God's love for them, and for believers, another testimony that God is near and cares for his own. Thank you again for the opportunity to serve others. May the Lord bless!

Cerkva HVE m Pochaiv

24630020 / 163

The funds we received under this project we used to purchase food, hygiene products and refuel booms with which we delivered humanitarian aid to the war zone and the export of refugees on the way back and deliver them to safe places, including abroad. We deliver aid to Kharkiv, Sumy, Trostyanets, Bucha, Irpin, Borodyanka, Kyiv, Volnovakha and many other towns and villages and distribute food kits together with Gospels and brochures and celebrate the hope of Christ Jesus. Bread of Life

38480315 / 164

We, the Christian Church "Bread of Life" in Ternopil, in connection with the situation that has occurred in our country have taken an active position to respond in all possible ways to the needs of our society. Beginning in 2014, when the first phase of military aggravation took place in Ukraine, we began our ministry for refugees and displaced persons who were forced to leave their homes in the east of the country and move to Ternopil. Then we were able to reach families with school-age children to help them with the necessary school equipment, and finally, to provide these families with food and hygiene packages for several months. Since the beginning of the full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine, we have realized that our city is becoming one of the epicenters for the shelter of people fleeing war zones leaving their homes. Therefore, we decided to focus on the following areas of activity: providing temporary assistance in the form of food and accommodation for those refugees who are in transit through our city and stay here for only a few days; provide long-term assistance to those who stay in our city for a long time. To do this, we purchase food and hygiene, and on the basis of our church, twice a week we organize meetings to distribute food kits. Each time, these meetings are attended by 70 to 120 people. We also send much of the food directly to the war zone to help people who have not been able to leave. The next of our projects is to provide psychological assistance to children and their parents. To this end, on the basis of our church, we organize weekly meetings attended by children and their mothers, and here our qualified ministers help them rehabilitate from stress and psychological trauma. Since one of the constant directions of our church's service was to serve the socially vulnerable category of the people of our city, today we continue to keep this group of Ternopil residents in focus and provide them with the necessary assistance. As a church, we express our sincere gratitude to the Samaritan Bag Mission for its financial assistance to reach more people and for its practical expression of compassion and mercy.

Pyat Hlibiv

41389976 / 165

Since the beginning of hostilities on the territory of Ukraine, our public organization "Five Breads" has been actively involved in volunteer activities (reception of migrants for overnight stays and long stays, transportation of migrants to the border, help with productive packages for low-income families, trips to eastern Ukraine with food packages , military assistance and baking for the Armed Forces). Each area of volunteering requires a lot of effort and money, and financial assistance from the Samaritan Bag helps in this, namely in covering utilities, cooking lunches, arranging rooms with minimal conditions, repairing and refueling cars for trips to Kharkiv region (there were about ten) . We are sincerely grateful to God for the Samaritan Bag project. God bless.

Persha Tserkva Zhyvoho Boha m.Mukachevo

13596879 / 166

They were able to accept more than 100 migrants, provide accommodation and food. They also prepared 300 food kits for those who fled the war and turned to the Church for help. Along with the food, the settlers received spiritual prayer advice and New Testaments.

Öåðêâà ªÕÁ ñ. Êðóïåöü. Äóáåíñüêèé ð-í, Ð³âíåíñüêà îáë.

40121007 / 167

Thank God brothers and sisters! We turn to you with sincere gratitude for the prayerful and financial support of our ministry. From the first days of the full-scale invasion, our church has come to the aid of the temporarily displaced. With your support, we have been able to organize accommodation for the temporarily displaced in the basement of the House of Prayer. They brought mattresses, organized a shower room and cooking appliances, and bought food and medicine. The Kyiv-Chop route runs through our village. Therefore, from the very first days of the war, when people were evacuated to the West and to the border, we provided places to spend the night. Some left a few days later and other people arrived. In total, about 50 people passed through our church from February to April. Where some of them were helped by transport. We especially remember the young woman who was taken out of the place of hostilities with the child she gave birth to in the basement and stayed there with her under fire for 17 days. We took her to relatives in another area. Currently, the House of Prayer is home to 20 people who have been evacuated from the scene. Some of them have completely lost their homes. The House of Prayer became their second home, we bought food, fuel, and electricity for them. In addition, we help people with internally displaced people living in our village. Dear brothers and sisters! We pray for peace in Ukraine. Pray also for our church that God will give strength and wisdom in the service of the temporarily displaced. Pray for our people who live in the House of Prayer, they all need to meet Christ. Our brothers spend a Bible hour with them.

May the Lord bless you and meet your every need. We ask you to pray for Ukraine, not for peace to come soon, because every day it is getting more and more difficult with medicines and food and fuel at gas stations. We believe that the Lord will not leave us!

Buy medicines for 15 migrants, two of whom have cancer. 3. Purchase food and basic necessities and support families who received people in our area (25 houses in the area and the pastor's home in Vynohradiv were open to displaced persons and received more than 350 people during this time)! And many people continue to live with us… 4. "Samson-winner" and other organizations and volunteers who also accept migrants… 5. Help our Armed Forces through the NGO "Transcarpathian Military Movement" also addressed to specific soldiers and brigades on the front line! There is still a lot of work to be done, but with God's help and good partners, we believe that everything will be fine! And good will surely win! Thank God !!!

Many families started attending our meetings. Our sisters prepare dinners for those who come to us. There is a team of people who are always on duty at the church to help the needy. There are many different stories of how God brought people out of difficult situations, and even because of all those circumstances, they saw that God was with them. Cherkva EXB s. Velika Berezna

34826141 / 177

The church provided funds to the Samaritan Bag to help displaced people from the occupied and devastated territories due to the war that began on February 24 in Ukraine. One part of the funds was used for people living in houses and apartments provided for them by the village council or people who settled in the houses of their relatives or acquaintances. More than three hundred such people came to the village, and the church was able to help more than two hundred people in providing food, clothing and footwear to make life and existence in our area a little easier. The second part of the funds was used to provide living conditions for people who were left without anything and could not rent or receive housing from the authorities. The House of Prayer has living rooms, showers and bathrooms, and people have the opportunity to live according to their needs. Some live a week, some two and people live permanently. So three meals a day, personal hygiene products and utilities (electricity, defects and heating) are the items of expenditure of the second part of the funds. I also want to share some testimonies of people who were able to receive help through the Church: Young family Volodya and Natasha, they have two children, a boy of 6 years and a girl of 4 years Milan. They are refugees from the village of Borodyanka, Kyiv region, when they beat Borodyanka, they ran to the basement, which was unbearably cold and lived there for some time, when they started bombing heavily, most people fled on foot and by car. When we saw even more shelling, we took the children in our arms and started running through the streets, and here we were picked up by a car, and so the Lord himself, so to speak, took us out of Borodyanka from the shelling. Arriving in our area, they settled in the House of Prayer and from the first day of their residence began to attend prayer meetings. And later, having settled down, they joined the work of the church in helping other people and directly on the land plot on the territory of the church. (Photo 1) A family from Gostomel, Kyiv region When they fired on Kyiv, they immediately ran to the basement, and when they started bombing the village of Gostomel, they had their own car, managed to take the documents and set off. Five more cars were following them, but when we left for safety, we saw that only one car was left behind, the other cars could not get out from the shelling of tanks, which mercilessly and brutally shot civilians. Having found shelter in the village, the family is grateful to God that the survivors of all those who evacuated, I was with them. (Photo 2) Grateful child for food (photo 3) Living in difficult resettlement conditions (photo 4) Cooking (photo 5)

Hrystianska Misiya Vefil, Novograd

13569983 / 178

Sincere thanks to all who support our country in this difficult time! You truly are the light of Christ! God's love is practically manifested through you! Thank you very much for that! Thanks to God, our city is in trouble. But our church could not stand aside from the plight of others. That's why we received refugees, prepared stew, porridge, baked cakes and sent it all to the place where the humanitarian catastrophe took place: in the churches of Chernihiv, Zaporizhia and Zhytomyr regions. My brothers and sisters and I also went to Borodyanka, Bucha, Irpin, and Zagaltsi to prepare food and feed people who had not seen hot food for weeks because they lacked gas, electricity, water, and heating. The brothers helped people, at least with oilcloth, to break the broken windows to keep warm and get rid of drafts in the house or apartment. We really want to serve the needy, but many of our church members have lost their jobs and their money, so we can only serve with time and work. We can do much more with you! Because to prepare porridge or stew you need money, which we do not have enough. Therefore, we truly thank you for your service! Your finances are very appropriate! People who had not seen bread or hot soup for weeks were able to quench their hunger. We also delivered food bags and necessary hygiene items to places where it is not possible to buy them. May God reward you a hundredfold for your service, open heart and sacrifice! People with tears in their eyes shared their pain and thanked for the support, for remembering them! This is very valuable today! We wish you peace, prosperity and abundant blessings of God! Your help is tangible, valuable and important! We pray for you! Bless you! Thank you very much! You can upload only 5 photos, we also have a video. If necessary, contact.

Vidnovlennya Skyniyi

Peace to you! Dear friends, the Church "Restoration of the Tabernacle" sincerely thanks you for your help during the war. Thanks to your kind heart, many people in Nikolaev, Odessa, Chernivtsi received food packages and medicines. In every city, from 20 to 50 people a day thanked the Lord for you and your families. May the Lord richly bless you and reward you according to the riches of His Glory in all spheres of life. The Church "Restoration of the Tabernacle" thanks the Mission "Good Samaritan" and are ready for further cooperation in this difficult time. Thank God! Victory for Ukraine!

RO RG KhVE “SPASINNIA” (Pentecostal Salvation Church)

26323829 / 180

On behalf of all members of the church and parishioners, the RG HWE "SALVATION" expresses its deep gratitude to you for supporting us in such difficult times. Thanks to your support, we can continue to sow the Word of God and support hundreds of people, migrants, children, and families in crisis with food. We also serve people with disabilities in providing medical care. Children left without parental care have the full range of assistance, including food, accommodation, clothing. Displaced migrants can find asylum in our social center, which has the opportunity to exist thanks to your support. Special thanks from the father of a single person with disabilities. He is raising his 11-year-old daughter himself. My father lost one leg and the gangrene spread to the other leg just before the war. Several surgeries were performed. A skin graft operation has now been performed. It is already being corrected. The daughter is provided with full support for the period of the father's treatment. The church prepares daily dinners for children from crisis families and families in difficult family circumstances. Also, children receive dry rations daily (10-15 children). We pray for you and thank you sincerely for such a generous, timely, and significant blessing! May the Lord bless you !! May there be peace in your hearts and on your earth !! We appreciate your help and every person who is saved and every donated penny is important to us !! ????????????

RO “ Cherkva EXB m. Polonne”

22779998 / 184

Thank you for the funds provided to our church. This has helped us to better serve the needy and displaced. The funds were spent on immigrants fleeing the war, as they left the temporarily occupied territories or cities that became the scene of active hostilities. Cities and towns of such people were bombed by rockets fired at with cannons. Therefore, the funds received were used for: purchase of food, purchase of necessary medicines. Bed linen for IDPs was also purchased. A humanitarian aid point was set up on the territory of the House of Prayer. In this way, many warm clothes were distributed to people in need, as well as personal hygiene products. About 500 people were able to get temporary shelter in our city and with the help of the church received these things. Hundreds of kilograms of cereals, vegetables, oil and bread were distributed. The rest of the funds were directed to the provision of comfortable living conditions for people that the local church accepted for living in the House of Prayer: equipped beds, showers with hot water, rooms for washing personal belongings. The displaced persons were provided with warmth in the living rooms, delicious three meals a day: breakfast, lunch, dinner. Part of the money was also spent on people to whom the state provided accommodation but did not provide food. So we took care of the food for these people, and provided food for the church and for them as well. Immigrant families who had children were provided with the necessary baby items: diapers, baby food and even toys. Food for the people in the House of Prayer (photo 1) Help for displaced families (photo 2,3,4) Overnight in the House of Prayer (photo 5)

New life

23597584 / 185

Residents of the village of Cherkasskoye, Slavyansky district, convey their deep, heartfelt gratitude to the people who collected and handed over food packages. It is especially difficult to live in the villages now - there is no work, social payments are delayed, the villagers are not pampered with humanitarian aid. And if in the cities people leave the war faster and more decisively, then in the villages people cannot simply abandon their households. Therefore, many become hostages of the most difficult and dangerous situation. - We are so grateful to you, unfamiliar kind people who helped us at such a time! We see with what love and sympathy these precious products were collected and delivered! God bless you for this! Elena Korobkova, the mother of a large family, expressed her general opinion.

Tserkva Bozha

26083265 / 186

We all together, the whole church, express our gratitude for the help we have received, it is a great help for us and we believe that the Lord works through you, thanks to Him. At the church meeting they decided how to manage the money wiser and found out that there is already a shortage of fuel briquettes, in our village there is an organization that sells briquettes, our brother works there and he said that before the war there was a small supply briquettes. Therefore, it was decided to buy briquettes for the church, namely for people who do not have the opportunity to get their own firewood or other fuel, looking in advance. These are the elderly; those with physical disabilities or health problems. Most of the money was spent on this need. A smaller part of the funds was spent on the sale of products for the church and their delivery, namely: various cereals, flour, sugar, flour, vegetables, oil. An even smaller part was left for the need of evacuation for the people. Thank you very much, thank God, for giving the workers, may the Lord bless you a hundredfold.

Kiverrtsivska Bibliyna Tcerkva

43842808 / 187

Peace be upon you! Thank you very much for your service! The money we receive is a great blessing from God. Thanks to this, we were able to help more than 30 people who are refugees from the war from different regions of Ukraine. Two people from our Church went to Germany to serve with a group of people with disabilities of 20 people and we blessed them with money for the trip. Refugees from the east we serve also came to our city Kivertsi. Today it is 17 people whom we help. The first was a family from Sumy - a wife and two sons. They were under fire for ten days and were very scared, they didn't know where they were going. They are believers. The Lord foresaw that our apartment was vacated and they now live there and we as a church help them with everything they need to live thanks to your money. A little later, this family was joined by another young family who also live in this apartment. We also serve them. God also brought to our city a family from Kharkiv, 4 adults and an eight-month-old baby. Their homes were bombed by the Russian occupiers. They were able to escape very quickly. And thanks to your donations, we provide them with everything you need. Another family (a woman and her daughter) live in the house of our church members. They were evacuated from Slavyansk. They are not believers, but they gladly attend our meetings, we pray for their conversion to the Lord. We also made them festive food sets for the Easter table. People thank you very much for your support and sacrificial hearts. We thank God for you and pray that the Lord will bless your sacrificial service. With prayer Pastor Serhiy.

We are very grateful to the Lord and the Samaritan Bag for the funds transferred to our church with which we are able to do many good deeds that have helped many people know the Lord as their Savior. One of them is a family of seven. 22 long days (one woman was injured in the shoulder, another with a concussion) 6 hours they walked to the place where they could pick up cars while driving through the Russian-occupied territory volunteers advised them to pray and they did not know how it was then the man advised the woman to just fold her arms to hand and bow their heads in 5 days they were able to get to our city where we had the opportunity to serve these people with their homes and finances from the Samaritan Bag financed treatment (people had injuries, pneumonia, concussions) provided the most necessary things and most importantly had the opportunity tell of the Lord Savior of Whom they knew almost nothing before Now having lost all home all they rejoice in their possessions that they have found the most important treasure of the Lord Christ. Also through our city is the main railway line on which evacuation trains with refugees moved, people were scared hungry, we had the opportunity and funds to give these people food, medicine and baby food. We also served orphans who lost their parents during the fighting.

Time of salvation (Chas Spasinna)

25770029 / 193

Thanks to the financial support of the Bagar Samaritan ICF, the Church of the Salvation Church in Cherkasy was able to organize and carry out evacuations from cities and regions of Pryluky, Kharkiv, Zaporizhia, Kryvyi Rih, Nikopol, Myrhorod, and Mykolayiv. Thanks to material support, we were able to purchase precious fuel. On the way, during the evacuation, which sometimes took several days, we had the opportunity to provide people with hot meals, warm clothes, accommodation in hotels or local churches. Always in communication with people, they knew from whom help (Samaritan's Bag) and that Christians from all over the world are raising funds to support Ukrainians during the war. About 130 people were evacuated to Truskavets, Lviv, and Cherkasy from places where others refused, and our faith in God and confidence in security was felt by the people. The people were very surprised that they were being helped without asking for anything in return, but to love the Lord our God with all their heart, and with all their soul, and with all their strength! The story of Levchenko's family Ilona, Olga and Victor from Mykolayiv. They were evacuated to Cherkasy on March 24. All the while, the family hoped that their grief would pass and the rockets would not fly into their house. but unfortunately on March 21 the bomb hit the Ingul Hotel and their house nearby was damaged. And thank God, thanks to the good relations between the Church of the Salvation and Jewish organizations in Ukraine, these people turned to the Jewish community for help and the Jewish community asked for our help. Thanks to good coordination, we were able to gather people in different cities these people were brought to Cherkasy. Since all the brothers and sisters have already shared housing with the refugees, they had to rent housing for these people at the expense of the Samaritan's Bag project. Also with the funds of the Samaritan's Bag project, we have the opportunity to bring the Gospel to refugees in need. Since the beginning of the funds, we have purchased and distributed more than 350 product kits. the price of one product set ranges from 280 to 300 UAH

It was here that they felt God's love and support, receiving: hygiene products, medical care and delicious food in the dining room.

Dwelling of God

34030038 / 196

Since the beginning of the full-scale offensive on Ukraine, our church has been actively involved in the ministry for refugees. We receive people every day. During the bombings of Kharkiv, Chernihiv, and Kyiv region, huge flows of about 150 people a day began in our church alone. We provide people with free accommodation in the church, food and clothing. We also deliver them if necessary and try to provide medical and moral assistance. The biggest expense is providing heat to people's living quarters, as well as feeding such a large number of people. One of the brightest stories of refugees about a family from Chernihiv region. The husband and wife, their daughter and two grandchildren were under occupation. Russian soldiers broke into their house and began to live there. They took their food and things. The man was interrogated several times and even shot in the head. Taking advantage of the moment, the family fled without anything, money or other means of subsistence. Miraculously, they got to our church. We gave them shelter. They gave the necessary clothes. Provided with food. Later, they were able to return to the territory already cleared of occupiers. We thank the Samaritan Bag for helping to carry out the great work of helping the Ukrainian people in difficulty.

Among the refugees are people with disabilities who need constant help. Thank the Lord and all who care for help and pray for peace and an end to the war.

Yevanhel?s?ki Khrystyyany-Baptysty s. Lalovo "Dim Yevanheliyi"

41187802 / 199

First of all, we thank you for your financial support. It is gratifying that together with you we can serve the needy. Ever since the war in Ukraine began, my family and my church and I have been accepting immigrants. In total, our church received 45 immigrants who have been living in our homes for a long time. Thanks to financial support, we were able to improve the places of residence of migrants, buy heaters, food, pay for utilities. We also went for four weeks to a children's boarding school for children who had been relocated from Dnipro. About 70 children heard the Word of God almost every day, where we distributed Samaritan Bags, conducted Bible lessons, needlework, sports, and music. We are glad that the children really wanted to have the New Testament, when we gave it to them, many people started reading and asking a lot of questions. During this period, six children repented in the boarding school. We plan to continue to visit these children, but once a week. It was also a great blessing for us that last year we distributed 200 Samaritan Bag gifts during the camp, and now, in the spring, up to 100 children came to a meeting that we arranged for them in nature.

"BLAHOVISHCHENNYA" M. KREMENETS (shkola m. Kremenets)

25350014 / 200

We thank the Lord that during this difficult time of trial, you have been able to support about 45 refugees who have settled in our city and to cover transportation costs, food, medicine and hygiene. Among the photos… Sasha is 15 years old - he lived in Bucha and said that at the time when Russian troops came to the city, as his relatives were military, he was also interested in this case and he enlisted in the defense, while there he witnessed terrible things, and over time, the volunteers who surrounded him were killed and taken prisoner. After holding him for several days and taking the phone he had with him, he was released, and he and his mother went to Kremenets to the house where his grandmother, who died this fall, lived. Sasha said that he is recovering well in Kremenets… he is currently studying at a local school and plans to live in Kremenets. Last week they returned to pick up things and there they dug up and destroyed the whole apartment and the occupiers hung a mine on the window… Thank God they saw.

41291669 / 202

One of the days when aid was distributed to refugees. Among dozens of people handed a package of food to two young women and their mother prayed for them, asked for God's protection and comfort for them, they thanked and left the church. About 10 minutes later I go out to the churchyard and see these women sitting right in the middle of the street in a circle and crying, I approached and asked them what had happened, and they answered me through tears - "Our homes in Kharkov are being destroyed by Russians, and you to us give food for free thank you ”I translated the glory to God and tried to support them. He came to the funeral of the husband of a sister from our church, he was killed by racists when a column of their horde entered Voznesensk, he wanted to preach in the cemetery, but crying over the coffin he barely said not to bear unforgiveness in his heart. criminals. They moved the family closer, helped financially and spiritually, now they help at the church to prepare hot dinners for the needy. Stopping the car in the yard of high-rise buildings, I answer the message on the phone, I see an acquaintance of the boy loading his things into the bus, got out of the car to say hello, and he says he arrived for a few days, and today again goes to the post 50 km from the city. I prayed for him, brought him canned food, groceries, asked him to take a picture and wrote when he got there. He sends me a photo the next day, where they found a family with children and gave them some of their products, and wrote to me - "we also help" Thank God that we have such a military. The church now feeds 40-50 people daily. On Sunday at lunch my father meets a grandfather who came to eat and tells me - I ate for the last time the day before yesterday and today I came to eat again because you have very tasty, and my father asks - why don't you come every day? The old man answers - it's a shame… Holy God, why do Ukrainians have such a shy holiday. The woman left Nikolaev as the child. She came to the church to receive food aid together with Darynka, who prayed for them one year after the distribution of food kits, and she then asked me as a priest if I could baptize a child. home. On Sunday, this woman brought her child for blessing and, being an unbeliever, asked me to pray for her Gift. for the period 24.04 the church feeds 40-50 people daily. Approximately once in 10 days organizes the distribution of food kits for migrants and children with many children. We take out people from Nikolaev. They placed several refugee families in their homes. Finances go to fuel, food, medicine. transport service.

Pomisna tserkva KHVYE m.Kremenets

24629984 / 204

Church of Evangelical Christians - Baptists “Meeting with the Lord”

22785415 / 205

Thank God we are a small church of 35 members where there are several couples of young people - for two months now we have been accepting refugees. If from the beginning of the war people were traveling in transit - they stayed only for 1-2 nights, now people who have nowhere to run have arrived and found shelter in our church. Now we are helping 44 displaced people. We feed them 3 times a day, they have the opportunity to wash themselves. In our church in Yarmolintsy we continue to conduct a children's ministry. Refugee children, our children and a little from our village come to the meetings. Fewer children came from Yarmolynets themselves, since it is impossible for children alone to walk the streets, only with their parents. In addition to the 8 rooms that were in the prayer house, we equipped 2 more rooms for refugees during the war. The second last room that could be converted for human habitation we did last week. We made repairs there, made beds, made the window open. It remains to find mattresses here and we are ready to receive people. A group of people is already asking us from the Kharkiv region. We continue to serve people in need with food, diapers, chemicals. We received a request to help people in the village. Zinkov. This is a group of refugees from the Donetsk region. They live in a rural school and needed elementary school. What we were able to share materially, and presented the New Testament, called them to turn to the Lord. At the end of the conversation, they prayed for them. We are gradually building relationships with people who now live in the house of prayer. Almost everyone regularly attends our morning and evening meetings, begins to read the Bible on their own, and prays. Thank God and many thanks to our partners for helping our church... May the Lord bless everyone.

We helped a family from Kharkiv financially so that they and their friends could buy fuel to evacuate their city. We buy the things they need and food for the displaced people who live near our church and around our church ... We also had the opportunity to help other displaced people who live farther away from us and were in great need of food and other important things and medicines. With these funds, our church has prepared food and hygiene kits for the families of church members and friends, because in such a difficult time for our country, these benefits are necessary and important for every family. Our church plans to continue to support the families of immigrants and church members, as well as those in need. We thank Sumka Samaritan for his very important support, both in prayer and in money. We really appreciate your support. Thank God for all of you.

"Blahovisnyk Prykarpattya" Evangelist of Prykarpattya

We live in the tourist town of Yaremche. Since the beginning of hostilities in Ukraine, thousands of people have come to us, because there are so many different recreation centers and hotels. The city authorities organized the reception of refugees in two secondary schools, and many people received migrants for free. The funds you have allocated have helped us a lot in serving these people. We were able to buy small appliances and some medical devices, bought the necessary medicines, which were not available in many pharmacies in our city, bought shoes and necessary food, some utensils. Part of the money went to fuel for the car during the purchase of necessities and assistance in resettlement. People are sincerely grateful for your help. We tell everyone that we are only postmen and that only God is the sender of all this. We are sincerely grateful and personally for the trust and help shown in serving people.

Evangelical Baptist Church Simer village

38699749 / 208

From the first days of the war in our country, the small church in the village of Simer began to accept people who were forced to leave their homes due to bombing and shelling. There were families who stayed for a few days and, if possible, went abroad. But there were and there are families that remain with us to this day. Most siblings adopted two or three families with children. A sincere thank you to the Samaritan Bag for the funds, which have been a great support and blessing to many refugees. After all, food, hygiene products and medicines were necessary for living. Transportation of people for medical examinations, sometimes long-term treatment for two weeks, all of which required costs that the refugees did not have. Some have already fled the house when it was completely destroyed and they have only the documents and things they left with. People are grateful for the warmth, for the opportunity to sleep even on a mattress, but in silence, for food and medicine - they thank the Lord and you who have shown Christian love and care for the needy. God bless you, dear Samaritan Bag team!

We also buy pork and stews. and pates, and various smoked meats and lard for people in places where there is war. We also cooked a lot of dumplings for people who are starving. eat and spend the night.

And we understand that in order to feed so many people 3 times a day, we need finances, to send each person abroad, we need finances to buy (who of the migrants needs medicine) it takes money and the money from the Samaritan's Bag helped us a LOT in this, thank you God bless you.

POMISNA TSERKVA YEVANHEL?S?KYKH KHRYSTYYAN-BAPTYSTIV VIFLEYEM

23835184 / 211

Since the beginning of the war, the Church of Bethlehem has provided various assistance: - human settlements - humanitarian aid for migrants (food, clothing, hygiene products and medicines) - humanitarian aid to the cities most affected by the war - evacuation of people from hot spots - spiritual support - children center At the church, volunteers meet and settle people who come from dangerous places in Ukraine. Church members also respond to help and receive whole families in their homes. It is said that there are almost no empty houses left in the city, and some have several families. Some stop for a while and go on to other Ukrainian cities or abroad. However, many families remain in Dunaivtsi.

Gromadska organizacija Misto nadii

43838262 / 212

One family from Kharkiv was helped to evacuate to a safe area and later travel abroad. They lived on the 12th floor. When the shelling began, they were sitting in a shelter. One day they decided to go up to their apartment and take the children's clothes. 20 minutes after leaving home, their apartment was destroyed. When we said goodbye to them at the border, they said, "We don't know where we're going, but we have nowhere to go." We also gave the children Samaritan packages that were left at that time. It was fun and support during this difficult time. Lunches are being prepared for temporarily settled people. About 450 people per thousand children were taken to the Ustyluh border, 2 evacuation flights were made from Kyiv, 2 flights from Sumy region, and from Chernihiv region. In Volyn, about 100 people found refuge in the homes of church members. They are provided with periodic assistance in the most necessary things. There is constant assistance to low-income people. We deliver hygiene products and products to the evacuation sites.

Victory Christian Church of Full Gospel in Cherkasy

38646257 / 213

Thanks to the partners for their help. From the very beginning of the war, our church has created conditions for the reception of refugees from places that have come under fire. Thanks to your support, we were able to expand the activities of assistance, namely: The church has 27 beds. 4-room, 3-room and 1-room apartments, 3 houses were rented and people were temporarily accommodated in the housing of church ministers. To do this, the property was equipped with everything necessary for living: refrigerator, washing machine, heaters, electric stoves, mattresses, boilers, bed linen, blankets, pillows. We pay utility bills for rented property and provided premises. In the period from 24.02 to 24.04 received about 250 people, of which 60 people are permanent residents. They also provided people with food and medicine. About 300 people bought and handed over food kits to pensioners, socially vulnerable people, families who lost their jobs and migrants who applied. Funds were allocated for fuel to evacuate people from Mariupol. Three bunk beds have been transferred to equip the apartment of the Armed Forces. This allowed people to show the love of Christ and to preach the gospel. After the liberation of the city of Chernihiv, we support the ministers who bring there the necessary things. Unfortunately, the war continues and people do not stop going. We find housing and provide people with permanent residence. For many, it is a problem to adapt and find a job. Also, your finances help us complete the construction of housing that will serve the people. Our joint efforts have enabled the church not only to maintain all ministries and ministers, but also to increase them. So on a regular basis we continue to help local needy people. Reintegration centers for men and women operate. Evangelistic, youth, missionary services are held. Thank you again for your support, may the Lord sincerely bless you.

Relihiina hromada yevanhelskykh khrystyian baptystiv sela Pavlovo

35102600 / 214

thank God for the opportunity to work with the Samaritan Bag for many years. And in this difficult time for our country, your support is felt more than ever. We have been able to provide both physical and financial assistance to many IDPs from the war zone. And we continue to work in this direction. This is assistance and resettlement in different homes, this is the provision of medical advice to various specialists as needed, providing the necessary things and personal hygiene products, assistance in leaving for temporary residence for the crown. We really need your help and we appreciate it. We also ask for prayerful support so that God may give us the wisdom and vision of the immediate needs of those who turn to us for help. Thank you again for your sacrificial support. May the Lord bless and strengthen you in this ministry and expand the boundaries of your ministry.

Hrysta Spasytelya

36896708 / 215

Our church is involved in volunteer work, during which we preach the Word of God. During the war, we sheltered about 250 people, provided long-term housing to 10 families, and we help all needy migrants with food, clothing, household chemicals, appliances, etc.

ILNYTSIA SEVENTH-DAY ADVENTIST CHURCH

26100555 / 216

As soon as the war broke out in Ukraine, we as a church began to help the affected and displaced. We relocated our school at the church to a refugee reception center. In school classrooms we bought mattresses, bed linen and settled migrants. Among the refugees we have, we have many young children and adults. The eldest grandfather is 92 years old. The youngest boy is 1 week old, he was born here. There are families with disabilities. In total, we have more than 100 people in affluent churches. Since the church premises do not allow us to accept all these people, in parallel with the church we look for houses for them and settle there, continuing to take care of them. One we help with medicine, another with food and a place to live, and the other we help to go abroad. We prayed that God would help us financially because the work we started was difficult for us. We saw that it was difficult for my 92-year-old grandfather to lie on the mattress on the floor. Similarly, it is difficult for a mother with a breastfed baby to constantly lean on the mattress to feed the baby. We started thinking about beds and other necessities for living conditions. And God answered us right away through the Samaritan Bag project. When we were praying, I got a call from your project wanting to help with finances. Tears in my eyes and words of gratitude to our great God for the immediate response. The next day I told this experience to the migrants who live here and said that there would be help. A washing machine, a vacuum cleaner, system clothes hangers, a refrigerator and an electric stove were purchased for the living conditions. Also sleeping beds. That is, with your help we have made living conditions comfortable. In our center we provide three meals a day, a shower and a place to sleep. We worry about utility costs to be good. For the second month, the church has been providing shelter to people who have lost their homes or have war-torn homes. Living here, they have peace and tranquility in their hearts. We continue to work, this work does not stop because life goes on and food, warmth and comfort are needed every day. Also helping materially, we share the Word of God with people by giving them Bibles and other spiritual literature. Most migrants have psychological trauma from what they saw and experienced during the fighting, so they need a word of hope from a loving God. We continue to work and believe that a good God will help us. We do everything possible and depend on us to serve God and people in this difficult time for our country. We truly thank you for that great love and care for us and our country. May the good God bless you. As soon as the war broke out in Ukraine, we as a church began to help the affected and displaced. We relocated our school at the church to a refugee reception center. In school classrooms we bought mattresses, bed linen and settled migrants. Among the refugees we have, we have many young children and adults. The eldest grandfather is 92 years old. The youngest boy is 1 week old, he was born here. There are families with disabilities. Since the church premises do not allow us to accept all these people, in parallel with the church we look for houses for them and settle there, continuing to take care of them. We saw that it was difficult for my 92-year-old grandfather to lie on the mattress on the floor. Tears in my eyes and words of gratitude to our great God for the immediate response. The next day I told this experience to the migrants who live here and said that there would be help. A washing machine, a vacuum cleaner, a system of clothes hangers, a refrigerator and an electric stove were purchased for the living conditions. Also sleeping beds. «Dzherelo zyttia» misto Nadvirna

26055292 / 217

Thank you for your help! Our church is helping refugees with food at this difficult time. We have created social packages that have food for approximately 1 month. Sometimes people stop and spend the night right in the House of Prayer. Some are dedicated to living in our families. Also, they tried to work with displaced children. Circles and a small program were organized for them. The funds from the Samaritan's Bag also served well in this case! Parents were delighted, because children often feel lonely in a strange city without friends, without home and certainty. And there was an opportunity to communicate and have fun. We take care of people not only in our city, but also in the surrounding villages, because they come from different places.

„Charity fund „Hope for a new life“

44030872 / 218

First of all, we would like to thank the Samaritan Bag for such support. That through these funds, we can serve and care for our brothers and sisters. And to help IDPs, that's 50 people. In this way we testify to them of our Lord and His mercy. May the Lord bless all of us who serve, give us wisdom and strength. Peace to all of us.
