Hromads?ka orhanizatsiya "Blahodiynyy tsentr "Dovira"

42494219 / 219

Christ is Risen! We apologize for not writing about our affairs for so long. The days go by so fast that we didn't even notice that a month had passed since the day we received the money. Let's briefly describe what is happening here now. It is the 60th day of the war. New people come to our community every day. If earlier most of them had families who traveled by car, now they are people who are evacuated through green corridors. These are often single mothers, elderly people and people with disabilities. To the best of our ability, we accept accommodation and temporary accommodation for all who need it. Thanks to your support, we can provide people with food, warmth and daily necessities. Thank you very much! Our Mother and Child Home "Good Mother" today has 24 people, including 16 internally displaced persons who came from the area where the fighting is taking place. 8 people are single mothers with children who do not have a permanent place of residence. We try to keep them all. In total, we have already fed, warmed and supported 71 people. Our youngest resident who settled in "Good Mother" was only 2 months old, and the oldest - 94 years old. Everyone has their own story, their own experiences. Among the people who live here are those who have already completely lost their home. They have nowhere to return, their house (apartment) was blown to pieces by missiles fired by the enemy. We communicate a lot with local authorities. Every day we exchange information with the center that registers refugees. We have the opportunity to help people not only with food and housing, but also with humanitarian aid that we receive from friends from Germany and the Netherlands. These are clothes, shoes, children's toys, rehabilitation aids. Many people come sick and exhausted, because they have been in the basement for a long time, where it is cold, damp and unsanitary. Your funds have also been used to pay for medical services for internally displaced persons. If you are interested in the following letter, we can describe some stories of people who came to us about their lives during the war. Two weeks ago, we started a new project - the construction of housing for people left homeless. This is an expensive project, so we have long hesitated whether we will be able to implement everything. Thanks to the Lord and friends who support our activities, we decided to start the reconstruction of our old house. If you are interested in learning more about construction, we will be happy to describe everything. Sorry for the big text, but I want to tell you everything. Our people are experiencing so much pain now. It is not easy to find the right words for those people who have said goodbye to their relatives forever… But we are strong and believe that everything will end soon. Thank you very much for your understanding and support. We appreciate your friendship with you! We would like to take this opportunity to sincerely congratulate you on the bright holiday of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ!

Tserkva Khutory EKHB

22803484 / 220

Hearts are overflowing with gratitude for the support of the church in these difficult times. This is God's grace, because we have been able to continue to serve the poor, the needy, the soldiers, and those in need. Thanks to these finances, they were able to complete the renovation of the room in order to receive refugees. While they are gone, we hold a Sunday school there. We pay for the operation to a girl who is being raised by her mother and is in a difficult situation. This is a great testimony for them! My mother said that when they were taken to the hospital she was afraid and panicked, because there was no money for treatment. When she learned that the church wanted to help financially, her eyes filled with tears. She is now very eager to hear the gospel. We pray and believe that after the treatment we will continue to work with them. The church is infinitely grateful for the help !!! Thank you for not stopping our ministry! May the Lord give thanks 100 times!

Doroga do spasinnja

23653727 / 221

Using funds from the Samaritan Bag: 1) we serve at the railway station: we help refugees, distribute free tea and feed the needy, as well as settle in recreation rooms and deliver food and water packages to evacuation train cars, water is especially important for passengers of such trains. , but food is also very important, because there were cases when people who got to safe places in Ukraine for 2-4 days did not eat anything); 2) for many refugees the place to spend the night is their own homes of members of our church (sometimes we have to receive seven "guests" at a time); 3) once a week (every Wednesday) we feed people who find themselves in difficult life circumstances. First we feed them spiritual food (short sermon, prayer, psalm for guitar or accordion, and only then we distribute delicious porridge and tea). Because of this ministry, one man decided to change his life and was sent to a rehabilitation center, where funds were also transferred for his maintenance. 4) from time to time we go around fasting, testify about Jesus and distribute sweets.

Dobray Vest

23112463 / 222

We would like to express our deep gratitude to the "Samaritan's Bag" mission for charitable assistance at a difficult time for our country, and especially for our native Kramatorsk. Your finances supported our city in a difficult time, when all production in the city stopped and people were left without salaries. Your finances helped us to buy food, we collected food packages and distributed socially low categories of people in our city, these were pensioners, the disabled, low-income and large families. We also purchased food and personal hygiene products for the evacuation center in our city. Hundreds of people daily passed through this center from Donetsk, Kharkiv and Lugansk regions. To this day, in our house of prayer, twice a week we hold hot charity dinners for all those in need. Passes about 60 people. Also, part of the funds was spent on gasoline for the evacuation of people. We continue to work on the fields of God. Receive Greetings and Blessings from the Good News Church

The war continues and the geography of the people is constantly changing and now people are fleeing new cities occupied and destroyed by Russia. We try to create the most comfortable conditions, to testify to God's love, to distribute the Gospel. We are grateful to you for your help to the Ukrainian people at this terrible time.

Vifleem

23563906 / 230

Dear service partners, we truly thank you for the support and help of our people in such a sad and anxious time, a time of war. Thank you to the Lord and to you for not shedding tears and supporting people, both in prayer and in deed. Unfortunately, the area where our church is located is dangerous, it has come under shelling and bombing. But despite the circumstances, the children of God continue to serve not in word but in deed. Because the building of our House of Prayer is in a dangerous place, we are not able to accommodate the displaced, but we are helping as much as we can. A group of sisters from our church gathers and prepares food for the settlers, namely, making dumplings, baking pies, etc. They were able to help families who came from Kyiv region with clothes and food kits. Many migrants live in the villages around our city. The family of Victor and Irina and their three children came from Gostomel, the poor escaped, leaving home and all things, came without clothes, food. They felt the horror of the war when a group of armed Chechen soldiers came to their home. The Lord showed His mercy to them, according to Irina, their neighbors were shot, and God saved their lives. We provided them with clothes, food and everything they needed. One day after the service, a family from Bucha came to the church, they had to leave their city, two women with a little boy and an old grandfather, found shelter in our city, needed clothes, we gave it to them. Also in the neighboring village of Demkivtsi lived families from Bucha who needed food, the Lord helped us meet their needs and testify to them of His love. One of our setters lives near a military facility, after its bombing, her home became uninhabitable, she is a widow and has no one to help her. When the explosions were heard, the windows were broken, the door was damaged, and now we are restoring her house. We truly thank you, dear partners, for your support and participation in the needs of our people, thank God that we are able to represent it. God's blessing, support and inspiration!

Congratulations! They need help and thanks to you, we can do it. UKRAINIAN CHURCH OF THE EVANGELICAL CHRISTIANS OF STARY LYSETS

42636784 / 235

From the first day of the war to us in the church with. 2 from Slavyansk, 4 from Kharkiv, 3 from Kyiv, 3 from Makarov and a little later 6 from Kherson came to Staryi Lis, they live with us for 56 days. Also 57 people from war hotspots came to our village in the kindergarten, up to 300 migrants live in our OTG, 71 disabled people came to our hospital from the basements of Mariupol, Severodonetsk, Kramatorsk, also near the village of Pidlissia there in the school 30 refugees from east, up to 50 refugees were brought to the village of Bystritsa with their children, they live in a children's camp, and more than 70 refugees were brought to the village of Prybyliv. We bring food to all these villages (bread, cereals, flour, sugar, milk, butter, cookies, potatoes, oil, curls, canning, hygiene products, diapers, everything people need). We also make grocery packages for the family and deliver them to the families, or hand out prayers in the house who can come. We make dumplings, rolls, cakes in the church with the sisters and women of the village and send them to Bucha, Kyiv, Sumy, Kharkiv, for soldiers and people in need. We also work with children in families, in homes with refugees, the poor, orphans, the disabled, we conduct lessons of the greatest journey. We thank the Samak Samaritan Mission for providing financial assistance, where we can help with food, preach the gospel, and provide shelter to people who have lost their homes, loved ones, and more during the war. We continue to serve and will continue to serve people in the Name of Jesus Christ, to whom all Glory and Honor belong. We are ready to continue cooperating with you. God bless you.

Tserkva EHB m. Mohyleva-Podil?s?koho

37022454 / 238

In our city (Mohyliv-Podilskyi) there was one of the few existing customs for crossing the border with Moldova, so through our city there was a large flow of people who saw abroad. We were able to help many of them by having our church members receive them in their homes by giving them food and lodging. One evening I received 16 refugees from the town of Chasiv Yar, Donetsk region, in my 3-room apartment (photo 1), and my wife and I had to sleep on the kitchen floor. So our church was able to accept about 1,000 people. Some of the refugees stayed in our city for a long time, so we were able to help more, we provided them with food, necessities (clothes, bedding, hygiene products), in some cases reimbursed the cost of utilities. We were able to provide special assistance to the foster family, Ivan and People, who moved to us with their nineteen foster children (photo 2). In total, we helped about 300 refugees who remained to live in our area. We also noted that many of the IDPs needed medical care and we ran a medical clinic for them at the church. For this purpose, highly qualified doctors came to us from the city of Vinnytsia - cardiologist, therapist, vertebrologist, in addition, there were specialists who performed ultrasound examinations and ECG. The refugees received good advice, and according to them we bought them the necessary medicine (photo 3,4). Also, in addition to serving in our city, we were able to help 20 small churches in villages within a radius of 70 km around our city, providing them with products and things to serve refugees (photo 5 - Brother Alexander on a homemade tractor takes help to his village).

We are also trying to fully provide the people living in the church with food. We also help with food and clothing of other migrants from our village, and sometimes other villages.

Thanks to financial support from the Samaritan Bag, more than 100 people have been able to be accommodated and accommodated so far, internally displaced persons are provided with food in the families where they live, financially supported and cared for. RO RG UCKHVE Pomisna Tserkva Spasinnya

21333622 / 246

Thank God, the Christmas Child Project team is blessed! We received financial support from you in difficult times for our country and the Lord gave us the opportunity to spend these funds to serve people who found themselves in difficult circumstances, left without a home, food, medicine ... On the basis of our church were prepared 70 beds and conditions for hygiene for people who needed a roof over their heads for one or two nights, food and spiritual support. There are families who have been living with us for more than a month because they have nowhere to go ... During the war, our church provided shelter to 1,800 people and continues to work in this direction. We also began serving people who remained in broken cities and towns. Having purchased products (more than 6 thousand kg) and medicines, we make food kits and take them to people who are in dire need of it. Such food kits were delivered to Kyiv, Konotop, Chernihiv, Berezanka and the village of Kyivka in the Chernihiv region. The people there have experienced hostilities on their own, it is difficult to look them in the eye, because their gaze is so full of pain and despair. Too many houses have been destroyed to the ground, not a single house has survived. These people have no food and no place to buy it. But these people testify to how they cried out to God during tank battles near their homes, during rocket fire, and the Lord saved their lives. When they receive the bread, they kiss it with tears in their eyes and thank them sincerely. We would like to sincerely thank you for your support and direct participation in this ministry. After all, by sacrificing for these people, we together touch their hearts and bring them not only physical bread, but also spiritual bread, testifying to them about the love of Christ in action! May the Lord bless everyone who took part in this !!!

We truly thank you for your finances. With these funds, large families and low-income people of our church are provided. In addition, ready-made food was purchased for shipment to the combat zone. We hope for further cooperation.

Tserkva EXB s. Stara Pisochna

Congratulations, blessed brothers and sisters, partners in our ministry. Thanks to the help you received, the Church of Stara Pisochna was able to bless many IDPs in our and neighboring villages. The Yahovkin family, having moved to the village of Kupin, needed hot water and a washing machine, we helped them to solve these needs and thanks to that we established good friendly relations. In the village of Stara Pisochna, in early March, a family of Telichens from Bucha settled near the House of Prayer, we helped them find a house, bought a refrigerator, and also provided two food kits. In the village of Stara Guta, in cooperation with the mayor, we visited 8 families from Mariupol, Chernihiv, Dergachi, and blessed them with food kits for each family, and one of these days we plan to help these families buy a washing machine.

ÓÖÕÂª "Ñïàñ³ííÿ",

43507490 / 250

We are a small church in the west of Ukraine (42 people) and when more than 100 refugees came to us at the beginning of the war, it was quite difficult for us to accept everyone, accommodate and help. Your financial support was very timely and necessary for us! Thank you, dear brothers and sisters, for your financial help. With these funds we were able to help refugees pay for apartment rent, composting, treatment and food. We received not only believers, many non-believers, thanks to this ministry, dedicated their lives to Jesus! So may the Lord bless you abundantly for your ministry!

Zhittya viroyu

20103920 / 251

For two months we received people from different parts of Ukraine, where the fighting took place. These were people from Bucha, Kharkiv and cities of Donetsk region. Thanks to the Samaritan's Bag, we were able to help them, namely to buy them everything they need for life: food, bedding, hygiene products, things necessary for rehabilitation (walkers, etc.). We also helped large families in our church. We also have a sister who is expecting a son and a husband from the war, so thanks to the Samaritan's Bag, we were able to support her during this difficult time. Also, thanks to the Samaritan's Bag, we helped people who were unemployed at the time and were under fire all the time!

The GCB Church “Grace”of Svalava

33266093 / 252

Never before in my life have I felt such unity of people in achieving one goal - achieving peace in Ukraine !!! Residents of peaceful Ukraine were caught in a terrible disaster. People had to leave everything and flee to save their children, elderly parents. God has strengthened us in a beautiful place where so far we can only hear the sound of sirens, but not the sound of bombs. Therefore, it is our duty to help those who have left everything and left their homes. The Lord has given us the House of Prayer, where we have been able to receive many immigrants. Some stayed for a few days, others stayed in the House of Prayer for another month. Everyone who lives is provided with three meals a day, baby food, hygiene items and necessities. We are also helping the soldiers of Svalyava region, who are going to the front line, to protect our native Ukraine with food kits !!! Thank you sincerely, dear brothers and sisters, for helping us to share our grief not only in prayer but also in a tangible way! May the Lord bless you abundantly for your sincerity and compassion. Only together we will win !!!

With the funds we received, we were able to help many internally displaced persons. Purchased fuel to transport food, hygiene products, beds, bedding, clothes, shoes. We bought food and medicine for the hostel, which we made on the territory of the former village council. Funds were sent for the treatment of a girl with cancer. We truly thank the Lord and the entire Samaritan Bags team for the opportunity to help those in need. May the Lord bless you abundantly.

“Jittya“ Vinnitsa (Agronomichne)

41875779 / 254

Thanks to the funds received in the church, we were able to equip a "laundry" room, where migrants can wash and dry their clothes, provide homeless people with proper hygiene. The church also regularly receives immigrants, feeds them free of charge and provides overnight stays for several nights. The church also has a kitchen, where volunteers make their own preparations and, if necessary, give food to those in need. Part of the funds was also used for the purchase and transfer of food to regions where the situation is extremely difficult. The Church has been a testimony of God's love to many who did not know God before or feared believers as sectarians. One day, volunteers took 4 elderly people from Mariupol to church, but people panicked because they were afraid that they had been driven into a sect and that they would do something with them. The women needed to be reassured, but the church was able to show God's love so much that the settlers themselves left notes of thanksgiving that they were received with such love and warmth in this church. Every time people spread contacts on social networks and provide links to the church, where they can help. The church also helps Ukrainians who are not immigrants, but lost their solvency due to the war. This is how a young woman with two children approached us, she does not have enough money for baby food and the church is constantly trying to buy baby milk and diapers. Recently, a young family from Kharkiv appeared in the church, they rent housing in Vinnytsia, but there were no funds for pillows, blankets and bed linen. The church was able to provide for this family. Many immigrant families are now joining the church, who, seeing their love for themselves, also want to serve others.

Bobrik, village Zavorichi, Makarov who came to us at the beginning of the war. As well as in the purchase of clothing, children's adolescent and adult, for the needs of people displaced by assistance with funds, payment for gas and electricity. Baby food, diapers for displaced children. Participated in the purchase of products at the Armed Forces. Help in our village for the needy (low-income families) We bought food for territorial defense. God bless you! May the Lord bless you for your sincere heart.

We also used these funds to buy food, shoes, send a parcel to a soldier of the Armed Forces (from our church, for example, a very important thing - a powerful mobile battery charger, for which this man is VERY grateful), as well as fuel and transportation costs. Thanks again! God bless you.

Vistka Miru

22780041 / 269

From February 27 to the present day, Vistka Miru Church receives on a permanent basis 70 IDPs from the eastern, northern and southern regions of Ukraine, 25 of them on the territory of the church, 45 are housed in the families of church members. We also provide support to those migrants who are in transit to Western Europe and live with us for 1-2 days. We work with local authorities to support IDPs living in our community. People living in the church and in the families of church members have a full meal at the expense of the church, we provide food aid to refugees living in the community. It costs about $ 5 a day (including utilities) to keep one settler in the church and in the families of church members. Our church Vistka Miru cannot allocate such funds on its own, so we are grateful to all the benefactors who support us. Your contribution is very valuable to us and we truly thank you for your help!

Baptist Church "VEFIL"

34560460 / 276

During the war, the Bethel Church in the Khmelnytsky region faced a number of challenges and, at the same time, opportunities in witnessing to the Gospel. Thank you very much for your financial assistance, which has helped to serve different categories of people and different forms of evangelism. Since the beginning of the war and until now, our city has been receiving people from hot spots (currently 3,200 people are registered in Slavuta), some of whom live in the dormitory of the technical lyceum. We have repeatedly provided food, hygiene, clothing and footwear that could not be purchased by ourselves. 120 people live in the dormitory around the clock. One day when we came, we heard an incredible noise. As it turned out, this is how the old washing machine worked, because the other one broke. People evacuating from hotspots were horrified by these sounds every time. So we decided to buy a washing machine and bless the people who live there. People were very grateful. It was just being installed, and the queue for washing was already being sought. Thank God for this opportunity to show God's love in action. We also hold meetings with children and youth of internally displaced persons both in the lyceum dormitory and in the church premises (some children began to take the course "The Greatest Journey" and received notebooks). We thank the Lord for building a relationship with them and for the opportunity to preach the gospel. Holding various evangelistic meetings for immigrants, a number of funds are spent on delicacies. Also looking at the pain and tears of these people, we tried to make pleasant surprises for them, for example, congratulations on their birthdays and made them a little holiday. It's sad to hear their stories. After all, many young people come from families in difficult life circumstances, and some from boarding schools. That is why they are so in need of God's healing. Searching for housing and resettlement, purchasing medicines, transporting humanitarian aid for IDPs and the local hospital, SJO families, as well as for people living in Kyiv region, serving IDPs through a social hub - all this became part of the life of the local church "Bethel ». We also continued to serve as a church for SJO families and families of boarding school graduates in our city and district. Every time we wonder how the Lord works in the village of Berezdov (where the children used to take the course "The Greatest Journey"), because at the Bible study meeting, the number of people and children increases every time. We no longer fit in the house of one of the families, and we pray for the room. During the two months since the beginning of the war, food packages have been repeatedly provided to those who come to these meetings and other humanitarian aid. You would see the reaction of the children at the inn (some people take candy home from the table for the father who abuses alcohol, but the children love it and sing Christian songs at home). We believe that the Lord changes and heals the hearts of everyone who comes. We rejoice when we hear that adults and children are asking for Bibles for them, and they are trying to change their lives. The Lord gives the opportunity through the Samaritan Bag to serve hundreds of people and to proclaim the Good News. On Easter holidays, we hold thematic meetings through various forms of evangelism: - visiting families of Sjo, migrants with food packages and sweet rolls (Easter cakes). One of the testimonies. When we arrived at the SJO family, which has 4 children, the father was drunk. We blessed them with a food package, sweets and the little one immediately grabbed these treats. In a dirty hut, a frowning baby, but smiling from the fact that she received sweets and Easter bread. And we were glad that we could pray together with parents and children and give a little holiday to this family; - youth meetings, where there are migrants, boarding school graduates, young people from the city and young people from crisis families; - general church meetings attended by immigrants, to whom we helped and preached the Word of God (young people have already joined in glorifying the Lord by singing); - watching a movie and communicating at a festive table with internally displaced persons, etc. And all this is possible thanks to you, dear brothers and sisters! Thank you very much! We have a few more ministry projects that will also be funded by the Samaritan Bag. Therefore, we truly thank you for the resource that serves to expand God's kingdom on earth.

religious organization religious community SDA church in the village of Dobryanske

38029047 / 277

Thanks to funds from the Samaritan's Bag, our community was able to support the victims of the war. Members of our community sheltered about 20 families (50 people) at home. Most of them will stay here for a long time, because their homes have been destroyed and cities have been mined. All IDPs receive food kits and basic necessities from the community. Our region is far from fighting, so people have the opportunity to relax physically and emotionally, as well as to be reborn spiritually, as most of the migrants attend services for the first time. Thanks to help from the Samaritan's Bag, we were able to purchase a refrigerator and a washing machine to provide shelter for the settlers right in the house of prayer. Later, we will be able to accommodate at least 6 families in the church. Also, thanks to the Samaritan's Bag, we were able to pay for our volunteers, who repeatedly took humanitarian aid to hot spots in our country and took people out. Since the war is not over, we still have work plans. We truly thank you for your generous assistance to our community during the war. This is a tangible help. May the Lord bless every person who has donated to this project and give you a peaceful sky

GO center Natxnennia

40657839 / 278

On behalf of the staff of the Center for Inspiration (Shepetivka, Khmelnytsky region), we express our sincere gratitude for the generous financial assistance provided during the martial law in the country. The war has radically changed the direction of our ministry, but we still manage to keep our slogan - LOVE, PRAY, HELP! We praise God that we embody these verbs together with you! Thanks to your financial donation, we were able to invest it to help displaced people, as well as local families with many children, those in difficult circumstances, and low-income families in rural areas. Currently, the Inspiration Center is home to 46 people (including children) who receive 3 meals a day, as well as the possibility of hot water, washing machine, cozy and warm rooms. This ministry is costly, but we see God's faithfulness and your love in action. We could also buy ingredients and bake 100 Easter cakes with the settlers and visit the families of the settlers and local low-income families before the resurrection of Christ, congratulating them - share the Good News and invite them to the service! There was so much happiness and tears of joy in their eyes, kissing a homemade bun in their hands, thank you! Part of the funds was invested in the repair of the bead, namely - the replacement of 4 injectors. This car served a lot in hot spots, where it delivered food and various humanitarian aid, and on the way back evacuated people (mostly women with children). The Lord also gives us to continue working in the countryside with those families to whom we have preached the Word of God before. People are now even more open, and they ask for the Bible themselves, constantly come to Scripture meetings, and invite their loved ones. Thanks to you, we were able to purchase food packages and bless them at such a difficult time today. We continue to love these people, pray for them and help everyone we can with one desire - to show them Christ and bring them to Christ! For the glorification of His Holy Name!

The Church is currently working on arranging living rooms and showers so that the Church can provide housing for the needy.

They were able to resume the children's ministry and three times a week the children can come to church and have a fresh and hot lunch. Elderly people also had the opportunity to receive food packages as well as medicines. These funds were also used for transportation costs. Since in the village where for some time there were no products and medicines, and local transport did not work, so you need to help with the purchase and delivery of it. We truly thank you for the care and blessings that enable others to feel God's care and support in these difficult times of trial. Blessings to you !!!

RO "TERNOPIL?S?KE OBLASNE OB'YEDNANNYA (ONC Shumsk) Êîä 14032038

14032038 / 284

Thank you sincerely for providing an opportunity to support people in need, people who are in difficult life circumstances. We have helped many families of IDPs who have taken refuge in Shumsk. We were able to cover the costs of transportation, food, medicine and personal hygiene products. In those conditions, people try to somehow create comfort and living conditions. Every story is impressive. I think a book of dramatic stories will be written someday. Many people who received help with tears in their eyes thanked. They did not expect such a display of kindness and warmth. Most of the families where we were helping at this time, men either returned to the outskirts of Kiev to dismantle the destruction of their own homes, or went to work to provide for their families. One story was particularly striking. We arrived at a house in the suburbs of Shumsk where three families of refugees from Irpin lived. They showed photos of destroyed houses. It hurts to watch when people just entered a new home and only the surviving aquarium remained, everything else burned out (I'll add it in poor quality because I took a photo from their phone). There were also many single older women who did not know how to live. Will they have enough pensions, for life, or their whole house? They do not know how their houses survived or survived. Together we became for them the hands of the dope, the hands of Christ. In such a difficult time, the church must serve the people by doing good. "Luke 10:27 And he answered and said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind, and thy neighbor as thyself." Thank God for you! Together we have become collaborators for the service of the Ukrainian people!

Get to know his love and care through believers. Let these funds serve those who need them now. And all the glory will be to the Lord. May the Lord bless us all, give us wisdom, how best to do everything, give us patience. May there be peace !!!!

Tserkva Adventystiv S'omoho Dnya,Kamenetz-Podolsky

34114821 / 286

We truly thank you for your financial assistance during this difficult time for our country. Thanks to your help, we have been able to help many people in their most pressing problems and needs. • Provided shelter to migrants, in the first month of the war provided accommodation in the church, food, showers for up to 50 people, as well as shelter in houses and apartments; • From the second month, when the flow of refugees decreased, food kits were distributed, delicious dinners for the displaced were prepared in the church, including at the request of the city administration from the city of Kharkiv up to 50 people; • Provided financial and physical assistance to our brothers in the base of the camp "YourCamp" (Chernivtsi region) - for the reception of orphans from Mykolayiv. They bought gifts for children, toys, donated furniture, conducted a Christian program, helped with the sorting of humanitarian goods; • To meet the needs of migrants bought a washing machine, hair dryer, iron, kitchen appliances, utensils and more; • We provide the opportunity to wash clothes and take a shower, choose clothes and much more that people need. • Conducted a "Vacation School" with children of migrants, church friends and church members; • We prepare the planned programs in the city, and work on the improvement of the youth club, children's classes, and the church in general in accordance with the decisions of the church council in coordination with the Podolsk conference of the church ASD. • And most importantly, had the opportunity to pray with people and tell that Christ is Love. We continue to serve our neighbors in this way. May the Lord bless you abundantly. Thank you very much. Pastor of the Church Kropyvnytskyi Stepan Ivanovych, Presbyter Safonov Vitaliy Eduardovych Link to video reports: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3pKvCu85p0 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UXfmA5UEDl0 https: // studio .youtube.com/video/mDhB_38aKdU/edit

Church in Bezpechna

Blahodiynyy fond "Rankova Zirka"

26397383 / 288

My name is Tamara. We left Kherson. They were forced to leave everything, the apartment and the apartment, which is 20 years old, was arranged. Because that's how they occupied our city. Explosions, constant automatic queues follow us. We did not go out for two weeks to make cakes for ourselves, bread, the child was without milk, without anything. It was so scary, because our house is prefabricated. And here even nearby somewhere something explodes. In the apartment, in a room couldn't sleep on a bed because we were afraid, the panel house, and all of us there will kill. We lived in a corridor. At first they did not go to the store, but then they were forced to leave. In the shops there are few products, everything is expensive, sugar 150 hryvnias, pasta 400 grams 150 hryvnias. People started coming to the bazaar from the districts, then they went for milk and potatoes, but there were racists around. We go to the market and they are between us. Wrongly looked up, warning. We went to rallies, we all went. That's where our guys got on the armored personnel carrier, shouted "Kherson is Ukraine", "home", "Guys, you don't need to be here". They weren't afraid of them at once, but when their black uniform, like riot police, came to us, they started shooting at us. They started throwing checkers, after that they became afraid and didn't come. People began to leave, almost 40% at that time left the city. Because it is impossible for them to climb, steal, threaten. Here comes directly to the entrance, go to the roof carrying some things, boxes. Our guys, who can go down, scratched the roofs. We went through the lists, looking for who was in the anti-terrorist operation. Daily automatic queues in the morning, afternoon and evening. In our yard, a car was fired upon, and a civilian boy was killed nearby. We have near Chornobaivka, the airport. Constant explosions. The little granddaughter did not walk outside, nowhere. For the sake of grandchildren decided to leave, contacted volunteers and took us, Thank God. We passed 12 Russian posts. We are elderly, few people are interested, and young people were undressed, looking for tattoos, it was scary. We finally managed to leave. We are currently in Uzhhorod, grateful to the Morning Star Charitable Foundation for accepting us, providing us with food, housing, medicine and helping everyone in need. I am glad that we can all be together with our family. My name is Anastasia, we lived in Donetsk region, Druzhkivka. On February 24, our lives changed dramatically, at half past four in the morning a fragmentation rocket flew at us and passed through metal and wood. Waking up from the tremor of the house, not understanding what was happening, half a minute later the rocket fell, from the explosion and fright, the children went down to the basement with children in not understanding the scream, undressing only in shorts, now not summer but frost on the street. The only thing that saved us was that we had a car, we left home that day and the ordeal of fate began here. We left the city for 70 kilometers, we were given a house, but there was no basement or shelter. The explosions hit very close, scratched the windows, rockets flew over the house, begged God to pass us. So we lived for over a month. We decided to evacuate. I feared for the lives of my children. We arrived in Uzhgorod. We were received by the Morning Star Charitable Foundation. The head of the foundation gave us housing where we now live and provides us with food, medicine and everything we need. I am grateful to God, the Morning Star Foundation for help.

Evangelical Baptist Church "NEW LIFE"

43604706 / 289

From the very beginning of the war, on February 24, our NEW LIFE Church and my family began to host people whom everyone later began to call "IDPs." For the first two weeks of each day we received 5 to 15 people at home, there were a lot of small children. Mostly, they were our friends and acquaintances from other cities: Kyiv, Kharkiv, Zaporizhia, Mariupol. Then their friends and acquaintances came to us, with whom we were not acquainted, but the Lord introduced us in this way. In total, more than 80 people passed through our church during these four weeks of these sad events. We stopped not only in our house, but also in the houses of our church members. Even some of my neighbors - my unbelieving neighbor Oleg, a 50-year-old man - open their homes to such people. In addition to transit travelers, we also try to help those people who came to our neighborhood Kropyvnytskyi and settled here for a while, from other major cities in Ukraine - who are fleeing the war, but still unable to go further. Yes, the other day we met a young woman - Valentina. Valentina (mother, 30 years old) and her two children - daughter Veronica (10 years old) and son Vladislav (7 months old) were forced to leave their hometown due to heavy shelling. Valentina's family from Chernihiv and this city is now in a very difficult situation: constant rocket fire on buildings. The young woman says that the school and kindergarten in their area have already been destroyed, as well as some houses, no water and heating, and almost no grocery stores. Valentina left with the children, and her husband stayed at home to look after their apartment. At the moment, it is very difficult to leave such cities, because there is shelling all the time and there are no green corridors. We have to go on field roads. With God's help, they got to Kropyvnytskyi and settled here with Olga's wives (according to the state program to support IDPs). Our church, maintaining good relations with the municipal authorities, learned about this family and visited them the other day. We gave them food, children's toys, stationery, hygiene items, Christian literature. Our daughter Marina talked a little with Valentina and her daughter Veronica. We ask you to pray for such families, of which there are hundreds of thousands in Ukraine today. With all our hearts we, the Evangelical Church "NEW LIFE" New city Kropyvnytskyi, Kirovohrad region, we express our sincere gratitude to all those who supported us prayerfully and financially in this difficult time for all of Ukraine. We pray to the Lord God to bless everyone with His Peace and Grace! We pray that through this care and help of our people, the Merciful God Jesus Christ will be revealed to people so that they may seek and find Him as their Personal Savior and Lord. Glory and Gratitude to him for everything! Sincerely, Serhiy Teslenko, Pastor of the New Life Church

Oselya blagodati

25668549 / 290

Greetings! Every morning, we invite about 60 unbelievers to church. For an hour, we speak the Word of God with them, pray, distribute food packages. We cover about 350 people per week. On average, one food package, per person, per week. A list of recipients is maintained. As a pastor, I note that physical (grocery) help makes spiritual changes in people. Of those who started going to church after the war, more than 200 prayed for the first time. More than 50 people repented. Preparing for baptism, 12 people. God through the temporal, makes the eternal! May the Lord richly bless you and your families and reward you for the help you have given to our church and made this service possible!

We also helped with food kits, diapers, clothes for families with children, as well as orphans who were temporarily in our city.

«Blahovishchennya» m.Kremenets, (smt Verba Internat)

25350014 / 292

We truly thank you that together with the church we can help more than 60 refugees who are left in need, and people who are in difficult life circumstances in the region of the village of Verba. We are able to cover transportation costs, and provide food, medicine, personal hygiene products and office supplies. Many people who received help with tears in their eyes thanked. They did not expect such a display of kindness and warmth. People try to adapt to rural conditions, but somehow create comfort and living conditions.

Shayan EHB

35007455 / 293

Thank God and you for your financial support, which helped to complete the premises where people who were forced to leave their homes due to the war with Russia now live.

Podilska Conference SDA Church in Ukraine

13331514 / 294

Our church is located in the city of Vinnytsia and we can say that it is the central part of the country. It is about 350 km from Kyiv, and the main road to the west, to the border, passes through Vinnytsia. Therefore, literally from the first day of the war, as soon as we recovered and realized that we were less safe, but could help others, we volunteered. The church has a large room, a spacious dining room, rooms for children and a small hotel for 30 people. such conditions made it possible to receive up to 150 people for a temporary stay every day. these people. They were taken in for the night, fed, clothed, provided with necessities, transported to safer places for further residence, and organized trips to the border. People frightened, anxious, exhausted and upset for the first time in their lives came to the church. At first they look at us with suspicion, but after a warm welcome - their faces brighten and so it happens with almost everyone who came. When these people leave the church, they hug the team members, kiss, thank and thank them for the care and love shown to them and the feeling that in these few days, they become relatives. People want to give something in memory to those who cared about them: flowers, some trinkets, children draw pictures of gratitude, but most importantly, people are interested in what kind of church it is and want to know more about it. We exchange telephone numbers, give spiritual literature and prayerfully send our migrants on their way, hoping that the time spent with us will be in vain for them. Some who remain in the city are also willing to help with volunteering, and today more than 10 people have joined the volunteer team and are helping out at the church's social center, which is open 5 days a week, delivering food and holding activities for children with disabilities. disabled people who have moved to our city and for adults.

Religious organization, Religious Community Seventh Day Adventist Church

21749558 / 295

Thank you very much for your support. Thanks to you, our church hosts lunches for displaced persons, transportation of refugees from our church to the border with Poland (two flights a day), purchased food and basic hygiene items, food kits are delivered to the temporary residence of refugees and much more is done thanks to you. support. May the Lord bless you

Relihiina hromada Sviatoho Arkhystratyha Bozhoho Mykhaila s. Balamutivka PTsU

36923191 / 296

There are 47 refugees from the east and south of Ukraine living within our parish. We are doing our best to help the seven pits who were forced to leave their homes due to the war. We offer a helping hand to everything we can: food, personal hygiene products, clothing and medicine. They also bought and sent medicine to treat wounded defenders of our country. We want to witness the history of one family that moved to us from Kharkiv region. Mom and children got to us by bus, so they had few things with them. The woman was advised to turn to the Church for help. So seven, this is almost the first time I have entered the service of God in the Ukrainian Church, where all prayers are clear, because they are spoken in Ukrainian, and almost the entire service the woman cried. And after the service she could not thank the priest, because she had not heard such sermons yet. Of course, they received financial aid (from the funds that your organization transferred to us) and bought clothes and essentials for themselves and their children. Now seven, I come to church every Sunday and the children's mother jokes that the shoes and hat for her daughter turned out to be their way to God. Our parish will continue to help those in need. We are currently developing new food kits (from products that have a long shelf life: cereals, flour, sugar, canned food, tea, coffee, etc.) for refugee families.

Thanks to your funds, we have purchased products to help internally displaced persons in Cherkasy and Cherkasy region, and all those who are in transit to the cities of Western Ukraine and Europe. Today in the Cherkasy region there are about 100 thousand people from the regions of the country where hostilities are taking place. People are in dire need of food, hygiene products, household chemicals, essential medicines, blankets, mattresses, pillows, clothing and housing. Thanks to your donations, we have already helped about 1,000 people who have sought food, medicine and resettlement assistance. Everyone who asked for help received not only food aid but also moral and spiritual support, and people heard the gospel. As a result, about 60 people joined the church. Immigrants are grateful for their care, shelter, help and moral support. We continue to help new people and take care of new people who are adapting in Cherkasy. Many immigrants visited the Protestant church for the first time. In addition, we evacuated 40 people (women and children) fleeing the war zone to the border with Poland and then to Sweden. Pohorilove both believers and non-believers. We bought medicines for the majority of people in Lviv and transported them to Mykolayiv region. During the month, church volunteers helped about 100 families and not once but systematically resumed supplies as products ran out. Due to the fighting, many families were left without income, without official work and without financial assistance from the state, many people were left alone in need. There was a case when a young family's young child began to lose weight because there was a lack of normal food and thank God we have the opportunity to serve this family and today they are provided with normal baby food, hygiene products. There was also a big problem with diapers for children and bedridden patients, we have more than 10 of them and today both patients and children in our area are provided with diapers. Helped inhabitants of Nikolaev with drinking water, to pay to some for housing and communal services, bought for volunteers gasoline for transportation of people to safe places for delivery of products. We continue to serve our people and are sincerely grateful to our friends for their material help, may Almighty God reward you for your sacrifice and love!

NRG HVE "SPASINNYA", m. Blahovishchenske

26590306 / 309

Congratulations, Glory be to our Savior Jesus Christ! My name is Eugene, I am the pastor of the Church of Salvation in Blagoveshchensk, Kirovohrad region. For several years we have been cooperating with the Samaritan Bag, giving joy to children and serving them to spread the Good News. Unexpectedly, a terrible war broke out in my Ukraine ? From the first days, we help people as much as we can - we share our food, warm things, help with transport, we serve prayer and consolation at services. Therefore, your financial support has been a great blessing for us, and I am even more convinced of the unity of Christ's Church! Therefore, they received this blessing as from the hands of Jesus Christ Himself! We have decided by our Church Council that part of the funds will be as financial aid for each family of our community (because someone went to safe cities - you need to pay for travel, someone needs medicine, some lost their jobs and no money to live…), the second part was spent for food packages and household chemicals - we gladly distributed them to needy people, came to their homes, prayed for them, talked. More than 100 families are immigrants from war-torn cities, wives whose husbands are defending their homeland at the front, these are poor families, single mothers with many children, and Roma families. People not only received food, but also heard about the Love of Christ, we prayed for them. From the whole community of our Christian Church "Salvation", the city of the Annunciation - I sincerely thank each of you, for your prayers, for support and word and material. “1 John 4:21. And this commandment we have from him, that he who loves God should love his brother also. " We pray for you and your service to the Lord! I wish peace to all of us! (several photos of meetings with people who received help)

In the city of Uzhgorod, the Blago Foundation constantly receives migrants, they bought a refrigerator, gas stove and various pots for them. In the village of V. Dobron, hot food is prepared daily for 500 migrants twice a day. They needed an industrial dishwasher, and most of the money was spent on it. Our fund also received food from Romania and part of the proceeds was used to transport food to various settlements where migrants live. The help is very useful, we are grateful for everything. Now for our little church it is an experience, but we hope for the mercy of God, who knows everything. This does not stop us from continuing to help and serve the cause of God

These days, our church, like many other churches in Ukraine, is trying by all possible means to serve those who need it most. The church constantly accepts people who have been forced to leave their homes and are fleeing the war. The church premises became a shelter, a place where you can eat, rest, get other necessary help, hear the Gospel, pray to the Lord together. Since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, the Church has received more than a thousand people, which we continue to do to this day. Also, every week we send a minibus to the east of our country with humanitarian aid: food, personal hygiene products. A brother from our church is returning with people who have left their homes in the war zones. Thank you for your financial assistance, which you provided for the needs of internally displaced persons, they were used to help Ukrainians who suffered from the military actions of the Russian Federation against our people.

During the war, our church joined in actively helping people affected by the war - the evacuation of the population from hot spots, evangelism, pastoral care of refugees, transportation and distribution of humanitarian aid to the needy. Our brothers arrived in Kramatorsk on April 9, the day after the tragedy at the train station. People were very scared, they didn't know where to go - where it would be safe and where they would be received. The brothers testified to them about God's protection, protection, and care and offered to pray together and trust God. Alina and her son Maksym received prayer housing in Western Ukraine. We have a relationship with them - we pray together for their work and income in a new place. The Lord shows His mercy and people in this difficult period of their lives decide to serve God and study His Word.

A lot of people were taken to the border before the pedestrian crossing !! But thank God that the Samaritan's Bag provided very timely help in a very timely manner !! Nobody could even hope for that !! When they saw the amount of help, they thanked God very much and blessed the Samaritan's Bag !!!!! The funds arrived in time to serve many in need! People cried and thanked us and God for their help in the church. The funds were used to purchase food, pillows, bedding, fuel for the constant transportation of the needy from the station to the border. May the Lord bless the donors and give a hundred !!!.

43969439 / 329

Praise the Lord for the support of the Samaritan Bag! Thank you very much for your mercy to the people of Ukraine and for the financial support of our joint Service in April! Thanks to these finances, our team fed people on the street, we rented several apartments for refugees, and there was also a fully functioning refugee reception center at vul. Stepana Bandera, 26. Many people from Sumy, Kyiv, Pokrovsk, Nikolaev, Mariupol, Slavyansk, Ternivka, and Malyn, Chernihiv and other cities passed here in a month. We helped the refugees with food kits, fed them and helped everyone needed for a full life! Some people started going to church, they started living in peace again! Now also in the reception center live orphans who could not leave the shelling for 2 weeks, now, thank God, they are safe. We also started a small school for preschoolers, it's also IDPs. I PLEASE PLEASE SUPPORT OUR FINANCIAL SERVICE IN MAY! PRAY AND BLESS YOU! ??

Vifania

25081790 / 330

Thank you very much for your financial help. Our church "Bethany" Although large and few members. Therefore, the assistance has become very supportive. The war broke out and the pastor decided to receive the settlers. Since the hall is large and can accommodate up to 50 people. Preparations began, toilets and showers were completed. They equipped the hall with beds, bought dishes, a refrigerator, an electric stove, and microwaves. A table of love was prepared for Easter. People of different ages and denominations sat at the table and talked like one big family. Because God is our father. Sunday school with presents was prepared for the children. Houses were found for some families. At the expense of the fund cosmetic repairs were carried out. Thanks for support. God's words of the word.

EHB dim molitvy

25440817 / 331

Peace to you brothers and sisters. It was a much-needed aid, we distributed UAH 1,000 per person to all refugees in our district, and purchased food for those who prepare food for the Armed Forces. People were very happy with the financial help because there are many different things about humanitarian aid, such as underwear, hygiene, and so on. In one family and there are seven of them, they were given a house to live in and some food. But when we came to them, they cried because just that day the finances and products they were given for the first time ran out, they said that God heard their prayers. And there are many such stories. Thank God that we can help and serve each other in this way

Koolo druziv

40189421 / 332

In connection with the active hostilities that have been taking place in Ukraine since February 24, 2022, from the first days of the war we began to provide assistance to those who were evacuated to temporary residence in Lviv - free accommodation in apartments (37 apartments in general at different times were involved in receiving those who were expelled from their homes by the war, we currently have 64 IDPs); residence during the war in the village of Honchary, Lviv region, Fazenda complex in Honchary, where 65 to 80 people live (some of them from the church of Philadelphia Irpin, a family from Bucha, Brovary, Mariupol, Kharkiv, Vorzel, Kherson, Odessa, Kiev, Chernihiv is our geography). A special moment was when on the 10th day of the war, a woman arrived with a child who was 10 days old. The heart was especially pounding when looking for everything for newborns. And now two mothers with children born during the war have received shelter at the Hacienda. People from different parts of Ukraine, who so often went into obscurity, called or wrote and the moment when you write to them "yes, we have a place to accommodate you, come, relatives, we are waiting" - it struck everyone with love. Many who wrote "are waiting for us - it's so important to hear now, thank you." We provide food for those who live with us and do everything possible so that they do not feel like refugees, but simply feel that they came to their relatives for a short time, that they are happy here, that they are not alone in a terrible war! We also help those who are in the "hot" spots of our country. In particular, in Kharkiv, namely in the city bomb shelter BC "HEMZ", where a team of volunteers of our friends, with whom he served in peacetime in Christian camps for children, came up with various programs, stayed and served people in Kharkov and Kharkiv region, as well feed 150 soldiers of the Armed Forces. This is a miracle, when on the territory leased in peacetime by the church, there is now a city bomb shelter on 1450 sq.m. They are incredibly grateful to everyone who helps and every story matters, because it's someone's life. With their help, they bring people hope, as I often read, when people wonder why young people did not go, but older people take care of them. They understand that they are not alone, because help comes from different parts of Ukraine. It is unbelievable when my grandmother, who has been smiling for 101 years and said that we have a future, is also thanks to help. That's why we are happy to try to gather everything that is necessary for the people there and take them to Kharkiv. Help in Irpin, for those who are there now has become a special moment for us, because now they are our friends, we certainly do not know everyone, but together with those who live with us from Irpin we care for everyone. Realizing that cooking there is still difficult, the love that fills the heart suggested the option - to cook here and bring ready-made food that is only worth warming up or you can taste it anyway. And so it turned out that now we buy food here, prepare delicacies and take our Irpinians to Irpin. Thanks to the financial help you have provided, we can continue to help, worry, show Love. One woman, Luba, who is currently in the Netherlands, sent a message today: “Thank you. As I remember myself at the dark train station in Kyiv ……… ..sirens, it is impossible to get on the train …… .. you revealed God to me ».” I am infinitely grateful that we can serve together with the Samaritan Bag both in peacetime and in wartime !!!! We continue to reveal Christ !!!! I want to say to everyone who has joined this help: Your service in every life brings the hope that is so necessary to live !!!

The church has become a home for many families, where they have been able to feel the warmth, God's support, and His Holy Word. May the Lord sincerely bless you and multiply you a hundredfold.

Church of the Nazarene

39403509 / 336

At this difficult time, we as a community have taken care of several large families in difficult economic situations. One such family has nine people (Seven children), they need almost everything, because they do not have a stable and sufficient source of funding. Also, our community regularly collects and sends humanitarian aid to areas where hostilities are taking place and trying respond to the needs of people affected by the aggressor. We try to meet the needs of the local population, especially the most vulnerable. We support the elderly, single women with children, and all those who are limited in vital things, especially food and medicine. We organize lunches, prepare lunches for territorial defense, provide psychological assistance (We have a Christian psychologist) to all who need it, accept refugees for overnight stays, and help with the resettlement of temporarily displaced people.

RELIHIINA HROMADA TsERKVY ADVENTYSTIV SOMOHO DNIa U M. UZhHOROD

22114164 / 337

This assistance was like a breath of fresh air that freed our hands in providing assistance and completing work for IDPs. We have the necessary resources to enable us to address important issues related to the provision of humanitarian assistance to people in difficult circumstances. She assisted in resolving a number of issues on the delivery of aid to the cities: Kharkiv, Kyiv, Bucha, Dnipro, Sloviansk, Kramatorsk. Thanks to her, we were able to provide assistance to internally displaced persons and arrange places for their detention in Uzhgorod (which housed 30 to 40 people at a time every day). We have people from: Slavyansk, Kharkiv, Irpen, Bucha, Kyiv, K. Roga, Kramatorsk and other places. Thank God for the resource you have given us. Thank you very much for expressing your desire to provide such a necessary resource for working with migrants. We wish you God's blessings and a peaceful sky above your head.

Relligiyna gromada yevangelskih hrustuyan baptistiv

38222244 / 338

At this difficult time for our country, God has given our church the opportunity to take part in helping people, namely refugees, those who are suffering as a result of hostilities in Ukraine. During this period, in recent weeks, we have been able to communicate with many people. We gave them the news of Jesus Christ and also helped. We helped these people to buy medicine, hand over hygiene items, prepare food, buy and hand over food, buy air mattresses, and create living and heating conditions. This service to disadvantaged, needy people filled our hearts with pain, compassion, and the joy of being able to serve them. The people we personally received, accommodated and supported came from different regions of Ukraine: from Mariupol (Donetsk region), from Zhytomyr, from Kherson, from Kyiv, from Luhansk, from Dnipropetrovsk regions. Here are some testimonies from the people we helped: A resident of Mariupol: “We left two families in two cars, nine of us, including seven women and small children. When we left the city was surrounded, we were already leaving through Russian checkpoints. We tried to ride in a column, as lone cars were firing. It was the last day when it was still possible to leave the city. " A resident of Korosten: “When we got in the car and were already driving, a rocket attack on a military unit began. At first we thought that the wheels of our car were firing, but then we realized that shells were exploding nearby. We managed to leave two families, including three women and seven children. " A resident of Kherson region: “We have four young children. When we left the city was already occupied. We had to pass eight Russian checkpoints. We passed two of them, and then we were not allowed. We decided to take a detour by side roads. Thank God we managed to pass. The next day we were told that Russian artillery and tanks were parked near the house where we lived. " A resident of Lysychansk: “We had an apartment and a car. The shelling was every five minutes. We could not leave, we were taken out by the Ukrainian military. We left everything and I don't know what to do next. " A boy from eastern Ukraine: "A rocket exploded near our house, but we survived." During our meeting with refugee children from Vasylkiv (Kyiv region), it started to rain and thunder began to thunder. The children were very scared because it reminded them of war. We reassured these children, saying that they are now in a safe place and we will take care of them. In recent weeks, we have provided various assistance to 220 people, including 165 of them children aged 2 months to 17 years. We also held prayer meetings with them, and conducted Bible lessons for the children, handed out gifts, and treated them using the resources of the Samaritan Bag. These people, whom we helped, live in our house, in the church, in the apartment in private houses, in the premises of kindergartens, schools. They still need help. We want to serve them by providing spiritual and physical support, because it is such a blessing to show mercy to them as Jesus Christ shows mercy to us. Also, the people we helped come and still want to come to our church for worship. At this time, we would like to express our special, sincere gratitude to the staff of the Samaritan Bag Mission from all those children who have thanked many times for their help, as well as from their parents. Also, accept from our church sincere, fraternal gratitude for your support, for this blessed opportunity, opened through you, to serve disadvantaged people. With respect and gratitude to you pastor of the church EHB with. Nove Selo, Zakarpattia region Vyacheslav Bovsunivsky.

43576166 / 339

Dear friends of the Samaritan Bag) Thank our Lord that He is our Hope, Strength and Support ????We live in a difficult time for our country. Thank you very much for your financial support. God unites our hearts for His Glory. Together with you, we can help suffering people who are in dire need of help. , diapers, medicines. They were able to refuel cars to take people left behind to safer places. Many people were taken to the border, people are forced to find a place to survive. We bought food and prepared food and hot tea for the guys who are on duty. We accept and prepare food for migrants from Borodyanka, Luhansk, Donetsk, Gostomel, Kyiv, Belogorodka. Thank God we have a good opportunity to help them feed, nourish, and clothe them. ???? I will give a couple of examples, although you can write many… One couple who came from Borodyanka. A woman in her 60s, when she received help, just started crying with the words: "Don't think, I had a lot of clothes, I had everything, but ran out of the house and came in what is on us, without things without anything .. I'm like that I am grateful to you for these clothes, for these products, thank you for helping me, may God bless you in everything. ”With tears in her eyes, she rejoices and thanks. We put the Bible or the New Testament in each box of food. A little time passed and this woman asked for another Bible, she tells us a lot in the house, we want another one. At such a moment, you especially thank God that we can sow seeds, and God grows. We had an opportunity to refuel cars, to people who wanted to return to the, though shot homes to Kyiv. Without light, without water, but your own. Buy the necessary things for them. Another young family came from Donetsk, when they received a set of food and sweets, toys for children, the following words were heard: "Thank you very much !! We probably would not have been helped in Donetsk." In Matthew 5:14, "You are the light of the world," the wonderful words in the Bible that we can be light on this earth. When you help people in your heart, there is a special gratitude and joy that God sends people to whom we can help and share His immeasurable love. Everyone has their own little mission, someone prays, someone prepares, allocates funds, takes people away, packs and all of us are united by God's love. I believe that the Lord will bless and reward those who work in His land. Thank you very much for helping us financially and we can take care of others! May the Lord bless each of you abundantly. We are happy that we know Him and that we have the One we can turn to and that we have special support. I believe that the Lord will give us a time to meet, if not on earth, then in heaven. The Lord has helped us to this place! (1 Samuel 7:12) With love, brothers and sisters of the Yemilchyn ECB.

Mykolaiv EHB

41476417 / 342

The Nikolaev association received financial aid. The association is engaged in volunteer activities. We deliver food to churches, which transport it further to the addresses of the needy. Distributed in hospitals, unions, disabled people, Afghans. We also distribute to people who live in the city and its environs. Priority is given to large families, the disabled and the bedridden. The second direction of the association today is the evacuation of people. We are evacuating people who are leaving the occupied territories of Snihurivka and Kherson. At the same time, immigrants sometimes live for several days in a bomb shelter near one of the churches. Established flight logistics. When the water in the city network was turned off, an autonomous system was built in that church. We transport water to the system, as well as to people in high-rise buildings nearby. Most of the finances were used to purchase fuel for transport and to repair trucks.

Funds are used for IDPs to provide for their lives, purchase of washing machines, refrigerators, electric stoves for cooking, we also transfer funds to small communities that have accepted IDPs and can not provide and maintain them. Funds for the purchase of fuel for the delivery of humanitarian aid from the western regions directly to those points where people have to hide in basements, We spend money on fuel for small cars that deliver food and humanitarian aid to the most dangerous places. but there is some opportunity to buy something on the spot, we transfer funds to the bank cards of employees and people in need. At churches we organize holidays for the children of migrants and their parents by giving them gifts and giving them festive dinners. We sing and pray with them, giving them a little happiness and hope in their lives. We truly thank all the sponsors and donors for their participation in the suffering of our people, may the Lord bless you. Good day! The funds received from the Samaritan's Bag as charitable aid by the Church of Jesus Christ (Bashtanka, Mykolaiv region) were used to purchase food and distributed to needy, affected residents of Bashtanka. In addition, at the request of one family from Bashtanka, a house damaged by shelling, in addition to food, purchased hygiene products and household goods. Currently, the work is still ongoing. The rest of the charitable aid will be used to restore the roofs of damaged houses, of which there are many in the Bashtansky district.

Religious organization "Religious community (local church) of the Evangelical Faith Christians "Resurrection" in Mukachevo city"

41637169 / 357

On the morning of February 24, 2022, the Russian Federation, without declaring war, invaded the territory of the sovereign democratic state of Ukraine. Violent bloody battles with the enemy in the territory of our cities inevitably lead to the loss of the inhabitants of Ukraine of their homes, a dignified existence, and even life, but the most terrible thing that can happen in life is the loss of Faith. There are no strangers in Ukraine, there is no place for indifference, in Ukraine there is love for God and neighbor and for one's land. That is why religious, charitable and public organizations of Mukachevo, having no moral and spiritual right to stay away from human tragedies, reaffirming their deep faith in the fundamental truths enshrined in the basic law of our state and in the word of God, taking into account The Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms was established on the basis of the Sinai Christian Missionary Charitable Center, which belongs to the Resurrection Church of the Evangelical Faith, and the Operational Headquarters for Aid to Victims of Russian Attacks. The purpose of the Operational Headquarters is to provide assistance to victims of the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Thank you very much from the Church of the Resurrection and the Operational Headquarters for Assistance to the Victims of the Russian Attack, for your financial assistance in the amount of $ 5,000. The funds provided by you were used to purchase household appliances, washing machines, dryers, ironing boards, shower boxes, water heaters, washbasins and components, which gave us the opportunity to create extremely good living conditions for temporarily displaced persons. God bless you - let's go together to victory.

Tserkva Masto Zhittya

26212225 / 358

The City of Life Church (Uzhhorod, Zakarpattia region) expresses its sincere gratitude to the partners of the Samaritan's Bag charity organization for their financial assistance. Since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, our church has been helping IDPs who have had to flee their homes. We house people in our homes and in our church. We distribute food, clothing and basic necessities. Many people came in the same clothes without means of subsistence, many have nowhere to return because their homes have been destroyed. So, we give some of the money to people so that they can buy what they need, and we also help pay for utilities. We are infinitely grateful for your kind hearts and much-needed help at this difficult time. We believe in victory. God be with us all. Blessings)

Thanks to funds from the Samaritan Bag, our church was able to provide targeted assistance to affected families from Bucha, Irpin, Kyiv, Mariupol, Chernihiv, Kharkiv regions in the form of products, hygiene products, household chemicals, medicines, etc., which are currently in our city. They also joined the work of local volunteer centers and social services, providing them with products provided to IDPs. We bought a microwave oven in the center, which houses temporarily displaced people. They bought sowing material for Borodyanka and surrounding villages. The sisters of our community have repeatedly baked cakes for the military of the Armed Forces and for the residents of the affected regions. They also took part in organizing the transfer of products and providing fuel to the people of Kharkiv region through our brother in Christ. They joined financially in the construction of a home for refugees from Mariupol. We truly thank everyone who made this help possible! We believe that this has become a manifestation of God's love for those people who at this difficult time are unable to cope with the circumstances alone! May the Lord repay a hundredfold!

Thanks to your help, we are able to help with products, hygiene products, clothes, medicines - internally displaced persons living in schools, kindergartens, dormitories of our city. We also help to find housing for families with children and settle in a new place. Whenever possible, assistance is also transferred to the eastern regions of Ukraine, where there is the greatest need. May the Lord bless you and help us all to go through these difficult times.

Odesskiy Oblactnoy Blagotvoritelny Fond HERITAGE

34929480 / 363

During the 60 days of the war, we were able to feed more than 20,000 people with sandwiches at the railway station in Odessa during the evacuation, these people fled from hostilities, sometimes under fire with a backpack on their shoulders, where they had the most necessary documents ... about what to take I didn't even have time to think on the road. But God took care of this through the finances that He gave us. We also visited about 700 families, who received food packages, hygiene products, and household chemicals. Words cannot convey the emotions that people feel. ... They just kiss potatoes in a bag, rejoice in toilet paper. They are immensely happy that they were not left at such a difficult time for them. We sincerely thank you for the finances for the ministry, may the Lord reward a hundredfold who donates resources, time, patience.

House of Prayer

20558129 / 364

From the first days of the war, the church began serving refugees. Sunday school classes were immediately converted into bedrooms. There are 30 refugees living at the church on a permanent basis, and about 20 more spend the night one or two nights and move on. About 70 more live in the homes of church members. The church's kitchen feeds about 50 refugees three times a day. Also, every Sunday we distribute food kits to refugees who do not live in the church. Purchased products and transferred to the Nikolaev and Kherson areas. They took food and distributed it in the villages of Kyiv region after their deoccupation. Several times they bought medicines and transferred them to cities where it is impossible to buy them (Sumy, Svatove, Luhansk region). All this, and much more, the church could do, including with the help of the Christmas Child Project. We truly thank you for spending this difficult time with us!

Church of Jesus of the Nazarene Vinnitsa

26176185 / 365

Thanks to finances, we were able to provide material assistance to refugees from the eastern regions and the Kyiv region. People who were driving towards the border in their cars could get an overnight stay, hot food, showers and medical care, as well as fuel in the form of gasoline or diesel fuel if they did not have it in the tank. Those who temporarily stayed in the Vinnitsa region and the city of Vinnitsa receive weekly and daily hot meals and food packages, as well as personal hygiene items.

They have small children, a man with a disability and a blind grandmother. The family was very worried that there were no means and means of subsistence. But thanks to the funds provided, it was possible to help them significantly. There are also meetings with displaced children, communication that helps children make friends, adapt to new conditions. We truly thank the Lord and you, dear partners, for your funds, help and prayerful support. We believe that the Lord will show mercy to Ukraine and Ukrainians.
