CHRISTIAN CHURCH LIVING HOPE

42417354 / 371

We truly thank the Samaritan's Bag project for the gifts, printed materials, and funds we received for the ministry. At such a difficult time for our country, your resources have been a great blessing to many children and their parents. Since the beginning of the war, with God's help, we have been able to conduct several evangelistic events in which we used the resources received from you, namely: - for a group of children with hearing impairments, as well as migrants in the village of Berezivka (Zhytomyr district) and their parents in Zhytomyr - Easter meeting for a group of children in the village of Teterivka (Zhytomyr district). - Evangelistic meeting with children in the village of Vydybir (Chernyakhiv district) We also held many individual meetings with children and provided gifts, brochures and assistance to a group of children from Zhytomyr whose parents are police officers. For them it was a real encouragement and surprise! But the greatest impression of our team was left after visiting several villages liberated from occupation in Makariv, Bucha and Borodyanka districts of Kyiv region (Nemishaevo, Dibrova, Mirotske, Andriyivka, Vablya, Borodyanka). We brought help to the inhabitants of these settlements, who found themselves in difficult circumstances, without water, gas and electricity, and to the children we met, we gave gifts and testified about the Lord. Thanks to the funds received from you, we were able to purchase and distribute medicines to the needy (for pressure, painkillers, vitamins, etc.), various foods, fruits / vegetables, matches, candles, batteries and other essentials. The money was also spent on car fuel. So far, we have been able to reach about 150 children and their parents (families). All children and parents are pleasantly surprised, very grateful! There were tears of gratitude in some of them for the gifts and help. In such a difficult time of war, tension and stress, the resources you have provided have brought many children and adults some comfort, encouragement, and real support. Imagine how in one village we took the fragments of a rocket that the children were playing with from the children's hands and gave them wonderful gifts that were a real blessing for them! In the town of Borodyanka, we stopped at a large crowd of people waiting for charitable help. We called the children with their parents apart and gave them gifts and sweets / fruits, testifying of the Lord. The photo with these children came against the background of a damaged and burned building. And not far from that place was a whole block of damaged and destroyed high-rise buildings… Thank you sincerely to the Lord and to you for the opportunity for service, for works of charity and evangelization! We still have a number of gifts, and we will continue to serve children and families. We pray that this will happen as effectively as possible and for the glory of God! We look forward to working with you in the future! Praying for you, Serhiy Kozlov, pastor of the Living Hope Church (Zhytomyr), service coordinator.

Church of Christians of the Evangelical Faith, Matsoshyn village, Lviv region

26307730 / 374

Despite the fact that our church is not located in Lviv or in any big city, and also has only about 100 people, we had a good opportunity to serve people who were forced to leave their homes, or even lost them. The funds you kindly sent us helped to transport almost 200 people from Lviv (mainly the railway station) to our House of Prayer, and then to the border with Poland. There was a small base in our church where we received people, our sisters came every day to cook hot food and take care of the rooms where people lived. We managed to re-equip our rooms with Sunday school classes for living rooms, and by purchasing electric heaters we maintained a comfortable temperature in them. At one time, these rooms were equipped with a bathroom with shower and everything you need, in the current circumstances it has become very useful. After staying with us (it sometimes lasted from one to several days), we attracted our brothers with their cars and took people to the border. Most often, for the sake of faster border crossing, we had to go to the checkpoint in Uhryniv, in both directions the road one car covers about 150 km. Thanks to your help, we were able to refuel cars (given the cost and shortage of fuel, this is a very tangible help, because the first weeks of the war the cost of fuel sometimes reached 47 UAH per liter). They were able to buy a considerable amount of food to serve displaced people. We would also like to emphasize that, thanks to your help, we were able to purchase the necessary items for the brothers of our church who serve in the army (bulletproof vests, backpacks, etc.). Several brothers have already been mobilized from our community, and now they are better off. Thank you very much. We continue to work for victory!

Ukrainian Methodist Church

20446413 / 375

Congratulations to all âàòè My name is Diana, as well as many families from central Ukraine and we had to leave for the safety of our children and us. We have 4 minor children: the eldest daughter is 13, the sons are 11, 5, 2 years old. We came from the Kyiv region from the village of Zabirya (you know the hero cities of Bucha, Irpin and Gostomel - so it is 40 km away from us) and Vasylkiv, which they started bombing from the first day - 20 km. The first day seems to be calm, and then when you realize that it continues to rumble all day and night ñòðàõ fear begins to take over you. The first night we slept together six in the same room with the children on the floor. The second night we spent the night with my sister in a nearby village in the basement of the church. Altogether there were 18 people sleeping on the floor that night in the church. We just slept with our backs to each other. When military planes flew and dropped bombs, fired rockets from Belarus at the airfield, Vasilkov's floor shook beneath us… It was a very long and difficult night for all of us. My sons did not fully understand the situation, and the eldest daughter began to cry from the first words "the war has begun." The next morning at 7 o'clock my husband Leonid decided to send me and my children to Transcarpathia to relatives with friends by minibus. In 20 minutes we gathered (we didn't even return home to pick up the prepared suitcase, only what was with us - baby diapers, changeable clothes for the children once and documents), prepared some food and left. 5 adults and 9 children left us in an old Volkswagen T4. Thank God, the day before our departure, relatives from another city of Kyiv region were driving, they helped us with the route and told us which way to go. At that time we could not move on the Kyiv-Zhytomyr highway, the bridge in Stoyanka was blown up, the highway was constantly shelled, it was blocked. Keep up to date with the news to understand the situation around. In total, we had to drive about 800 km, and we drove 26 hours - constantly on the move. Our driver Vanya (who has a brain cyst) did not even stop to sleep… only refueling and toilet. Already being in the mountains we had to stand in a big traffic jam (for the night we may have driven 10 km), the heater in the car did not work at all, we stood all night in a traffic jam in the mountains, where the snow was knee-deep. My hair froze to the glass, the children froze hard… we just lay on the floor, put the children's feet on their feet and rub the body so as not to freeze .. I'm the same with Masha (this is the mother of 2 children who went with us, her husband was the driver) rubbed legs to each other..?? These are the moments you will not be able to forget all your life… constantly tears in your eyes and thoughts whether we will return there again ?? Thank God I had a place to go. That I have sisters and brothers in Transcarpathia. That not only I but also my friends were able to leave on time and be safe. All of us were met by Tanya - she is my older sister, she fed us hot food and we live and now she has her, for which I am very grateful to her and Slavik. 4 days after we left, my husband left. He took some of our neighbors and together we drove to Western Ukraine as well. Thank God, the road was difficult, but He saved and we are here now. I want to thank everyone who helps us and our children and our country ???? May the Lord reward everyone for their good deeds ?? Now we feel safe. We have food, we already have clothes, warm beds and everything we need for every day. A little bit of how many of us there were in the first days when I came with the children. All who lived in Tanya and Slavik were 36 people in one house. But all of us together strangers or relatives helped each other, prepared food for everyone, cleaned and shared their experiences and little joys. Some went abroad, most who came with us stayed here. We continue to pray to God first of all for the war, and we are also learning to continue living in this difficult time for Ukraine ?????? Thank you again to each of you for your prayers and help ??

40110016 / 381

Thanks to your support, our dear partners, we were able to help people who so needed and need support at this difficult time for Ukraine and the Ukrainian people. These are children, their parents and the elderly, whom we helped to evacuate from battlefields. We placed them in the Church, in the houses and many of our brothers took them home. We fully provided them with everything they needed: clothes, food, medicine, hygiene products, took the needy to the hospital ... We did everything necessary to make them comfortable Many broken lives, broken families who have nowhere to return, many tears, many sorrows. Our Church is extremely grateful for the financial support that allowed us to help people and witness to them at the same time. about love of God. We went from Irpin, took with themselves the pregnant woman, her husband and their son. We were given a green corridor for 20 minutes. Going by them they started shooting from submachine guns and from tanks and it was the real hell. God's miracle, we came out alive and the rest of the cars that followed us were shot, they all died. We were helped to evacuate people to the army, which we also had the opportunity to witness and two of them believed in Jesus Christ. And the family living in Unas also believed. Thank God for these souls. Thank you sincerely for your support, for your love.

Many thanks to all who take part in helping the people of Ukraine in such difficult times. Thank you for the money you received from Samaritan's Bag. - Our church is on the border with Poland, it is Ustyluh. Our first service was to help the refugees with hot tea, food, warmth, a place to stay temporarily, spend the night. And we were not immediately ready to help so many people: tea, coffee, sandwiches, hot food, disposable tableware .... Therefore, financial assistance was very important to us. - not all people go abroad, some families stay in our city. Some of the migrants were given old houses to live in, thanks to these funds we were able to buy the necessary bed, utensils (for the first time), clothes (some came in what they were, in steamed shoes), food for families. - Many migrants just need food. (Especially those who stayed in the villages) So we try to provide them with at least the most necessary products, sometimes we organize dinners for them just at home, conduct pastoral work, invite to church service - A lot of money is spent on fuel to deliver everything needed to migrants , meet, drive to the border, .... - people are amazed at the kindness of other people, sacrifice, willingness to serve. With tears in their eyes, thank you for your help. Without the funds you provided, we would not have been able to help the needy during the war in our country. Thank you very much. May God bless you.

From the first day of war we began to evacuate people from Nikolaev, refueling cars at the expense. Thank you very much for your help, which we immediately sent to refuel for cars! Every day we continue to take out from 9 to 60 people. We have established several evacuation routes with partner churches from other cities, we work together. We leave, sometimes they come or meet and so we help people in Nikolaev, the Nikolaev area and if possible people from the Kherson area! At the same time, we are constantly working on the delivery of humanitarian aid, both in the villages and to people in the city, we bring food and hygiene products! We also buy medicines for sick elderly people who do not have the opportunity to do so! In the basement of the church we create more favorable conditions for sheltering people, bomb shelters and for overnight stays of migrants. Lay polystyrene foam on the floor and put the door. From the first days until today we help the military, deliver the necessary things to the checkpoints and locations! Many people left our church. But now most new people come to communicate, we treat them! Thank you very much for your support! She is very much needed and on time!

Poslannya nadii

40552320 / 406

We are sincerely grateful for such significant financial assistance for our church! From the very beginning of the Russian aggression, we, as a church, have identified several main areas of work, namely: assistance to refugees with settlement and deportation; assistance to the military and their families; collection and dispatch of humanitarian aid to hot regions where hostilities are taking place, as well as assistance to migrants who remain in Lviv. We were able to organize mobile transport crews to take people to the border and transported about 600 women and children in a month. We were able to help with the temporary settlement of about 800 people. During this time, we sent food aid to Sumy, Gostomel, Bucha, Pokrovsk, Kramatorsk, Kyiv and other cities. When the flow of people to Lviv decreased, we rented premises in the shopping center (New Central Department Store) and opened a humanitarian center to help refugees and military families, where people in need can get clothes, shoes, food, medicine, as well as spiritual and psychological help. In the two weeks of the Message for Action humanitarian hub, more than 1,000 people have received important assistance, and we continue to look for opportunities to serve those affected by the war. As part of this work, we organize master classes for IDP children to help children feel cared for and safe! We have started cooperating with educational institutions in our district, which have opened the doors for the settlement of temporarily displaced persons and our desire to feed these people, because every day people who lack food and necessary hygiene come to our help center. Thanks again for your help and open to further cooperation!

Since the war, we GO Perspektyva Ye has hosted about 500 people with children. We always needed money for food, things, and personal hygiene, we give linen to the laundry, because people often change, fuel for drivers who carry humanitarian aid, linen, and food. The brothers of our church take women with children and large families to the Polish border. They went there twice a day. Since the beginning of the war, about 750 people have been transported. The money went to gasoline/ diesel, to change the oil in cars … These are the realities of our center. refugees come with different health conditions, there was also a woman with stage 4 cancer, and a grandmother of 90 years. We were the part of the transportation of night vision devices from Poland to Ukraine (Kharkiv and Dnipro). We started an outreach Bible group for nonbelievers. Here are men from different parts of Ukraine (Kyiv,Luhansk,Zaporizhya). Please pray that they would come closer to God. At the end of March we had our an English club. There were 15 young people, 10 of them are unbelievers who are not even sure that God exists, the club went great. we had an English class and read the Gospel of John. Then shared the gospel again and again to make sure they understand where they are and who is God. Andriy is 1 year old,Mother Vika arrived from Kirovograd go to hospital for surgery. He has heart disease. Now our church takes care of this family in hospital. We visited militaries of Armed Forces of Ukraine in a milinary hospital and brought them Ester bread, food and Gospels. We are grateful for your participation in our ministry by prayers and finances.

Tserkva KHVYE s.Dovhovolya

24176079 / 410

Congratulations. The funds received by the church in the village of Dovhovolya helped us a lot. Thanks to them, the church was able to purchase and send food packages to areas that were particularly affected by the war. They bought sewing machines and fabric for sewing unloadings for soldiers on the front line. They bought flour and some other products for baking bread and bakery products for soldiers and people living in the occupied and liberated territories and were left without basic necessities. We also helped people who temporarily moved to our area and bought them everything they needed. Part of the funds was allocated for people with cancer to purchase expensive medicines, as many people lost their jobs due to martial law. We sincerely thank God from the bottom of our hearts that He has placed your compassionate hearts to help us financially in this difficult time for our country!

EHB Bilopillia

38725361 / 411

Many thanks to the Lord and to all those who joined this project. May our God reward you for your sacrifice and bless you without measure. The funds that were given to us were a great blessing for our local church, as well as for many people in our city and nearby villages. We were able to buy food and medicine, hygiene products and fuel. They collected food kits and distributed them to vulnerable groups, the disabled and families with children, as well as their church members. Already received assistance, more than 300 families and now, we are forming a stock of products that can be distributed to those who find themselves in difficult life circumstances due to the war. The Lord allowed us to support the Armed Forces with products that were used to feed the soldiers in our territorial community. Also during these two months, we have repeatedly supported the orphanage for children with physical and / or mental disabilities and mental disorders, buying them sweets and food ... Helped in the purchase of drugs for the new company of the Armed Forces, formed. from our compatriots. They also helped to treat three seriously injured young men. We paid for the delivery of one truck of humanitarian cargo to our region. We replenished the phones of church members who did not have the opportunity to do so ... We thank God that they are such sacrificial people as you and we glorify His Holy Name!

Regional Organization “Christian Missionary “Messeger”

39713423 / 412

Peace to you!.. We want to express our deep gratitude for your financial support, Thank God that there is such an organization... Our mission is to spread the Gospel to most children, and we always need support from everyone who wants to participate in a common cause, and finances are always needed; and at this time, in connection with the martial law, they brought a lot of benefits! Thank you very much, may the Lord reward you and bless all the workers in His field! With these funds, we partially purchased food for the needy; for everyday lunches, (at the request of our local authorities) we feed the people of Ter Oborona, and this is forty people every day, unfortunately it is impossible to provide a photo (for security reasons); we were also able to provide one-time assistance in the form of a meal for six hundred children and adults who heard the Good News from these same products; and on the Easter holiday, twice God helped to get together (it’s dangerous for us) and hold a festive event for children with their parents ... They also helped families with food and bought a little flour, cereals, sugar, so that refugees could be accepted (it’s not always possible to help with money ). In our area, those who came from the "hot" places, everyone was placed at home, but we are preparing to receive more people, and we have a room with a capacity of 100 people, but it is designed for warmer weather ... We built in last year the “bathhouse” building, so that you could have the opportunity to wash yourself with hot water, and so it’s cheaper than paying for electricity; but we didn’t finish, due to lack of funds ... and we invested the remaining money from your help here too ... we decided that it was very necessary, for refugees at this time ... and in the summer we plan (we believe and hope) to collect children and see them off camp: with an overnight stay for 5-7 days ... And we also have two villages where, since Christmas meetings, we continue to communicate with children and spend time together studying the Bible ..., money has also been allocated there, received from the mission "Bag Samaritan "...! In general, it was a great help and very timely! All money is distributed under the supervision of heaven, with a clear conscience and to the Glory of God! Thank God for you! Thank you for the "big heart"! God bless you all and all areas of your life!

04/13/22 in the amount of: 361.60 + 458.50 + 255.00 + 120.00 = 1194.40 bought food for refugees from Kramatorsk, who settled not far from Myrhorod, in the village. Petrivtsi. Testimony Yes, it turned out that the war in Ukraine caught many by surprise, and many people found themselves in a difficult situation. Many people fled the bombings. And near the city of Myrhorod in the village. Petrivtsi came to Roma families. They are also people and they have children, and they also need help. But as they say, since they are gypsies, it is not easy to find a job. Because people are not used to thinking about them very well. But we help them and testify of Jesus Christ. Thank you that the money we received from the Samaritan's Bag allows us to help people in need at this difficult time for Ukraine. Thank God! Testimony I, the pastor of Myrhorod Oleksandr Yuriyovych Rohochy, received funds from the Samaritan's Bag during the difficult times of the Russian war. Our Rel³g³yna Gromada HEV v misti Myrhorod. We are very grateful for this opportunity to serve the people in this difficult time for the people of Ukraine. We had this problem with my phone. Since the phone is old and there was not enough memory in it and the problem was that it often happened that the photos on it disappeared, wrote (no content), and the battery did not hold much, and then it happened that the phone rang and we could not extract a photo from it. I bought a new Samsung phone. We prayed that he would somehow restore the photo from the old phone, and thank God he managed to do it. With the new phone, we will be able to continue to take photos much more successfully and safely. Thank God!

Rel³g³yna Gromada HEV v misti Myrhorod

23814128 / 416

Certificate: 16.04.22. in the amount of: 2000 hryvnias bought a refrigerator for refugees from Severodonetsk _ Raisa and her husband Valentin Hindzinsky. Valentin had cancer, he underwent 2 surgeries, he cut out part of the intestine, pancreas, spleen. Their apartment was bombed, they were blocked on the 6th floor of the apartment while rescuers dismantled the debris. And when they arrived in our city of Myrhorod, they had nothing, no food, no food, no money and nothing else. And most importantly, they needed refrigerators and food. We were able to buy them a used car. refrigerator and food. Now they began to go to meetings.

Rel³g³yna Gromada HEV v misti Myrhorod

Sabina, a refugee from the city of Kramatorsk, fled her city without documents or money. We bought her products for a while. The house in which she lived was bombed, her parents remained under fire there in the city of Kramatorsk, and she escaped and could no longer stay there, she was scared. We still do not know how to help her. she doesn't have a phone, she wrote down our phone in her hands, she said that she would call us, she would contact us somehow.

Church of the Holy Trinity Ivanopil

25740672 / 419

Glory to Jesus Christ, Christ is Risen! Thank you for your help, it is wonderful to feel God's support through brothers and sisters, to see the rays of light in these difficult dark days of war. Today we have two months of war, our Church is far from the front lines, but we feel the war every day. We accept the second influx of migrants from Eastern and Southern Ukraine, settle them in the House of Prayer, and organize a center for humanitarian aid at the church. During this time we have helped more than 200 families with food kits, things, hygiene products resettlement was inhabited by 30 migrants from Kyiv and Chernihiv regions, we provided them with everything they needed for a comfortable stay, now these people have gone to their homes or rather what is left of their homes, with your help we help such people with young children to find places to accommodation in their settlements and help with the payment of accommodation for the first month. We continue to help mothers who have lost milk due to stress and can not breastfeed their babies for them, we buy baby food and medicine for babies, diapers. With the arrival of spring, children begin beriberi, parents save and buy only what they need, so we continue to buy fresh fruits and vitamins. We have many horrific stories of people fleeing the war, feeling the breath of death behind them, people fleeing through the woods with their children, people riding bicycles and seeing the families of others killed. It is the hard work of pastoral care, giving people hope and the belief that God will fix everything, you just have to wait.

Baptist Church, Irshansk

40342020 / 420

About 80 people from the combat zones came to our village, to whom we provided various assistance. These were mostly large families and the elderly.

Gromadska organIzatsIya «Kulturno – prosvItnitskiy tsentr «VIdkrite sertse»

33699042 / 421

Our Church is infinitely grateful to the Samaritan's Bag. In this particularly difficult time for our country, we feel God's love through you more than ever. Your charitable help allows us to take care of people and, most importantly, to bring them the Good News. Since we received the funds, more than one and a half hundred people in our city, whom we visited in person, received food, heard the gospel, and were invited to worship. The nearby villages, which were recently de-occupied, were visited separately. Our city of Sumy was under siege for a long time, at first there were not enough products in the shops, later they became much more expensive. It took a long time to stand in line, to get to the other end of town. As public transport did not work for the elderly, disabled, mothers with young children, it was a real problem to buy the necessary products. Now Sumy region has been liberated from invaders, but enemy shelling of communities near the border continues, and the threat of missile strikes remains. Life goes on, the work of many institutions is resumed. In the days before Easter, there was a warning about the threat of shelling on the holiday. Our enemy is also the enemy of God, because his goal is the building of the Church, the gathering of people. Despite such threats, about two dozen people we visited came to worship for us at Easter. Among them were parents of children with disabilities, single mothers, retirees, immigrants from Kharkiv. Some mothers expressed an interest in their children attending a Christian children's club in the future. Others expressed gratitude for their help and participation in their lives. We had the opportunity to visit the small village of Artemo-Rastivka, which was located at a great distance from the city, there is almost no road to it, and there are not enough necessary things. Since there are only about 30 people, we organized a small meeting. People listened to and accepted the Word of God, supported the prayer for our country, for the soldiers and the approach of our people to the Lord. In one of the villages where our volunteers live, food kits were distributed. Over time, a prayer hour was organized there, and a short meeting is held every night on the street. There are spiritual meditations, a prayer in which three families take part. Some of the people we visited joined our volunteer movement. Because of this, some of them have already attended our services several times. Among these people is Sergei. Until recently, he had a drug addiction, now there is a struggle in his soul. He understands that without God's support he cannot cope. He is touched by the testimonies of the people of our Church whom God has set free and given new life. He is also hindered by his religious worldview, which is aimed at fulfilling certain traditions without a personal relationship with Jesus Christ. Now he is with Christians for some time, his example of life affects him. This is more important than many guidelines. He seeks to help people because he is now unemployed and understands people's needs. We believe that God will surely convert him to Himself and he will be our brother in Christ. We also ask God to give us the opportunity to receive people from areas where it is very restless. Many cities have simply been wiped off the face of the earth, and people cannot leave the occupied territories because they are being purposefully shelled and not released. Now, more than ever, we see the power of prayers that are heard in different cities of the planet and bring us closer to victory over darkness!

Church CHVE Sokal

Since the beginning of the full-scale war with Russia, our church has been actively involved in the reception of migrants, who later settled in the area. Thank you very much for your sacrificial hearts! You are helping the victory of Ukraine! May the Lord bless you!

CHRISTIAN MISSION "SOURCE OF LIFE" OF THE UNITED CHURCH OF CHRISTIANS OF THE EVANGELICAL FAITH 40009, Sumy, st. Kulykivska, 50/2 tel .: +38 050 957 36 27 Ex. ¹ 35/22 From April 25, 2022 Letter of thanks Dear servants, beloved brothers and sisters of the Samaritan's Bag Mission. The pastors of Sumy region, the people of God of all the churches of Sumy region who are subordinated to the regional mission of the Source of Life Center, are sincerely grateful to you for their mercy and zeal. We have received your financial support for our churches. Sumy region has been surrounded for more than a month, there was no centralized supply of food and medicine, fuel, so your help came to us as God's blessing for God's children. We thank you for your efforts, fundraising and funding for the Churches of the Sumy region. The funds were used for the purchase of food and the formation of food kits provided to church members and residents of the most affected areas of Sumy region: Putivl, Krasnopil, Bilopil, Trostyanets and other communities. The families of the military and the Territorial Defense received food support. A service was organized in the Sumy Correctional Facility ¹116, where food supplies were restricted during the occupation, and humanitarian aid was also provided for workers and prisoners. We cooperated with the Geriatric Boarding House, medical institutions and the homeless shelter. Thanks to you, support is provided for large families, the elderly, people with disabilities. A separate area of funding is the provision of assistance to the visually impaired. During the occupation, the purchase and delivery of necessary medicines to the region was organized. Transport costs for the delivery of humanitarian goods and evacuation of residents were paid. Financial support was also given to the families of those who do their best to do charity and volunteer work. May our great Lord Jesus Christ bless you abundantly! Yours faithfully, Head of the Source of Life Mission, Bishop of the Churches of the Central Executive Committee of the Sumy Oblast CEE _____________ MB Nelin

At the beginning of the war, we tried to buy food and medicine wherever possible. They also spent money on personal hygiene items and fuel. In every place and in every contact they tried to speak the Good News, about Christ and His way of salvation for all people. We put a New Testament in each food set. We also helped with the evacuation of people who wanted to leave dangerous places. We were the only ones at the time who helped the IDPs with food. We connected with schools and called families with children who registered at schools. Local families who remained in difficulty also received assistance. These packages were delivered to homes. We prayed for each family, talked. When people received food packages, they called and thanked again because they did not expect such necessary products. Every family heard that God loves and cares for them. Tears in the eyes of parents and happy eyes of children, because the child received gifts from the Samaritan Bag, which miraculously remained from last year. We put our hearts, prayers and love into this project. Many people from the church were volunteers. It is an honor for us. Many thanks to the Samaritan Sumka, who is with Ukraine at this time. Thanks to your financial help, we were able to repair many houses in the village of Veselivka that were damaged as a result of the failure of Russian cruise missiles of ammunition depots. Slate from houses just blew up, windows fell out. We could repair house after house by replacing the slate so that water would not flow on the heads of the people who live there. In our village there were and are many immigrants from Bucha, Irpin, Makarov, Kiev, Borodyanka, Kherson, Narodich, Mariupol. All of these families were provided with the necessary food and clothing, and some with housing. During this time there were many trips to take people out, deliver food and other needs and thanks to your help could refuel cars. May God generously bless everyone who helps in these difficult times.

Our dear brothers and sisters of the Samaritan Bag Mission, thank you very much for your help in helping people during the war. During this difficult and unusual time, you and I have done a lot here in Ukraine, and more needs to be done, because destroyed cities and villages, wounded people, orphans, refugees need various help. You blessed the refugees we received at the unfinished rehab center, heated them, installed doors and windows, and made a kitchen for them. During these two months, 25 blind people were settled there - migrants and their companions, as well as children. To this day, we feed them, clothe them, treat them, pay for gas and electricity, spend money on fuel, and pay utility bills for refugees who have settled in our homes and neighbors' apartments. Funds were also donated to the army. We give them food, medicine, bought a bulletproof vest. The temporarily displaced refugees are very grateful for your help. May the Lord bless you all. With prayer and love, employees of the Trust Charitable Foundation.

Thanks to these funds, we were able to renovate and open the Humanitarian Aid Center at our Church, where we distribute food, clothing and hygiene products to IDPs and all people in need. We also pack and send products to people who live in villages or towns and are unable to come to the Humanitarian Center. We bought a lot of flour and now we have a team that makes dumplings for soldiers and for all those in need. We also dry vegetables for instant soup kits, thanks to which we were able to pay the electricity bill, which turned out to be quite large. In addition, we bought carrots, cabbage and other vegetables for soup sets. Thank you very much again - thanks to your generous help, many people both inside and outside the church were able to get what they needed for their lives. May God bless you abundantly!

We thank you very much for your financial assistance and cooperation in the field of God. Our city of Zaporozhye has become a shelter and transit place for people who escaped from shelling and active military aggression. Thanks to your help, we have the opportunity to help a large number of people in a difficult situation. We collect and distribute food bags, clothing, personal care and essentials. We arrive at the addresses where the IDPs temporarily live and bring them hot meals, bake pies at checkpoints. We help in the hospice with diapers and products, we cut the disabled people's hair and everything is based on the Evangelization of souls. We feed the homeless and the poor on the street, since there are no jobs in the city, many are in poverty. We carry out evangelizations for adults and children everywhere with Samaritan gifts. People are very grateful to God for His mercy that they were able to escape from the shelling themselves and save the lives of children. A lot of mothers with babies thank for diapers, baby clothes and all the help provided to them. This is at least a little encouraging and inspires people not to lose heart and live in hope in this terrible time of war. Thank you again that we can do one thing together in the Name of the Lord. God bless you for your open hearts to the misfortune of your neighbor.

YEVANHEL’S’KA TSERKVA KHRYSTYYAN BAPTYSTIV

26478934 / 442

We truly thank God for your kind hearts and thank you that with your help we can help those people in need during the difficult times of war. We had the opportunity to visit families in need. We were able to bring the Word of God to those who do not yet know Jesus as the personal Lord and Savior, and we were able to help brothers and sisters who lost their jobs and had children because of the war. We visited the families of people who have been displaced by the war. - Brother Volodya Korniychuk was helped with 2,000 hryvnias, paid for the gas he spent on receiving refugees at home. - Sveta Konanchuk does not have a pension because the cards are blocked and you have to pay for gas. 2000 hryvnias. - Boychenko Maria needed money for treatment, she is a pensioner. - Dovbysh Halyna has two children, but she and her husband lost their jobs due to the war. We helped with this blessing of 3,000 hryvnias. - Vashchuk Olena is a single woman without a family, she was blessed, she is a pensioner, UAH 1,000. - Polishchuk Lydia is not able to take care of herself, they left with her daughter and needed help, 2000 hryvnias. They also allocated funds for a family where they lost their mother and left two children, the eldest takes care of a younger child aged 19 and 12. They are in need. With your help, we also had the opportunity to allocate funds for the Hope for All Charitable Foundation. He takes care of a home for the elderly, our fraternity, located in Dovbysh. Blessed 30,000 hryvnias. And for the bank's services 300 hryvnias. We had the opportunity to visit migrant families and speak the Word of God and asked what they needed to help. We will be sure to report on further costs.

HVE s. Visove

39391986 / 443

Congratulations to you! Church of Vysove took an active part in the support and provision of refugees and military food, hygiene products, bed linen and others ... Every week we make dumplings and dumplings, freeze and send to the district center of Sarny in the refrigerator .. from there they are distributed as needed or not refugees who settled in our villages and cities, or the military or citizens who were in the cities of occupation. Also, in addition to dumplings / dumplings, they were sent to Kyiv every week, once aid was sent to Mariupol, namely: pastries (bread, pies, rolls, cookies), canning (lard, stew, salads, jam, pate, fats), boiled dumplings, hygiene products , essentials .... and much more. Thanks to your help, we were able to serve those who needed it much more. And now we continue to help everyone who needs it, to the best of our ability! May the Lord bless you abundantly!

21117500 / 445

Thanks to the help you have received, our Church has managed to do a lot of good during these difficult times of the war with Russia, not only for the members of the Good News Church, but also for other people who are suffering from the racist invasion. When our city was under a three-way siege in the first days of the war and there was a great need for food, hygiene, medicine, etc. It is thanks to your help that we managed to buy these scarce items and provide them free of charge to those who really need them - both in the Church and on the road, especially when the Armed Forces of Ukraine liberated our temporarily occupied towns and villages. We must not forget the eyes of people who kissed bread with tears ... We also managed to help our Territorial Defense and Ambulance Hospital, but the emphasis was on targeted assistance to people through a mini-headquarters in the Church, where specific needs were collected and food was delivered. and medication. We are very grateful for your open to God and people who are not indifferent to the suffering of people's hearts!

Seventh Day Adventists

24832573 / 446

Thanks from hundreds of migrants, whom I helped to live through these two months at your expense. Many of them know me, greet me, thank me and now come to work for me every day - a whole volunteer center has been formed here in the lobby. Fellow villagers demolish things, conservation. I buy cereals, household goods, potatoes and everything that people need. ADRA (Adventist Development and Relief Agency) paid for the factory for a month, they baked bread for the settlers, the local mill gave me 250 kg for free. flour, and another volunteer got us a thousand goose eggs! So people come every day for bread and we talk to them. Because they need not only carnal bread, but also spiritual bread. They want to talk to someone, share the fact that their house is gone, how they ran away barefoot ... this girl is 3 years old, a rocket fell into a neighboring building and wounded her with shrapnel.

Seventh Day Adventists

24832573 / 448

Thank you for sending financial assistance for the second time. Indeed, the funds have already run out, because these two months there was an intensive influx of migrants, and we distributed aid to 5-7 families every day. I counted about what I wrote: with your money we fully helped 100 families with 300 adults and 150 children! This is approximately not taking into account the cost of gasoline and isolated cases. Now the influx has slept a little, but those who live here for 2 places, now need again. Some give in the second round, some ask what is over - I add. Now people need to change clothes, because they were fleeing in the winter, and the heat has come - fellow villagers are taking away their things, just a good opportunity to clean the attics and give to those who need it.

Recently there was a Volunteer Day, then familiar acquaintances greeted us. - Nice. One woman peeked into a bag full of groceries and shouted, "Wow!" and wept.

Glory to Jesus Christ. Congratulations, dear employees of the Samaritan Bag, on this day our officials have purchased and formed almost 60 food packages, which were distributed to people in need, namely the elderly, and who were forced to leave their homes due to hostilities or occupation, these are people with small children and those in poor living conditions. We also bought various medicines that people needed, that is, almost twenty people. In our city there is a great need for drinking water, because there is no more two weeks of water. We want to deliver water to those who cannot physically do it themselves. We are amazed at how willing people are to receive help and the Word of God. church "life"

36079562 / 453

Many thanks to the brothers and sisters of the Samaritan Bag for your participation in serving our country and our Church at this difficult time. God has guided our church in this special way. At first, when we received funds from you, we did not know what to do with them: many people left our church and our volunteer ministry was not developed. We were already thinking of joining another church to help them. But later in the Khimik Palace of Culture in Rivne, where we rent office space, the city authorities opened a clothing center for temporarily displaced people. We met the responsible people of this center and asked them if people needed products. We were told that they ask very often, but they don't have any. Then we decided to make a delivery point in our office. Many members of the church immediately agreed to participate. First we made 20 packages for the test, then 50. And they all left, there was no need to look for people, they came themselves. Then one of our brothers, who is a very strong evangelist, suggested that evangelism be given along with the distribution of food, and he knew exactly how to do it. And everything went very well. Today we distribute 100 food packages three times a week, we divide people into 3 groups of more than 30 people, each group has its time, and while people register, they sit and listen to the Word of God, then prayer. Our church members say that we have, as Christ did, trough the bread and teach by the word. Thank you very much again for your participation, may God bless you. If we have the opportunity to join this cause, we will be very grateful, because many people are still coming with the need, and our opportunities are running out. Pray for Ukraine that the war will end and people will not need this service with food packages that we are currently conducting

Svitlo Evangeliya

26282214 / 454

Thanks to the funds from the Samaritan’s Bag, our church is serving people in the occupied territory in this difficult time in their needs and problems. in which people were taken from the occupied city to the bus. People were evacuated and food was delivered 4 times. They refueled the bus (there was an export of people to western Ukraine) and cars. Humanitarian aid was provided in Balakliya, Pyatigorsk, Verbovka, and district camps). The city is now closed to entry. It’s hard to come in… But we still find ways to bring medicines and food to people in need. Our brothers and sisters have repeatedly come under fire, but the Lord is merciful and He keeps. We help with food packages, medicines, financially. We hold worship services in three places in Balakliya (at the temple, in the city center and near the camps), because people are afraid to move long distances. Unbelievers began to come. We pray for God's opportunities in ministry. It is very difficult, but we believe that nothing is impossible for God. Thank you for such a tangible financial support of our ministry!!!! May the Lord richly bless you and reward you a hundredfold!!!

Shlyah Lyubovi

25838394 / 455

Church of the Way of Love Ovruch, thank you very much for financial support and prayers, thanks to your support we were able to do many good deeds for people, for the Lord Our city is located 30 kilometers from Belarus in the north of Zhytomyr region. missiles - bombings, in the city and in the villages. From the first days the church was involved in supporting the people of our community, our prayer house served as a bomb shelter for 60 people for many days, thanks to the support we fed these people in the church. Medicines have also run out in the city and we, as a church, have set up a "medicine aid point". People were constantly stressed, there was high blood pressure, heart problems, and many people died because of it. The church was a point of salvation, helped by prayer and medicine. We also evacuated people from our city to western Ukraine and abroad. People are very grateful. During this time, immigrants from Bucha and Irpen moved to our city, and we helped them with food. More than 1,000 people received assistance. Thank you very much, God bless you.

May the Lord abundantly bless you, for your good heart, restore your needs, with respect, the team of the church "Source of Life" in Kharkiv.

Church Christians Seventh Day Adventists

23297965 / 465

We truly thank the Seventh-day Adventist Church for its financial support during the war. Thanks to your support, people were helped: food kits, hygiene products, medicines, baby food, and multiple evacuations were carried out. Experience-1 During the shelling and bombing of Sumy, 11 people (including 6 children) were taken away in a small car. we prayed asking the Lord to save. We saw shots and bombs explode, but they were all taken out and unharmed. The children were frightened but have already undergone rehabilitation. If they had not been taken out that day, it is unknown what would have happened a day later because their place of residence had been damaged. Experience-2 Thanks to financial support, medicines were purchased for patients who could be provided. They thank you for salvation through medicine. When they learned that this was done in the name of God and their lives changed, they said teach us to live as you do. These people are now studying Bible lessons. Experience-3 4-year-old girl who was left alone her parents died, now we help her, provide for all needs.

Seventh Day Adventists

24832573 / 466

Today 5 more families received help. Mom and daughter came home and took another picture and sent me a photo. And one woman was so happy that she looked anxiously at the package, I couldn't ask her to stand for the photo.

tsybly

25668549 / 467

Anna Pavlovna, 91 years old, lying down. Five years ago my legs gave out. No kids. The husband died a long time ago. No relatives or friends either. She lies by herself in a house that has begun to fall. The house has not been renovated for a very long time. She began to open up more, to tell what was wrong in her life and what she would like to change. We told her about different biblical heroes, and said that this has already happened and is repeated in the lives of many people. A woman is open to God and accepts everything that she is told about Him. We gave her the New Testament, it lies next to her bed, we see that she is reading it. She is always glad to see us and always asks God to pray with her and for her. The neighbor who looks after Anna Pavlovna always welcomes us with joy. She is moved by the fact that strangers began to visit the old woman and bring her food packages. She, too, listens attentively to every word about God. A neighbor brings, if possible, food for Anna Pavlovna. The neighbor's son comes to heat the room where Anna Pavlovna lives. She was very happy to see us and get help. Glad someone remembers her.

CERKVA “Hrystovogo Voskresinnya”Stovpiv

39327015 / 468

Palms of hope Children's palms ... If you think they can !? So small ... no, not even tender - tiny. Eleven children are brought up in our family-type orphanage: two biological and nine foster children. Ten of them are under ten years old. Interesting, funny, noisy, but sometimes they still remember the sad pages of their childhood memory. Once six-year-old Elijah, sincerely rejoicing in a delicious dinner, suddenly remembered that once he had nothing to eat. So he wandered around the garbage cans and looked in the trash: "Some bread ..." This story was an unpleasant burden on the soul, but it was from it that the new story of "palms of hope" began. Little Elijah and the rest of the kids help their mother bake bread to give to poor people who, like them, are looking for this piece of bread, the "edge" of hope, love, help in this life. Children, especially Elijah, are very happy that they, even with their little hands, can somehow help people. And today they are just happy !!! After all, their palms are firmly pressed against such wonderful surprise boxes, wrapped in a magic ribbon from the "Bag of the Samaritan"! They had a childhood without bread, let alone gifts! Some of them have health problems. Elijah suffers from certain mental disorders. So we brought all the necessary medicines, detergents and diapers for our youngest baby. We truly thank YOU for YOUR palms of kindness, hope and love, which have been extended to our Ukraine and its children for so many years. Thank the LORD for YOU, YOUR example and YOUR work!

Our team welcomes migrants from the occupied territories who have been forced to leave their cities and villages due to active hostilities caused by military aggression by the Russian Federation. For the most part, people are left homeless because many houses have been hit by shells and people have been left on the streets without livelihoods. Thanks to the cooperation with the "Samaritan's Bag" and your financial participation, we complete food kits, personal hygiene items, essentials, clothing, as well as baby food and diapers for mothers with children. Before distributing food kits, we evangelize adults and children separately, after which we distribute Samaritan's Bag boxes. Thank you sincerely for putting your brotherly shoulder in this difficult time and for your open heart to help people in the eyes of grief, tears and pain to have encouragement, support, hope and God's participation in this difficult and cruel time. God bless you!

We thank the mission very much for the opportunity we have been given on behalf of all these people who thank us. There are more than 1,000 migrants in the city, except for those in nearby villages. A lot of people come. From the most diverse parts of Ukraine, in particular from the infamous Bucha, Irpin, Gostomel, and even from Mariupol, which escaped from there. Food, hygiene products are a vital necessity for people who have lost their homes, jobs, and their usual way of life has changed dramatically. At the beginning of the war, local authorities partially helped people when there were not so many of them. Now in our church the main point of help for IDPs, if not for your financial help, we would not be able to help, because those resources that were not enough to cover such a large number of people! We try to help with food more if people ask for help with medicine, we buy medicine, sometimes with shoes, clothes, because someone escaped from the bomb shelters and could not take anything with them ... People are very grateful, bless, wish not to experience what happened to them. And everyone dreams that it will end ... It was written to me by a woman. Good afternoon! Our family is from Kharkov, we are 5 people. We are very grateful to the kind people who sheltered us and to you for helping us with our products. We left Kharkov on March 4 and arrived on March 8. Assistance to migrants is not yet paid, so your help is invaluable to us! Thank you so much for taking care of us!

Tserkva Hrista Spasitelya

24105560 / 486

We thank the Samaritan Bag for significant help to our church. Thanks to your funds, we are able to buy food, prepare food, feed refugees and residents of the city of Kherson who are under occupation. We will also be able to continue to support our citizens in these difficult times by purchasing cereals, bread, vegetables and everything they need. We are currently negotiating the purchase of beds, mattresses and bed linen so that people can have decent conditions for a temporary stay in the basement of our church, which serves as a bomb shelter for people and their children during the war. Thanks to you, we can also now pay large utility bills, including the use of large quantities of water and electricity used for lighting and space heating. Thank you for everything! May our Heavenly Father bless your mission and protect you and your families! May the Lord bless you abundantly! You are special! Thank you very much! Hold on and believe in victory!

RELIHIINA GROMADA GJVISNOI CERKVU HVE MISTA KORETS

37344321 / 487

We are grateful to the Lord and to you for this help and support for our ministry in Ukraine. Were it not for this help, I am afraid we would not have the means to serve the needy, the refugees, and the children of our area. Today is a very difficult and stressful life in Ukraine. We are grateful to God that He did not leave us even in this difficult time. Personally, our mission station now serves to receive refugees for overnight stays and to live in our house of prayer. And also in the delivery of humanitarian aid to the east of Ukraine, where districts and villages are now overcrowded with internally displaced persons. With the money you donate, we can cover fuel, which is now catastrophically expensive, to deliver aid to those churches that are in dire need of humanitarianism and unable to cover fuel costs. Funding for the needs of refugees in our house of prayer is also included here. The expenses of serving the children and adolescents who regularly attend our Sunday school are covered by the finances that God has blessed us with through your generous heart. We were able to help one needy family to buy spring children's clothes. Thank God and you that we have the opportunity to have and give to others. Bless you.

Tserkva hristiyan viri Evangelskoyi p'yatidesyatnikiv

24177588 / 499

Church HVEP s. Young. Our meeting with Svitlana's family from near Kyiv happened by accident, but I believe it was necessary, because this family really needed help. The unfortunate people were waiting for the explosions in their house, but when the house across the street was destroyed, they realized they had to flee. After waiting another 2 days at a dacha in the woods, the family decided to go to western Ukraine, taking their friends and their children with them on the way. With tears in her eyes, Svetlana told how before the Russian invasion she opened her veterinary shop, paid off the last debts and delivered the goods, but in an instant all the plans and dreams were ruined by the war. The man brought them to a man who offered them shelter, and he returned to Kyiv region. Svetlana cried in despair and told her that she did not know where they would return, because the roof of the house had been raised several times due to the explosions, and it is unknown whether it will survive. These people desperately wanted to escape and therefore did not even take with them the most necessary things, sorry for the details, but one boy did not even have to change underwear, and clothes were already dirty - no other in them For these two families were purchased: food, bowls, buckets, powders, personal hygiene products, for children - stationery, diapers, chocolate and linen. Another small help was the purchase of products, which will later be sorted and sent to Chernihiv region. Thank you so much for your help, you have no idea what it feels like to know that you are not alone and to be able to help others.

41828638 / 500

Thank you for your financial help. Here we are serving the refugees (photo)

BLAHODAT',JEKHB,m.Kovel

34752286 / 501

The war was a test and a challenge for many in our country. Our local church, like many other churches, never stood aside when there was a need to help, serve, care for the needs of others. Our city is an important railway junction, through which many evacuation trains pass, we met people, fed, helped with settlement, treatment, registration or further transportation to the border with Poland. A part of the prayer house was set up for the accommodation of the settlers, and some other rooms were set up for the same purpose. Completed and sent transport with the necessary things to Chernihiv and Severodonetsk. The funds received from the Samaritan's Bag were of great help in these matters.

Our sisters for the military sewed thermal underwear, hats, gloves, unloading. Thank you for the finances we used them in the name of Jesus Christ.

"Ruth" Religious community of Evangelical Chtistians_________________________________________________________

35073528 / 503

The Church of Ruth thanks the Lord for helping the Samaritan Bag financially. Because of this, we were able to serve the brothers and sisters of the church and the people of Kharkiv. With these funds we bought food, the residents of Kharkiv, especially those in need, held children's camps for refugees from Kharkiv region. The team of volunteers transported refugees and passed on the Gospel to many people, which we believe will surely heal their hearts and give them the strength to overcome difficulties in these difficult times. Personally, listening to everyone's story, my heart breaks with pain for those people who have learned the great grief brought to our Ukraine by the "Russian world". And I want to share one of these stories with you. Anatoly, the so-called new acquaintance of mine, lost his leg and hearing from an enemy shell explosion that was dropped in a residential area near the ATB. The story of this terrible tragedy, said his wife Anatoly, because he completely stopped hearing. "On February 24, the war began and time stopped for every Ukrainian. People began to leave the city. However, we are already old and did not have the opportunity to leave, so we stayed put. Between shelling and bombing, we periodically left the house to buy bread and food. That's how on March 12 Anatoly went to the store to buy bread and find out about possible humanitarian aid. And after a while, when he came out, there was a loud explosion near our house. It seemed that the house would be built in an instant. At that time, I realized that the rocket hit somewhere very close. And there was only one prayer to God, so that nothing would happen to my Tolik. One hour passed ... two ... three ... and he was gone. I couldn't find a place for myself, because my heart felt that something had happened to my husband. I don't even know how I survived that night. It seemed like an eternity. And as soon as morning came, I started calling all the city hospitals, looking for him. He was in the 17th hospital, where his leg was amputated. During that terrible explosion I heard, my husband received shrapnel wounds. His leg was torn to pieces and one of the fragments pierced the side of his abdomen, but thank God that the wound was not fatal! He cried out in pain and cried for help. And one family, seeing him, took him to the military, who provided first aid and took him to the hospital. Doctors made every effort, however, and could not save his leg. Later, as it turned out, Anatoly lost his hearing. He was in the hospital for a month. And when he was discharged, I could not recognize my Tolik in him. He was like that "budulai" and completely gray. Now we have moved to a private house, which is located near our apartment. Good people helped us a lot. But my Anatoly does not lose hope and dream that very soon, thanks to the necessary prosthesis and hearing aid, he will be able to walk and hear again, and I thank the volunteers of the Church of Rufus who help us with food and support us financially and spiritually. " like our Anatoly and Valentine very much, therefore, our church is infinitely grateful to the Lord for your sacrifice, and that you and I have been able to share this pain with these people and comfort them with the Word of the Lord by transmitting the Gospel through us!

cherkva EHB s. Shpaniv

26298706 / 504

the funds were assistance in serving the displaced and needy. They were used to arrange accommodation for migrants, and part of the funds was used for transport services to evacuate people. Food kits for needy people were purchased

Ukrainian Greek-Catholic Church Parish of the Holy Maccabean Martyrs Beryslav city Kherson Region.

34874661 / 505

HUMANITY EXAM My dear friends! We had to live in a crucial time. Right now, each of us is doing a very important thing in our place. And we are all working together for our victory. Until recently, our charitable kitchen-dining room provided the necessary food for those people whom we used to call the least socially protected categories of the population. Our visitors were mostly single elderly people, large families, people with disabilities. But the war changed everything. Now, those who were never considered poor were often left homeless, and those who never ran out of bread sometimes ate nothing for several days. And now we, as Ukrainians, as Christians, help each other. And we, as a parish, as a Beryslav community, are doing what we can to help those in need. Each of us today is taking an exam for humanity, for authenticity, for patriotism. Hundreds of people who want to eat come to our doors every day. And we thank God that we can serve them and have the opportunity to help. In the last two weeks, 1,721 people received ready meals in our canteen. And the dining room itself has now become, without exaggeration, a refectory church, because it operates within the painted walls of our Berislav shrine. I bow low to all our compatriots who tirelessly serve on this front of love - cooks, volunteers, benefactors and donors. Your help is invaluable! I want to bend down and kiss your hands, which, despite the fatigue, find, prepare and distribute all that we treat our visitors. Thanks to our partners Samaritan's Purse International Relief, who found the funds to purchase products. I am proud of you, dear compatriots! May the Lord generously bless each and every one of you! PS Our kitchen is open daily at 1 p.m.

Ukrainian Church Pentecostal of village Puzhnyky

26263725 / 506

We truly thank all the donors for their help. Thanks to these funds, assistance was provided to 70 families who needed and suffered from the war and currently live in the villages of Olesha, Dolyna, Deleva, Mostyshche, Zhyvachi, Petrov and Isakiv of Olesha OTG. We also helped 10 families of victims and needy in Horodenka district, where our missionaries work. Assistance was mainly provided in the form of food, clothing, medicines, hygiene products, necessities (blankets, pillows, bedding, etc.). Assistance was also provided to three family-type orphanages (one family of 17 people, second - 14 people, third - 11 people) who were evacuated from Donetsk region. In addition to material aid, spiritual literature, the Gospels, and Christian newspapers were distributed. Prayed for the people. Thank you and your friends for the opportunity to preach in this way, both in word and deed. May God bless everyone.

24177588 / 522

Our Church of the Pentecostal Evangelical Christians v. Molodavo also joined the organization of assistance to the people of Chernihiv, amounting to 100 food packages. The realities of our time are that we are currently at war on two fronts: our brave warriors are defending the Ukrainian land from Russian invasion, and we, ordinary people, are helping to fight hunger and destruction. Every woven camouflage net, every loaf of bread, every donated hryvnia is another step towards freedom and peace. Apparently, each of us could never have imagined that in our time, in a prosperous, fertile Ukraine, the word "famine" will be heard, in Ethiopia, North Korea, Haiti, yes, maybe, but not here. And if our help can make someone full and save from hunger, it will be our little victory - mercy over poverty, light over darkness. The Bible says, "He that hath a good eye shall be blessed: for he giveth unto the poor of his bread" (Proverbs 22: 9).

KOOC EHB

23902886 / 531

We are very grateful for the help, because with the help of these funds we were able to help about 10,000 IDPs who stayed in our area, giving them food kits that they desperately needed.

Slovo Zhyttia (Word of Life)

26532355 / 532

Our village is a suburb of Zaporizhia, where people from the occupied territories have been fleeing in recent months. Our village was no exception, there were many new families who came without anything, who lost everything, and who were separated by war. When the war broke out, the only thing the church ministers wanted was not to miss the tremendous opportunity to get in touch with the locals, to support them, to calm them down, to remind them of really important things, to "tune in to the heavenly wave." God saw this desire, blessed the Samaritan with his bag, brought him to the right social worker, and led him. Social worker only after personal acquaintance - began to give contacts to families in need. At the moment there are more than 60 of them. Families are different ... some barely make ends meet, some are left without the help of relatives, some were uncomfortable taking help, some kissing the Bible, saying God loves us and has not forgotten, some are looking forward to leaving soon to finally reveal gift and package and see what is there, someone shares the pain that the child is not baptized in childhood and asks how to live with it further, someone cautiously begins to smile, someone asks for more "supplements", someone can not believe that help just like that and in return nothing should be given, someone at first refuses to take, thinking that there is some trick in it, someone in ten minutes has time to open his soul. Emotions are positive, sincere gratitude is felt, openness to listen to the Word of God! It is clear that people will not immediately repent for a piece of bread, but the reputation of the church, acquaintance with its light and good deeds - will bear fruit. We also financially helped several families to leave the war zone. Someone stayed in our village, one family with 2 small children was helped to travel to Western Ukraine and find housing there. They took care of our grandparents in our village, who were left alone because their families went to safer places and countries. We did not ignore the children with cancer in our city, those who are in hospital and continue to stay there, unable to leave. We bless them with sweet and fruity sets as well as Samaritan Bag gifts. In total, during the week we managed to financially or productively support 10-15 families with children, 8-10 grandparents, once a month children with cancer, and 50+ children in Yuliivka. The pastor of the church, Kostenko Oleksandr, says: 'Personally, I am happy that helping people in this way - the church library emptied the Bible, the New Testament. It is possible to see people who do not have it at all and finally understand the attitude of people towards God '. Larysa Bykova, director of the Julius House of Culture (with whom we worked before the war) writes: 'Good evening! We are from Ukraine! Thank you very much! I announced to the children that you will come to us for Easter, that you have collected gifts. The answer was stunning. "No need for gifts, better let them come to play together, drink tea." Yuliivka is a village outside the city of Zaporizhia, not occupied, but flew in several times. Located 20 km from the city, but the village is a village. There are several streets, everyone knows each other, everyone is scared, but almost no one left, because there is nowhere. There are 54 children in Yuliivka, so they were blessed with food, medicine and gifts. Almost every family ends the conversation with the phrase 'Thank God'. We are trying to continue working with them, looking for new ways to provide humanitarian and financial assistance, and to support these families. Thank God! May the Lord abundantly bless those who sponsor these good works.

Preobrazhenie

25364006 / 533

Peace to you! We greet you with the love of the Lord Jesus Christ! We thank Christ for your location, through your participation in helping people and the church who suffered from the hostilities in the Luhansk region. These funds were used to evacuate people, and food packages for people who remained in the city of Lysychansk, as well as for migrants from the Luhansk region, and partly from the Donetsk region, and the purchase of medicines. The following products were purchased: Pasta, bread, sugar, cereals, sunflower oil and much more. Also, there is no electricity in the city of Lisichansk, and for charging phones and cooking on electric stoves, gasoline was purchased for a 40-liter A-92 generator. In the city of Shepetovka, Khmelnytsky region, 30 displaced persons live in the church, and there is not enough food because the church prepares sandwiches for people who travel by evacuation train, and we decided to help this church at the fraternal council, since they once received our church members and placed and provided warmth and comfort. I have never seen or met the pastor of the Shepetivka church, but he received 9 people from our church and 2 of them are my wife and pregnant sister... I am very grateful to God for such brothers and sisters who did not stand aside and helped our members churches in difficult times… God gives opportunities to serve people, and we were able to help 450 families with food, bring 55 people out of them 6 disabled people, 10 children, and also help 1 person in an operation, bring water to 60 families who were left without water in the city. Many thanks to you all and blessings from our Lord. May God supply all your needs. With love Church of the Transfiguration. Sincerely, the minister of the church Alexander Cherneta

Religious communities church of Evangelical Faith Pentecostals v. Sokil

38741439 / 534

The funds received from the Samaritan's Bag were used to support families in which men are defending our state, refugee families, families in difficult life circumstances. The families were provided with material assistance in the form of food kits, including flour, sugar, oil, etc. Each child received a gift from the Samaritan Bag, which was a testament to Jesus' concern for the children as well. We believe that the help provided by the organization will help make people's hearts more open to the Word of God. Families with tears thanked God and Christians for not leaving them alone and supporting them in this difficult time for their family and Ukraine.

Voskresinnia

37198237 / 535

When the war started, it was difficult to describe the experience, because it had never happened before. We prayed that the funds would be directed correctly. They had the opportunity to bless people of retirement age so that they could pay for apartments. Our church also serves with drug addicts. There is a third stage in this ministry, when a person goes to work and lives together in an apartment. This means that we teach them to socially adapt to society. During the war, they lost their jobs and had nothing to pay for the apartments they rented. We have three such apartments. They also gave a certain amount to families who also needed financial support due to losing their jobs due to the war. It is impossible to describe in words what people experienced when they were blessed with money. People cried and everyone said…. God thank you! I knew, I knew you wouldn't leave. We thank all the people who served our church with financial support. Praise our God!

Thank you for supporting our city, our church and the people who seek refuge in us ??

Ukrainian Christian Pentecostal Church, Chervonograd,Lviv region,Ukraine

25547260 / 540

We are very thankful for your financial support .We appreciate your sacrifice and care about ukrainian people. Our main tasks in volunteering of our local church are: 1) sending buses with humanitarian goods( food,medicaments,hygiene products) to places where are actve hostilities(for civil people, soldiers, hospitals).So it needs finances for fuel, buying food and etc. 2) giving living places and having food for our refugees 3) giving dinners for our local soldiers who are at our local blockposts We have helped refugees to go abroad and also we have helped them to be transported to the West of Ukraine earlier . If you want more photos or videos please write us on the email kozhapavlo@gmail.com. Let God bless you and your families.

Tserkva yevanhelskykh khrystyian "Kovcheh" m. Zhytomyr

25838081 / 541

Good afternoon, very grateful to the Samaritan Sumy, that at such an unfortunate time for the Ukrainian people, you did not stay aside, but indeed, as our Lord taught us, you came to the aid and support of the local churches of Ukraine. Thanks to this help, we were able to do much more good deeds and in turn support the needy. In the first days of the war, our church helped evacuate people to western Ukraine and European countries. We also took mothers with children, the sick and elderly parishioners from our church out of the city. And they left only men and those who did not want to leave Zhytomyr and stayed to work with us on the spot. When people were taken west, they in turn arranged for a humanitarian and took them back with luggage to help those in need. Already in March, we began to deal with the families of migrants in our area. They were helped with food, hygiene items and clothing, as many of them simply left the bomb shelters without even being able to go home to pick up their belongings. Most of them were people from Irpin, Bucha and Borodyanka, who did not want to go far, so they came to Zhytomyr and many to Korostyshiv. That's why we went every day and gave them, first of all, the necessary things for life, as well as offered them communication. You know, during this time we saw how the Lord works in the hearts of Ukrainians, so many of them listened to the Gospel of the grace of God's salvation. It was a very joyful time for us, and when you read the news or see what is happening somewhere, there are only tears in your eyes and tightness in your chest, but the Lord has given us comfort, inspiration and hope through this work. We took care of the families of the migrants all March. And when the Kyiv regions were liberated from occupation, we have been paying more attention to trips there since the beginning of April. The closest region to us is Makariv district. There people have been under occupation for a whole month and there are villages where half of the village is completely destroyed, somewhere not so much, but people all suffered morally, many physically. Many different organizations came here and abroad to help, but people needed more moral and spiritual support. So my brothers and sisters and I went there almost every day for the first two weeks, and then several times a week. There are already people there who are always waiting for our arrival to listen to the word of God. We even try to get them to eat, so we prepare and bring with us some delicious homemade dishes, or pies and dumplings, because we see how difficult it is for them still morally. They are exhausted and even many of them do not want to eat, let alone cook something delicious. Therefore, with our support we want to show them that someone needs them, and most importantly they are precious to our Lord. In parallel, we are working with centers for migrants, preparing programs for children, showing a film about the birth and death of Jesus to parents and preaching the Gospel to all. Thank you very much for meeting you and for such timely support. In fact, now more than half of the church is not in the city, but the remaining few still work, so with the support of the Samaritan Bag could freely spend money on food and industrial goods, and a lot of money was needed for fuel to travel to other regions, and especially the evacuation of people. Thank you very much, Lord, for you !!!

Adventist seven'th day Church

35820355 / 542

Our community helps refugees and the elderly during the war. Not far away in the village of Mykolayivka, B-Dniester district, there is a large family: five children whose mother is paralyzed. We constantly bring them food and financial aid. We have refugees from the east of Ukraine, to whom we also provide food and medical assistance: we provide money for medicines. We have up to ten such families.

Our church used the money to buy food and distribute it to needy people, large families, the elderly, those who have lost their jobs and church members.
