We would like to share one of the testimonies: "Good afternoon! My name is Anna, I'm from Kherson. I live with my mother, she is 70 years old, she is disabled. Since the beginning of the war my mother's pension was withheld and I lost my job. , we didn't have enough money for food, but thank God you helped me a lot with the food. Thank you very much. " We thank God and the Samaritan Bag Mission for the opportunity to serve the unbelievers and their people in the Church at this difficult time.

Rozhysche Evangelical Baptist Church

25944110 / 545

At the church we created the Joseph's granary fund and organized a team of volunteers. Some of the proceeds were used to purchase products, medicines, detergents and hygiene products in Poland and Ukraine, and we use them for people's needs. Refugees live in our church. We also serve the refugees who are in our city. We try to provide for their physical and spiritual needs. We help with food in school canteens that feed displaced persons and bake bakery products for the Armed Forces. Thanks to the funds received, the Church of the ECB in Rozhysche provided the following assistance: - Periodic distribution of food kits for refugees living in Rozhysche; - Assistance with drugs for the Armed Forces (painkillers, anti-inflammatory, hemostatic…) in the amount of UAH 3,500; - Repair of a car for a volunteer from Sumy in the amount of UAH 2,000; - Refueling of volunteer Roman in the amount of UAH 3,000, who goes to Sumy and carries humanitarian aid; - Food kits for 50 needy affected families in Sumy; - Purchase of a monocular for border guards of the Armed Forces of Ukraine worth UAH 7,000; - Food packages for large, low-income families of our city; - Address parcels to the victims in Kharkiv; - Donation of funds in the amount of UAH 10,000 thousand. to purchase a car for a separate mechanized brigade, which includes men from our city; - Purchase of a bunk bed for a family with two children from Sumy worth UAH 9,000. Displaced people go to our church for humanitarian aid and we have the opportunity to witness to them and invite them to worship. We feel that we are doing the right thing for people and to the glory of God. Thank you for the funds! With your help we can actively work and plan future activities. May the Lord generously bless those who sacrifice! Thank God! Peace to Ukraine!

ÑhF "New beginning"

We are very grateful to our constant partner for his faithfulness and sincere help for all the years of cooperation in the field of God. Special gratitude is in these days, when our Ukraine is going through such difficult times, the valley of the shadow of death! We are very grateful for such great, significant and very timely help! With this money we were able to buy food and detergents for families of social dormitories and families of displaced persons, buy stationery for classes with children of IDPs in the school house and a children's program with children of IDPs in Beregovo, for children in social hostel and classes with them, were able to pay for gasoline for transport in order to deliver humanitarian goods from abroad, bought a speaker with a microphone for classes with children on the street and even distributed the rest of the funds for gasoline for volunteers who carry goods to the warehouse! All praise to our Lord Jesus and great thanks to Him for this, and may God bless the families of those who sowed and sent money so that we can receive such significant help in these times !!! "RELIHIYNA HROMADA TSERKVY BOZHOYI "DOBRA ZVISTKA" MISTA LYMAN

39115456 / 547

Not a quiet time has come to the Donbass. It became impossible to continue living a normal life. The sound of exploding shells alone is terrifying. And when it comes to young people, children who still have to live and live, you have to make a choice and look for a more peaceful place. So it was decided with these young people. Most of them are relatives. But among them there is one guy, a teenager, Yaroslav, who can be called an orphan with living parents. Each of them lives his own life, separately from each other, and Yaroslav lives his own. There is no one to take care of him. They were evacuated to Transcarpathia, in one of the villages they found an old house where no one had lived for a long time, they cleaned it, repaired the water supply, gas column, kind people helped whoever they could and the guys settled down. Glory to the Lord and gratitude to people for compassion and care. The local church supports food and is always there.

"RELIHIYNA HROMADA TSERKVA YEVANHEL?S?KYKH KHRYSTYYAN-BAPTYSTIV "DIM MOLYTVY" MISTA SLOV'YANS?KA

35957586 / 548

For seven years now, a team of missionaries has been serving in the villages on the front line. Preaching the Gospel, helping people living in depressed areas of the Donetsk region. With the advent of the active phase of hostilities, the situation deteriorated sharply. Many people have evacuated to safer places. Other people remained where they were. It’s a pity for them to leave their old, but native housing, and there’s really nowhere to go. So we continue to visit these people with food assistance. We meet, hug, pray for them and expect peace. We are very grateful to all not indifferent people who support us in this ministry. God bless you.

"RH KHTS "SLOVO ZHYTTYA" M. SIVERS?KA"

25795041 / 549

It became very difficult in the front-line settlements. Shops closed, no water, no medicines. People who have made the decision to stay put have to literally survive. Our team delivers humanitarian aid to these villages in the form of food, water, hygiene and medicines. It is an indescribable joy to see the faces of people receiving hope for life. Accepting with gratitude, they understand that not everything is lost in this world, there are people who can not sleep when others are malnourished, there are those who think about them. We thank all the donors, your work is not in vain.

KHRYSTYYANS?KA TSERKVA "SLOVO ZHYTTYA" SMT VELYKA NOVOSILKA

26257825 / 550

From the line of demarcation in the Donbass, we take families with small children to western Ukraine. The journey is so long that it takes two days. We stopped for the night at the house of prayer. After a warm welcome, sleep and breakfast, we set off again. They have never traveled this far before. Tired but happy to be in relative safety, the children patiently waited for the end of the journey. Some women were also brought medicines necessary to maintain health. Now it is almost impossible to buy them there, pharmacies are closed. Let's do good together. Thank you for not indifferent people.

RELIHIYNA ORHANIZATSIYA BOZHA TSERKVA KHRYSTYYAN VIRY YEVANHEL?S?KOYI "ISKHOD"M.SYEVYERODONETS?K

35217053 / 551

Evacuation from the Donetsk region of a shelter for the elderly. 21 people were evacuated to Ivano-Frankivsk region. Elderly women, some in wheelchairs, others with disabilities, and still others lying down. But when the front line approached tightly to their village, it was impossible to stay there. People were taken out together with the staff, temporarily settled in a camp site and we provide all possible assistance with food, hygiene and so on. These people need special care and it is nice to be a witness of how Christians can serve their neighbor. Thanks to all benefactors

Christian Church «New Generation» Korosten

36428190 / 556

Congratulations dear brothers and sisters! In the last 2.5 months, we have experienced several bombings in the city of Korosten. From the first day of the war, the brothers and sisters of the church volunteered to support not only the population but also the defenders. When your donation came, we had a big problem with transportation, and that money was God's answer. While we were looking for transport, we still delivered humanitarian aid to the residents of the affected areas and villages, pensioners and displaced persons. So far, more than 30 tons of hygiene products and supplies have been distributed to the local population alone. We also made the children happy when we had the opportunity to give them gifts from the "Christmas Child" program. And finally, the main thing is that we bought transport and now we can move between settlements to transport not only humanitarian aid, but also people. The funds have greatly supported us in purchasing fuel and food. Thank you for your support and for your sensitive heart! It is very important! We feel that we are doing what pleases God.

Church "The Light of life"

Congratulations to all project partners! We work in all directions! - Help the needy! -Help to those who were evacuated. -Help to those who are in the occupation of Shostka, Romny, Chuguiv, Kherson, Odesa ... - We give gifts to children who were evacuated from Sumy and Kharkiv! We are very grateful for the strong support, which gives us the opportunity to involve more people in volunteer work. A little evidence: we were approached by the Regional Department of Health with a request to refuel the Children's Resuscitation Vehicle. They have refueling coupons in the Marshall Network. but these gas stations were closed and the office in Kharkiv was bombed. we are twice per 100 liters. fuel refueled them! This made it possible to transport operable children from the occupied territories! We are constantly helping the regional children's hospital! Funds for the purchase of food for children. We help people in the war zone and in the liberated territories! We are very happy and grateful for your help and cooperation!

Thank you that many people have experienced God's love and care through you.

“Zhyva voda” (Living water church)

25896629 / 561

We truly thank the Samaritan Bag for the money sent. In this difficult time for all of us, you have become an incredibly powerful blessing to our church and community. Our church is located in the village of Dimer, which from the first days of the war until the beginning of April was under the occupation of the Russian army. Near our village, near the river Irpin, there were fierce battles for the city of Kyiv. Every day there lasted an eternity. But we thank God for you, for your finances, because thanks to them we were able to serve the people in the village. We were able to evacuate dozens of people from the occupied territories, including small children, and take them to safe areas and even abroad. Whenever possible, reliable people donated medicines purchased with the funds you sent. After all, there are many retirees among those who remained in the occupied territories. Among the people we could serve was my grandfather, who lost his sight during the war. We still take care of him with food and medicine. After the deoccupation, we are working to rebuild our village, purchase food kits for the community, and serve children who have suffered psychological trauma. Most of the finances go to fuel and food. If necessary, we continue to buy medicines for people, because in the village of Dimer pharmacies are just beginning to resume their work. Thank you for your timely support, thanks to you we can serve many people who suffered in this terrible war. We plan to organize children's clubs and hold children's camps in the settlements of Kyiv region affected by the war. Thanks for support!

1) Thank God for the money, many people lost their jobs - the financial situation is difficult, so we support people with products !! 2) The story through which God spoke and showed that He is strong, and cares about his own: We have a woman who goes to church, a man whose atheist) when we visited her, saw the need, the old rough with which they heat the house -almost not grill)) we offered to replace it with a new one, she agreed…. After building a new one, she told us a story: when she asked her husband to replace the rough one, he replied: -you pray to your God, let him do something else… As a result, God replaced and gave a new rough one powerful, works through their children))) 3) pleasantly shocked were the forcibly displaced people, in this time of war People turn to God even more, they see so much God's care for them, God feeds and clothes them, and most importantly God gives peace to the heart !! - says one of them… And we thank God that we are His messengers, thanks to you !!! Wishes from grandmothers: That you always had, and never asked, and could still share !!! That you were everything and there was no shortage….

NGO "Prisept NGO" expresses its gratitude for the funds provided in the amount of $ 5,000. For us, it was an extremely great encouragement and help in this difficult time. Our organization consists of a small team of young volunteers and has no sponsors from abroad, all activities of the organization in Lutsk were carried out through the dedicated work of members of the church "Word of Life". and it was difficult to continue the organization as before. But God miraculously took care of and opened the door to work for the benefit of our state and people, so for us it is a special mission to help people and be part of the team of the project "Bags of the Samaritan" Sincerely, the head of the NGO Timonyshyn We carried out the following work: 1) assistance to the most vulnerable groups of the population, those who lost their jobs, refugees: - clothes, food - household chemicals, - essentials. * By regions: Lutsk, village Perespa, in particular the city of Kryvyi Rih, was visited by many refugees from the east. For the Amount: UAH 52,000 2) assistance to the military: clothing and related items, means of protection, directly to Christians who have been drafted into the Armed Forces. In total: UAH 34,000 3) medicines in the amount of UAH 38,000 4)-lubricants, -car service - fuel For the delivery of humanitarian goods from Europe to various cities of Ukraine, including the East. Sum: UAH 35,000 Testimony of pediatricians from the United States who provided medical assistance: “Two weeks before the trip, we spoke with Pastor Anton and asked him where we could have the greatest impact. He helped us, took the medicine in Warsaw, transported across the border and half of Ukraine, helped deliver the medicine to its destination. Without his help and devotion, this trip would have been impossible. Pastor Anton continues to help and support others. Photo 1. Testimony of an employee of the center for refugees in Kryvyi Rih. We were not ready for the number of people who came from the south. I had friends in the west of Ukraine and turned for help to the head of the NGO "VO Prissept" Timonishin A.Yu. teams and for the people who came empty-handed and were grateful for any help. This is very important now in this very difficult time, because through such blessings we can serve even more people who have lost their homes and left the places where they were born. By helping, we get closer to complete strangers, who then become almost like a family. We also organize meetings where, in addition to receiving the necessary help, we testify to them the Word of God. It is inspiring to go further. People gladly accept the Word, we sow, and the Lord grows and uplifts. Thank the Lord that we can serve Him. And may the Lord be glorified through these works. Thank you very much for your help. Our church is once again accepting immigrants fleeing the war. Every day in the House of Prayer there are from 10 to 30 people who are fed, given the necessary things, there are children who need children's things, as well as medical examinations and certain medications. In addition to food and things, we also bought medicine, part of the money was spent on dental services, a 12-year-old girl was braced, part of the money was donated from this project, part by church members and part paid by the dental clinic itself. Essential medicines for the wounded were also procured and transferred to a medical facility. We, as disciples of Christ, work for His Glory. We also help with moral support and testify of the Savior of the world. It is gratifying that people are taking part in glorifying our Lord in worship. Glory to our Lord.

Pentecostal Volochysk

26216654 / 571

Church of Grace

26414822 / 572

The money we received from the Samaritan Bag made us able to serve our people in difficult times. We did not seek a one-time use of your funds, but reusable and long-term. Therefore, they were used to purchase equipment for canning (autoclaves, canning machines, tin cans, retort bags and raw materials for stews and porridges). We have already processed 3.5 tons of meat, made more than five thousand cans of porridge and stew and a lot of smoked products. All this was delivered to people in places where hostilities are taking place. You have become a great blessing for us !!! Thank you sincerely for your help !!!

tserkov’ “Nove pokoleniye” Ternovka

33322613 / 573

We, the volunteers of the New Generation Church in Ternivka, express our gratitude to the Samaritan's Bag for providing financial assistance. These funds have become a huge support for hundreds of people in cities where hostilities are taking place. The help that you provided to our ministry was able to cover all the costs of logistics, acquisition food, hygiene products and medicines. We would like to share one of the many stories of how the financial support of your ministry influenced the lives of people in the conditions of military operations. Dmitry Kravchenko lived in Avdiivka, but due to shelling by Russian troops, he was left without an apartment, where he lived with his old mother. Both of Dmitry's legs were amputated due to diabetes. He and his mother were evacuated to a neighboring village and were left to survive without a livelihood. Our volunteers visited this family and donated humanitarian aid: food and hygiene products. Dmitry's mother was very touched by the help provided. "The most memorable were the men's tears," said volunteer Elena. Dmitry really needs prostheses now, but due to the war there are very big difficulties in order to deliver them to him. The family thanked the Samaritan Bag from the bottom of their hearts for helping them through such a difficult time.

Istochnik jizni

41828638 / 574

Obnovlenie

25106395 / 575

One unique evacuation story. Before the war, Alisa went to Kyiv to study from work, sat in bomb shelters, how calmly she tried to break through to Zaporozhye unsuccessfully, then turned to us, we took her through several countries to Mariupol, she took her children and parents and is now going back to Kyiv. Alice has one disabled child and one of the parents too. but the evacuation process, thank God, went well and they are already safe. Thank God! Thank you for the finances, thanks to you we can evacuate dozens of people from hot spots, thank God that you exist! bless you!

Rymsko-katolycka parafia Presviatogo Sercia Isusa

26514860 / 576

Sincere thanks to the Samaritan Bag project for their great help. Financial support for disadvantaged people who have lost loved ones or homes is a great testament to the love of God and neighbor. On the territory of our church there are already many immigrants from different eastern regions of our state. Mostly these are people who are not believers or far from God. Thanks to such support we can help people not to lose hope, experience love and sow the seeds of faith. May the good God bless our common good deeds

We helped them with food, because they had no money left, everything went to her husband's treatment. We have agreed on the next meeting, we want to bring her the gospel! Thank God! NGO "Charitable Center" Trust "

42494219 / 579

Good evening! Thank you for your support. It is good that you understand us and invest in our affairs. The situation in our community is calm. We do not have military operations. From time to time we hear military planes flying by. A siren often sounds to warn us of an air alarm. We hear all the terrible things that are happening in the east of our country from people who come and from our acquaintances who live there. People come without documents, because the enemy specifically burns them. To pass the posts you need to pay money and listen to a dozen offensive words. Men are practically not released. Many people are missing. Say they were taken to enemy territory. Fighting continues in the east. Many casualties, both military and civilian. There are also soldiers from our community who have already died. Every day we have mobilization among men. They prepare people for worse times if they come. As for our work, we are doing well. There is a lot of work. Every day there are requests for help. There is now an urgent need for housing for displaced families, especially those with children. We have almost nothing to rent, everything is busy, and people are coming. Most of those who come have their homes destroyed. We continue our construction. More than 50 percent of the work has already been completed. A little more and we will be able to strengthen people. In May, we hired 12 more people. They came from a place that is now under enemy control. The aggressor hid his tanks behind their houses. We hold on! We believe in victory! We pray to God for protection and salvation! We draw strength from God! We testify to people of salvation! We try to keep in touch with children, it is often not easy to answer their questions - Why did it happen? Why was the Lord angry? Why is it so scary? It hurts everyone… Thank you for your understanding! Thank you for believing in our work and helping to save those in need. Everything will be fine! Thank you! (perhaps you have a question, write, we will be happy to answer) May the Lord thank you fully for your sacrifice, for your contribution to the lives of people thousands of miles away.

Love Healing

21164668 / 580

We continue to help people who have suffered from the war. Helped many people since the second day of the war. On the next day of the war, February 25, 30 people were sheltered. A week later, there were already about 400 refugees. At the same time, not forgetting about our church people who lost their jobs and food. Food packages were equipped, more than 600 packages were sold in a short time. Assistance was provided to cities that survived the humanitarian crisis, such as Kharkiv, Sloviansk, Voznesensk, Mykolaiv, Kyiv, Mariupol, and other funds were used to purchase cereals, pasta, pate, and other food and hygiene products, as well as diapers and medicines, and fuel. , and repairs. Plus the city where we serve in the spread of the Gospel Novodnistrovsk, Buchach, Brzezany, Ternopil. Work was carried out with the children of local churches, as well as with children displaced from the battlefields, where they received gifts from the Samaritan's bag. One of the areas of service that has now emerged is the service to the wounded in the hospital. 5680 people were sheltered on the base, 800+ were taken to the borders, 1500 people were taken out of the hotspots. 38 tons of rubber were delivered. We continue to help people in this difficult time for our people. A large number of women and children were evacuated, both from the battlefields and to the border with neighboring countries. Kingdom of God and help people. Thank you, and Franklin Graham, and the service of the Samaritan Bag for contributing to the victory. God's blessings to you with prayer for you Love and healing!

Thanks to your help and God's action through your open hearts, children feel the joy of life again, see the rays of the sun and believe that God will protect each of us! Unfortunately, there are a lot of people in our region who had to leave, who were left with nothing. With each passing day, the number of displaced families is growing and the needs are growing, but we believe that God will not leave to bless and protect, will help His children in His most wonderful way ?? Thank you for your great contribution to the family received the necessary food, care and support ???? May the Lord bless your hearts ???

New Life

23597584 / 589

Maria lived with her parents in the village of Dolgenkoe - on the border of Donetsk and Kharkov regions. It so happened that this particular settlement became the field of fierce battles for 2 months. For the first two weeks of shelling, the villagers sat in the cellars with a faint hope that it would work out. It didn’t work out ... The village was razed to the ground, the houses burned like matches. Masha's parents barely had time to evacuate, but they did not want to travel far and remained in Slavyansk together with two families of fellow villagers. Now this small commune lives with another hope that it will not be necessary to go further. The arrival of a team of volunteers from the Samaritan's Bag mission became a real holiday for children and parents. Our children are very scared. At first they played only near the open basement, - says Yegor's mother. We all, and especially children, lack positive emotions. Thank you so much for donating this! Thanks to everyone who collected and donated such wonderful gifts!

Õðèñòèÿíñüêà õàðèçìàòè÷íà öåðêâà "Ïåðåìîãà" ì. Áðîâàðè

25567854 / 590

The funds received are God's response to the needs of people inside and outside the church. After all, most were not ready for military action. Thanks to the funds received, it was possible to support people from the church - to provide the necessary food aid, to assist in the evacuation of people - to help buy fuel and food on the way. Our brothers also actively served needy and unsaved people. They bought food, medicine, baby food, hygiene products for children - diapers, for bedridden patients - diapers. As hostilities in the Brovary district were active, many villages were occupied without assistance. Our brothers were able to travel to the villages with humanitarian aid, which was purchased with funds received from the Samaritan's Bag. Sometimes, this help was the only one that people could get in remote villages. It was a great opportunity to preach the gospel, pray for the needy, and support what was needed during the war — food and medicine. Thank you very much for such help! After all, thanks to the Samaritan Bag mission, more than 500 people received the necessary help, which is very important in this difficult time for us. May God bless everyone who is involved in sowing finances in this ministry!

RO RC of Evangelical Christian Baptists

38182102 / 591

With the beginning of the war, the need for social service increased greatly. Because our community is on its way to western Ukraine. Namely on the border of Zhytomyr and Khmelnytsky regions. From the first days of the war, we faced an influx of refugees from Kyiv and the east of the country. Some asked to just spend the night and rest on the way to the border and some stayed until today. There were so many people that it was not possible to accommodate everyone. People even occupied the service hall and slept on the floor. Many had young children. Thank God we had stocks of food, diapers and some hygiene products. Now we have nothing. But people in need remain. And we truly thank the Lord that, through your financial support, He continues to use us to serve people. We constantly support more than thirty migrants and also local church members. People need food. Because most of them do not have enough money or opportunities to work and support themselves. As an example, the Terekhov family from Konstantinovka, Donetsk region. They are not believers, but the church welcomes them and serves them. They now attend all church services. Very attentive to God's word. Their sincerity and gratitude simply cannot be expressed in words. Photo Due to constant stress, many have chronic diseases, health problems. That's why people need medicine. Such as sister Galya in the photo. She suffers from pressure problems, diabetes as a result of ulcers. And there are often no drugs or no way to buy them. Photo Due to rising fuel prices, we have begun to spend most of our budget on refueling church vehicles. And some bought bicycles. Such as Sister Victoria. She is involved in our community with women with unwanted pregnancies. Before entering, she visited them in her car from home, delivering some aid. And now we bought her bike for this, in our opinion, important service. Photos The funds that the Lord has sent through you have enabled us to support, bless, give hope and show God's love to many who need it so badly now. With gratitude, Pastor Ruslan

Ðåë³ã³éíà ãðîìàäà õðèñòèÿí-ºâàíãåë³ñò³â "Öåðêâà íà Ñêåë³"

24419991 / 592

Thank you very much for your financial assistance to our community. The money came at a time when it was most difficult. We live in Cherkasy region and at the end of March refugees from Kharkiv, Donetsk, Luhansk regions began to come here en masse, before that there were already refugees from Sumy, Kyiv and Chernihiv regions. From the first days of the war, we began to actively volunteer. Our church in Cherkasy region has a Humanitarian Aid Center in the form of clothes and second-hand shoes, but they started collecting food and providing it to refugees. Many of our volunteers from the church lost their jobs, but steadily helped people with their products, served at home, helped to go abroad. But the resources ran out and that's why your money helped them pay for rent and utilities. It was God's answer to them. But we decided to spend all other funds on food. More than 700 families of various categories received food kits through our ministry. We bought products, packaged them, in cooperation with other organizations, paid for the delivery of food kits. And now the demand for products is growing. Not only migrants need help, but also local people who have lost their jobs. Other organizations working in the city have reduced the amount of assistance, so people come to our office in Cherkasy, register and are ready to wait. We also hold services for those who want to know God. It is the greatest testimony that has touched our hearts. Refugees from Sumy helped us set up a relief center and worked at this point, helping people choose the right things by giving them food packages. Then, when it was time to return home, they said goodbye with tears in their eyes, said that they would be at home as we help people and open a House of Prayer (they had never been to church before and did not know God). blessed your ministry more and generously rewarded everyone who does good deeds and multiplied what you sowed. We truly thank God for you and you for your work.

Kovcheg Spaseniya

41376417 / 593

By helping people with your food kits, you meet different life situations of people. For example, one woman had 60 hryvnias in her wallet and three potatoes at home. And at that moment she was called to get help. She came with tears in her eyes and thanked me sincerely and I had the opportunity to support her in the conversation and to testify of God. One grandmother, who was in a wheelchair, was helped with food and medicine, and in the conversation we learned that because of anxiety and loneliness, she wanted to commit suicide because she could not sleep at night. At the same time, we prayed with her and now we maintain friendly relations. In our ministry there are also people who suffered from the war (refugees), they also accept help with great gratitude, thank God for your sacrifice. Elderly people (retirees) accept this help with tears in their eyes and do not believe that they are given it for free. We always hear words of gratitude and glory to the Lord. In general, now during the war, if it was not difficult for people, they became more open to talking about God. That is, it is a blessed time for believers to serve and carry the gospel to the world.

41376417

41376417 / 594

want to share one testimony of how God saves people. We prepared a package of help for a woman in need, but when she arrived she was not found at home. We were a little upset, but we thought about everything, God's will. After that, seven days later they arrived and she was at home, but it so happened that her son was chained to the bed and could not walk because of the attack. She says go to my son, we went and talked to them about life, death and the gift of God's eternal life. After her son prayed to God with a prayer of repentance and asked the Lord to forgive his sins. And as it turned out the next day, this man died, but we believe that he is with God.

We also bought again products that we pass on to soldiers and people in the east. We have assembled a team of volunteers and thanks to your support we can be the hands of God in our country. We plan to buy a big tent where we want to place in the yard of our church, and every day to receive people to feed, clothe and help everyone in need…

Volodymyr-Volynska gromada Cerkvy Adventystiv somogo dnja

20133619 / 601

First of all, I sincerely thank the organizers of this project. The Samaritan's bag has become a lifeline for some people during this extremely difficult time of war. I want to share this experience. One girl that a man living in Germany told me about. He found my phone number and asked me to visit her. He says bring her some food. Thanks to the Samaritan's Bag project, I picked up my groceries and left. It turned out she lives with her mother and sister. Nobody works. Mom takes care of two daughters with disabilities. This senior has shaking hands and head and because of this the whole body. The disease is similar to Patkinson. She fell ill at the age of 13 and is now 24. And she says that shaking is the least of the problems, because all her muscles hurt. It is difficult to look at it without compassion. And the younger sister is mentally ill. Due to low social assistance, they live in great difficulty. So when I brought them the food they were extremely happy. This girl told me that she needed to go to the doctor in Lviv. And there are no opportunities for such a trip. Here I offered to pay for this trip thanks to the Samaritan Bag project. Gratitude could be seen in her eyes, she thanked with tears in her eyes. On the way we talked to her and her mother. Oksana was left with the question of why the Good God is so strong, and she suffers so badly. We remembered the Good Jesus, how He died on the cross for us, and that He was victorious in this struggle. When we returned to her home. She asked to come again and help her study the Word of God. She had a hope that all was not lost. That the Lord did not die for her in vain. That's why I say the Samaritan Bag project for some is the salvation of their souls in this extremely difficult time. I would like to add that our community distributes aid in the form of food, hygiene products, clothing, etc. to all those in need. The conversation was especially memorable when a woman called and said that she was from Mariupol or could not come to you and get food. Because there is a lack of social assistance, but it is necessary to have and at the same time have small children that adults do not yet understand the problems. You will remember the joy seen in the eyes of these people forever. And although the food bags were heavy, she carried them with pleasure. We received such people from different parts of Bucha, Chernihiv, Kharkiv. One man, wiping away tears, says that he has nowhere to return because his house was destroyed in front of his eyes. At the moment I am working with the city council, which provides housing for migrants, but it is in a condition that needs minor repairs. Change the gas column, wallpaper, toilet, some furniture, but the family will be able to find shelter and have a place to live. I will not forget about the young family that left Bucha only in what they were dressed in. When they arrived in Volodymyr-Volynskyi, they settled. They gathered food with our Church and intended to take it to Bucha, but after the liberation of Bucha, the Samaritan's Bag paid for his family's travel expenses to bring food to Bucha and bring clothes and necessities to this family. Therefore, I would like to thank once again the organizers and sponsors of the Samaritan Bag on behalf of those who have received and continue to receive this much-needed assistance. Through this program, many people have come to know the love of our Savior not in word but in deed. May the Lord bless you! I can't help but share with you a special experience, because it happened before my eyes. In early March, at the beginning of the war, I asked the city council to provide me with IDPs to shelter them in the House of Prayer. I was brought a whole family that escaped from that horror. They still live with us in the House of Prayer. So I say it was in front of my eyes. In this family, two daughters are twins. I do not distinguish between them. But the parents told me that sitting in the basement under fire saw how detrimental this state of affairs affects their children. One of the daughters developed mental disorders from the explosions and they decided to run away. After a month and a half that they lived with us, the Lord helped their daughter to fully recover. However, your prayers are not in vain. The Lord hears. And we pray. And I especially see that this calamity of war prompted many to seek God in the Word of God. The brother of these girls is nine years old and is studying English. In one package from the Samaritan's Bag was the New Testament in English, a pocket-sized one you would see the joy of this boy. May God bless you for such a necessary work for the Lord!

Tserkva Adventystiv S'omoho Dnya Kamianets-Podilskyi

Good day. Thank you to God and to you for the tremendous support of our organization. Thanks to the funds received, we were able to continue supporting our country's migrants from dangerous regions of Ukraine. We continue to give charity dinners, provide laundry services, offer humanitarian goods, showers, literature, hygiene products. Your funds were also used to pay utility bills. We were able to continue the reconstruction of the church premises for classes with young people and children. Plans for the construction and equipment of a hostel for 24 people for a more comfortable stay in our church have been approved. In addition, we were able to meet, make friends and support children with gifts, a program of orphans who came to our city from places where there is a war. We hold a holiday school on weekends with the children of migrants and children of our church. We cooperate with the administration of our city to coordinate assistance to people who have been forced to leave their places of residence. misto Zaporizhzhya. Tserkov " Spasitelya Christa"

41731991 / 605

Dear Samaritan's Bag Sponsors. Thank you for your financial support for our church and the churches we support. Thanks to your financial assistance, many needs in several categories have been covered. Financial assistance was distributed in several directions: 1. Financially supported the families who serve in the war zone for fuel and food packages. In total, 47 families were helped. Families serve people, take in families, cook dinners for the military, deliver food and humanitarian aid, run programs for children and older people, travel with humanitarian aid to villages such as the village of Kamenskoye, the village of Matveevka, the village of Kamysh-Zarya , s.Kamyshevakha, Orekhov. 2. 2 events were held on the basis of 2 schools, for children from low-income families, orphans, children under guardianship. Conducted an evangelistic program for the Samaritan's Bag project and distributed about 130 gifts. Food packages and personal hygiene products were also distributed to 80 families. Parents and children heard the gospel, and received spiritual and material help through this support, the love of God was manifested in a tangible form. 3. We cooperated with two kindergartens located near our church where refugees from Mariupol and other cities stayed. They bought and prepared snacks, bought underwear, helped with personal hygiene products.

Pyatihatska cerkva EHB

24610186 / 606

With the funds we received, we were able to purchase food packages for non-believing families. The Fast family - a family in difficult circumstances, a fire broke out in their house, the mother of three children lost her job due to the war, so the products for them became a testimony of God's love and a means of softening hearts to receive God's word (COST - 1200 UAH ) The Ogrynevych family is a family that is going through difficult times, the grandmother takes care of three grandchildren, has a paralyzed husband who has lost his documents, so he does not receive any payments. The family has a minimum pension for their grandmother, so it is very difficult for them. After receiving the food package, the grandmother began to encourage her grandchildren to attend children's meetings to study the word of God, and sometimes she comes herself. The Lord changes hearts, and material aid serves as a tool (COST - UAH 1,200) The Ignatenko family is a young family that had to leave Kryvyi Rih after the war after a week of living in a shelter. The migrants now live in the village of Adamivka together with the girl's mother. The work is lost, they have no special stocks. After receiving the food package, they became more open, began to attend meetings held for children and adults in their village, willingly accept the word of God (COST - UAH 800) Kozodoeva Raisa - single elderly woman 82 years old, who due to health I can't go to church, very weak. The support in the form of a food package and purchased medicines encouraged her very much, she sees the hand of the Lord in material support and sincerely glorifies Him (COST - UAH 1,700)

Pyatihatska cerkva EHB

24610186 / 610

In the pre-Easter days, an evangelistic service was held in the village of Petrivka with the funds received. The meeting lasted almost the whole day, both adults and children were invited. In total, more than 60 people gathered. They talked about the true meaning of Easter and the coming of Christ to earth, had communion with dinner, quest, games. People willingly accepted the word of God, thanks to dinner and the gifts received were open and sincere in communication. The adults said that they felt happy as a child and were very grateful for such a wonderful communication. Among large, low-income, disadvantaged families, this meeting became God's ray of light. Praise the Lord for acting! (COST - UAH 8,500 (porridge, veneer, cookies, sweet drinks, sweet gifts for each participant, as well as materials for the quest)

Khreshcatyk

35922794 / 611

Thanks to the support of the SS, we were able to prepare food packages for rich refugees. helped families reach the border. paid and are currently paying for pallets with products. which we send to cities and villages where people are left homeless. we pass products to soldiers on the front line. we buy a lot of bread and put them in grocery bags ...

Öåðêâà Õðèñòèÿí Â³ðè ªâàíãåëüñüêî¿ ïÿòèäèñÿòíèêè

26148527 / 612

Dear brothers and sisters, accept the great greetings from the Ukrainian people who are sincerely grateful to you, but that you have done so much in this difficult time for each of them. Thanks to you, our church was able to serve the people. Who just live in school and no longer have any housing. We bought medicines, they are also very important now and they are almost gone. Even just the usual painkiller. There are also many people who simply accepted Christ as Lord and we had prayers for these people. I want to tell you that this is one of the most personal people who has no family and no help from the authorities, she lived without bread for several weeks and had nothing to buy. But the Lord gave mercy and with the money you sent we bought food and were able to take it away. This man was lonely at the time and there was no one to help her. But the Lord fed her and saved her, she repented, and now she is with the Lord. Call her Anna and pray that her faith grows. Because where it is now is occupied territory. And unfortunately there is a lot of such evidence, but you can't describe all of it. We truly thank you all. But we embrace you with the love of our Lord Jesus Christ Be Blessed in God. People are in dire need of medicine, but they are not necessary now, thank you for trusting us and giving us the opportunity to work in God's field.

The Christian Church of the Evangelical Faith "Living Hope" expresses its sincere gratitude for the financial assistance provided. Thanks to this, we were able to provide charitable assistance in the form of food kits, hygiene products and medicines to families who found themselves in difficult life circumstances and difficult financial situation due to the war. These are people with disabilities, single mothers, migrants, low-income and large families, people who have lost their jobs. We also had the opportunity to go to the children living in the suburbs, tell the story of the Gospel and hand out gift boxes. We appreciate your desire to make our children's difficult lives more secure and joyful, and we look forward to continuing to work together for the benefit of those in need and to spread the gospel.

We have helped and are helping internally displaced people from Kharkiv, Zhytomyr, Volnovpha. Helped a large family of ten members, with medication for the youngest daughter who has undergone six surgeries and is waiting for the seventh. We truly thank you for your cooperation and such necessary and timely assistance. Thanks to your participation, we were able to help many people in different parts of our long-suffering country. May God give you back everything you spent a hundredfold! We pray for you and sincerely thank you for your sacrifice and example of Christianity! Our brothers went to Kramatorsk, which is suffering from shelling, and brought food packages, food and basic necessities. Especially for friends who donated, we made a video in English, you can watch it at: https://youtu.be/Xxyv-01WZRA. On the way back, the brothers evacuated people from the shelling. In our church they were fed, equipped with everything necessary and sent on to a safer place. It is difficult to imagine what these people went through: our young men, our young men, carried them out of the shelling. The house was destroyed, things were destroyed. They came only with what was on them. Both they and we are sincerely grateful for your help! Without your money, it would be very difficult to help because food and fuel prices are rising and many people are out of work. We do what we can. Your finances help us do more! Thank you for your love and sacrifice! We also want to add a link to a video report about 5 teams that prepared food and helped people in Borodyanka, Bucha, Irpin and Zahalets: https://youtu.be/99H05Uj0W6o. This is not only humanitarian aid, but also spiritual. We conduct Bible lessons with children, invite them to church, communicate with families, help with housing and accommodation. https://youtu.be/vTryaBc8OBE Thank you very much for supporting and helping to develop this ministry! May God reward you beyond measure!

"Nadia". Poliana. rn Gliboca

21432494 / 618

In fact, it is a great blessing and help. Our village is very small. Church members are probably the poorest in the village. We were very happy to be able to help. Perhaps I will write the story of two brothers. As the war broke out, about a week later, one of them felt at night that someone was waking him up and ordering him to get up, pick up his family, and leave the house. I decided to call my brother to tell. And he replied that the same thing happened to him. They realized that God had warned them. They woke up the whole family and left. We drove about 4 km and the rocket hit their house and completely destroyed it. We hear a lot and a lot of needs.

LVIV THEOLOGICAL INSTITUTE

35186413 / 622

Peace to you, dear brothers and sisters in Christ. Thanks to your sacrifice, we managed to create the most comfortable stay in one of the shelters for IDPs in Lviv. In this ministry we are working on the implementation of a comprehensive program "Child Recovery". Together with the staff of the Christian Lyceum "Living Word", we set a goal to take care of the physical, psycho-emotional, mental and spiritual needs of evacuated families with children. From the first days of the war, our educational institution became a place of temporary shelter for internally displaced persons and compatriots who left the front lines of active hostilities and went abroad. Gradually we had to buy a washing machine and dryer, freezer, shower, microwave, vacuum cleaner, iron, kettle. Thank God for sensitive hearts! Families with children found shelter in the dormitories. More than 1,000 people have taken advantage of this opportunity since March 1. People eat hot lunch; receive the necessary from clothes, means of hygiene; on a separate table families have breakfast cereals and dinners; for many, a health instructor offers a free anti-stress massage. Thanks to the literary department of the Church and the Ukrainian Bible Society, our guests have spiritual "food" for the soul (gift Bibles, children's Christian literature, booklets and manuals "Overcoming Disaster"). The evacuees receive advice from a nurse and a psychologist, talk to the chaplain or mentors about the pain, share their experiences, hear warm words of support from staff and practical advice on overcoming various social and domestic difficulties. Every day at 6 pm the pastor conducts spiritual meditations on the Word of God. Although the school continues its continuous online academic training, in order to reduce stress and adapt to new conditions for IDP children, our teachers additionally organized interesting face-to-face needlework classes, master classes, and periodic city tours. Eight IDP children are enrolled in the lyceum on the basis of free education and co-financing. The financial help from you was very timely and appropriate for Ukrainian families to feel the care of Christians around the world. Our guests are especially grateful for their first close acquaintance with God, His Word and the Church. For many, it is an invaluable experience of faith, hope and love. Pray that the mission of the Theological Institute and the Christian Lyceum of Lviv will work for the glory of God even during the war. On behalf of all recipients, we truly thank you for your financial assistance and ask you to continue to be our partners in spreading the message of salvation to people and social service. Ps We send a photo report of our activities during the war in a presentation in English. You can also see the stories of the war and the mission of the Gospel in the current environment on our official website and YouTube channel. https://www.zhyveslovo.com.ua/ https://youtube.com/channel/UC3PpAm-A5EGhZ6I4mOFm5DQ

Stavrivska cherkva Evanhelskih Hristian Baptistiv

25318039 / 623

We are infinitely grateful to the Samaritan Bag for financial support for the people of our country in such a difficult period. In our, the smallest in Ukraine, territorial community settled and fully support 180 citizens from the Eastern and central regions of our country. At the expense of the Samaritan Bag, our church purchased and distributed food, personal hygiene items, care items, and we prepare food for the people. We also pay for the second time by car (diesel fuel) to the East of the country in the city of Kramatorsk, caring people carry humanitarian aid and take people out, as well as food. It so happened that in a family living in our area who do not attend services, but the children came earlier to Sunday school, the house caught fire, destroying furniture and the house inside, in a family of four children, the mother is pregnant with the fifth. We did not stay away, we also helped by purchasing some building materials, and the brothers and sisters are repairing the house for the family. Thank you very much for your service and your good, sincere hearts, may the Lord bless you abundantly, and we will not continue to stand aside, but will serve the people, thanking you and God! God's blessings!

At the end of our meeting, we gave them Samaritan gifts, which they were very pleased with. Also, part of the money was used to buy vehicles that are used to evacuate people and deliver food, medical supplies, hygiene products to the hot spots of Ukraine - Kharkov, Donetsk, Lugansk. God also made it possible to arrange food packages in the nearest villages of our city (Mulchitsy, Bilskaya Volya, Ozirtsy) for refugees, large and low-income families who are experiencing financial difficulties during the war. We told each family about our Savior, gave the Gospel and distributed Samaritan gifts to the children. May the Lord bless your ministry in a special way and reward everyone 100 times for your generous hearts at this difficult time for all of us!

Our sister church, through which we used to receive gifts, is Good News. Next, the actual evidence. This family was brought to Kramatorsk church "The Ark of Salvation" from the shelling zone. They are waiting for a bus to the Dnieper. They were well fed, presented with two sets of toys from the Bag of the Samaritan, and they sat at ease at the table. The kids played and made inconvenience, as children should. They have a very young mother, about 27 years old. And the kids are 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2 and one year old respectively. I specifically asked! KOVCHEG SPASENIJA

19033551 / 627

Absolutely unique family from Lisichansk! The photo shows only a small part of them. One woman, about 56 years old, adopted 10 orphans, forming a Family Type Orphanage (in Ukrainian, DBST). Also, her two adult daughters took 10 children each. In total, 32 people came to us (my husband and his elders stayed in Lisichansk). These wise women managed in difficult circumstances, without water, to keep smart and clean children. We were glad to serve them, giving comfort, care and food for a short time while they were with us in the Church of the Ark of Salvation. We gave them three sets of toys from the Samaritan's Bag, and two sets of stationery. Thanks to your mission for financial assistance for our common work in God's work.

KOVCHEG SPASENIJA

19033551 / 628

The children of Lydia Petrovna Lukyanova were evacuated some time ago. She is 83 years old and for a long time she did not want to leave Kramatorsk. Until the rocket flew right into her block! We helped her with the evacuation, but then a difficulty arose: Lidia Petrovna's mobile phone broke before leaving. We urgently bought her an inexpensive used "grandmother's phone", half of the cost of which was compensated from the funds of the Samaritan's Bag. Now an elderly woman will be able to contact her children and will not get lost when the train arrives in Lviv.

Blahodiina orhanizatsiia "Blahodiinyi fond "Maibutnie ditiam Ukrainy"

36709330 / 629

team of ministers evacuated people from the areas where the fighting took place. We also bought and distributed food kits to those who stayed in Ukraine and could not buy basic necessities. In addition, part of the funds was donated to a woman who is raising two adopted children and lost her home during the war. This woman made repairs in the rented apartment and bought the necessary things for her family's life. After all, they could not take things or clothes with them - they only took documents. Because they had only 7 minutes to evacuate.

KOVCHEG SPASENIJA

19033551 / 631

In the process of evacuating Kramatorchan, we had to contact by phone more than five hundred people. Of these, 80 are disabled and their attendants. Sometimes one call lasted up to half an hour. Some approvals required up to ten calls. We had three employees on the hotline. Mobile phone bills have skyrocketed. Thanks to Samaritan's Bag for getting us through this period without financial problems. Note: The disabled list is deliberately vague to avoid the disclosure of personal information.

KOVCHEG SPASENIJA

19033551 / 633

Here, in the church "The Ark of Salvation", Bishop Anatoly Ivanovich Beskrovny asked to organize a temporary center for refugees. Initially, it was intended for believers from Severodonetsk, Lisichansk, and Rubizhne. But many unbelievers came with believers. They often had children with them. It was a very interesting time! People took a moral break from shelling in the pleasant family atmosphere of the church. They ate, slept, and then moved on. It gave us great pleasure to serve them. It was especially nice to give gifts to children from the Bag of the Samaritan.

Some people from Kyiv and other regional centers liberated from occupation are already returning home (where possible). We believe that this good seed, sown by joint efforts, will bear good fruit for the Kingdom of God, and a bountiful dinner in the field of those who sow. The percentage of the harvest and the reward will be determined by the Lord of the harvest. May those who scattered this good seed never know war and destruction!

We continue to receive refugees on the territory of the church. Then we ship to Poland and Germany. We prepare lunches and breakfasts for the military living in our community. Thank you for your financial support for the ministry of the church! Your funds help us deliver humanitarian aid to people affected by the war. Volunteers deliver food to villages, cities where people really need it. Delivery of products is expensive because fuel prices have risen. We deliver medicines, vegetables, fruits to the hospital, the hospital. We deliver to the military standing at the forefront: clothing, hygiene products, food, medicine. We are very grateful for your open heart for the people of Ukraine! PS If there is an opportunity to donate money for our service, we would like to provide a foreign currency account because the Bank has an understated exchange rate and we lose a large amount of money.

Evangelical Christians Baptist church of Rabyvyliv

22566133 / 647

From the second day of the war until today, we have accepted more than 200 people from Kyiv, Kharkiv, Izium, Kramatorsk and Lysychansk to the church base for long-term residence. Currently, 115 people live on the base. Mostly families. Every Sunday we hold services for them, every Wednesday a small group studying the Bible, also organized a service for children through sports. Funds from the Samaritan's Bag were used for food, utilities, clothing, hygiene products and medicine for displaced people. All the days of the war the church takes care of them. Your help was very important and valuable for this ministry.

EHB Stavchany

34398091 / 648

Our kitchen team for making pigeons continues to operate, we take for people - migrants in dormitories, for the military unit, just for people walking around the city ... We prepare stewed meat. Added a new service: pack food kits (video attached) in bananas. There 1 kg. Buckwheat, 1 kg. Rice cereal, 1 kg. Oatmeal, 2 kg. Vermicelli, 2 ban. Stew, 1 pack. Condensed milk, 1 kg. Onion, 1 kg onion, 1 kg a bottle of oil, 1 liter bucket of pickles, a jar of homemade jam, 1 bottle of water, 1 pack of dried fruit, 1 pack of tea, 1 kg of sugar and salt and all this sprinkled with apples, as much as will fit. Once our young brothers were taken to Zaporizhia, and now they were taken to Donetsk region. We hold evangelistic services in our village in a dormitory where migrants live. We thank the Lord for EVERYTHING! May our Lord support everyone in their work!

Seventh Day Adventists

25000490 / 649

At this difficult time for Ukraine, any help saves someone's life. We are located in the modest city of Krivoy Rog. We are located 50 kidometers from the military border of contact. And so every day someone tries to leave that dangerous territory for life for themselves and their families. Since the beginning of the war, our church has actively helped immigrants, refugees and residents of our region. Due to the fact that we were not ready for war, we were practically not ready for it. In this regard, any assistance, especially financial, provides many opportunities. For the past 85 days, our church has been buying essentials, humanitarian aid and giving it to those in need. We are also actively engaged in the fact that we take out civilians from points close to the military border on our own. We also give all those in need accommodation, food, find and send to the transport where the person who applied to us would like to go. Thanks to the help of the Samaritan's Bag, as long as we had enough funds, we were able to live such an active life. More than 5000 migrants in different city centers are now receiving help from our church, to whom we go weekly with food, essentials, personal hygiene. Now we are looking for new sponsors, since more than 30 new people contact us daily, and help it gets harder and harder for them. Despite all this, thanks to the funds from the Bag of the Samaritan, we were able to help more s from different regions of Ukraine. Also, thanks to this financial assistance, we had the opportunity to periodically help the baby home, which brought up more than 60 children aged 2 to 16 years who were brought from the occupied territories. You can see it in the last photo.

Christ The Saviour

25797643 / 651

Let's call it "Guided by Believers" The story is as follows. One family (mother and five children) With twins and a neighbor and grandparents, a total of 15 people. They lived in Luhansk region, on the border with Luhansk People's Republic. When the war broke out, they could not withstand the explosions for 15-20 days and were looking for a way to get some rest from the shots and explosions. Their homes were destroyed, and they covered distances from the bomb shelter to the bomb shelter, hoping that volunteers would come to some shelter and take them out, and 15 of them. It happened that two buses, on which Christians were volunteers, got to them - they left. Moving to Poltava region, they spent several days. Already being somewhere in the area, they came across an announcement of evacuation from the church. Read the comments on whether the organization is normal. Deciding to go and get on the buses, 15 people left for Lviv, but the next day after their arrival they were sent to Rivne, where they spent 5 days in one of the houses of prayer in the city. They are not lazy and penetrating people, so they immediately looked for a house, and when they found it, they moved to the Dubno region, being there in the village - they did not have a refrigerator. God always led them through His children, and He did not stop, because their need miraculously came to us, and with God's help we bought them a refrigerator. The refrigerator is a miracle! Price -as a gift. God is good We could also make more than 300 food packages and send them to hot spots in Ukraine. In truth, we cried when we received money, because the Lord gives the desire to do and immediately shows the finances for which to do so. Thank God!

Cerkva Hrysta Spasytelia

26526099 / 652

The funds received from the Samaritan Bag helped to organize decent living conditions for refugees: bunk beds, bedding, washing machines and dryers, equipped shower room, kitchen, and a warehouse of necessary things: from clothes to hygiene products and medicines for those in need. Food was also purchased with these funds. Food kits are provided to support the families of refugees hosted by members of our church, fresh food is prepared daily by our sisters to feed refugees, both those living in the Church of Christ the Savior and outside, financial support is provided to cover fuel costs for Refugee volunteers who work for free in humanitarian aid depots purchase specific equipment for people with spinal defects: portable toilets, feeding chairs, etc. Our church accepts people of the most vulnerable categories: women and children, orphans, cancer patients, people with various physical disabilities, the elderly, homeless people and more. We thank the Samaritan Bag for financial support and God's abundant blessings in serving the people. Peace be upon us all

We have formed a warehouse of things: from clothes to hygiene products and medicines, which we distribute to the needy. Our church helps the most vulnerable categories of the population: women and children, large families, orphans, people with disabilities, the elderly, cancer patients and more. RELIGIOUS ORGANISATION "RELIGIOUS ADMINISTRATION "DNIPROVSKA CONFERENCE OF SEVENTH - DAY ADVENTIST CHURCH IN UKRAINE"

25872250 / 671

My sincere thanks to the Samaritan's Bag project for the blessed and accessible opportunity it provided in the form of funds for real assistance to the internally displaced and those affected by the war in Ukraine. With these funds, we were able to help 327 families who found themselves in difficult life circumstances in other areas without having acquaintances or relatives, and having difficult financial opportunities. We held various events and gave gifts to the children of these families. We looked for houses for these people, made small repairs and gave them the opportunity to live in a safer area, for which they are very grateful. Vasyl and Kateryna, with their two children and parents, were forced to leave Severodonetsk with great adventures under the shelling. They did not know where to go. In the shelter program, they found a phone number and called us to spend the night. After talking to us and waking up early, they asked if they could stay in this town. We found a house for them, gave them clothes and everything they needed for living, a frying pan, a bowl, bowls, utensils, an electric kettle, an electric stove and other household items. They did not plan to stay for a long time, but the situation in their city has worsened, so they still live with us, but dream of returning to their hometown. Thank you so much for supporting both the products and everyone else for their lives. May the Good Lord abundantly Bless you in your life and ministry!

Pereyaslav

25668549 / 695

family came to Pereyaslav because of the war, mother Julia, 41 years old, children - Olya, 15, and Ilya, 13 years old. They lived in the city of Alchevsk, Lug. obl. (territory not controlled by Ukraine). In addition to the military situation, the family was pushed to leave by the suicide of their grandmother, who hanged herself in Ilya's room. At one time, Julia worked and lived with children in the camp "Dzherelo Nadiya". The children settled down to study at school. Olya studies well, and Ilya is prone to theft, skips school, does not spend the night at home, terrorizes his mother and those who rented housing to them. In this regard, they were forced to move out of the apartment they were renting. They were taken in by a sister from the church, but after several conflicts over Elijah, the unbelieving son of the sister kicked them out of the house. Soon, we were forced to urgently decide how to accommodate the family, at least for a short time. They settled in a room in a separate church building. It has not yet been possible to find other housing for them.

Tsybly

25668549 / 696

Anna Pavlovna, 91 years old, lying down. Lives in with. Tsybli. Five years ago my legs gave out. No kids. The husband died a long time ago. No relatives or friends either. She lies herself, in a house that began to fall. The house has not been renovated for a very long time. A neighbor brings, if possible, food for Anna Pavlovna. The neighbor's son comes to heat the room where Anna Pavlovna lives. She was very happy to see us and get help. I'm glad someone remembers her.

Blahovicti

36770630 / 698

congratulate you!! Our church thanks you very much for your financial help, since the beginning of the war we have remained in place and served the people. Our village is near the town of Okhtyrka (30 km.) Where battles were fought, people fled to us, scared without anything, the only thing they could take was documents. We helped them with food, baby food, diapers, hygiene, clothes. Our church also helped feed our soldiers, we took care of pastries and borscht, every day we each baked something sweet in our homes, and my husband and I then went and collected to give to the boys. The man and the pastor went to distribute food kits to those villages and towns that had already been liberated, what they saw was just awful. Unfortunately, our pastor was involved in an accident while dying for another consignment of humanitarian aid. God has given us the strength not to break down and continue to serve. Another organization received up to 150 soldiers a day, where they could wash, wash / dry clothes, and we were asked to help with washing powder and roast coffee so that the boys could taste while washing their clothes. So the next day we brought coffee with roasts. Too many people need help, many have lost their jobs, and cannot buy basic things, so we invite people to church every Sunday, where they can receive not only physical food but also spiritual food. Thanks to your help, the Lord will be glorified. Thank you to all your team, may the Lord bless your work ¦ ?.

First of all, we had the opportunity to buy fuel for cars to deliver aid to the villages and towns of Sumy and Kharkiv regions, and it also helped us to evacuate people even more to a safer place. They had the opportunity to buy several tons of products (cereals, oil, sugar) and deliver them to Trostyanets, Okhtyrka and villages near these cities. It was with your support that we were able to purchase essential medicines for retirees. Many times, bringing help to the villages, people with tears in their eyes thanked for bringing food and basic necessities. One day, while evacuating a mother with five children, it was difficult to hold back tears when they told how bombs exploded near them and killed their neighbors. They were incredibly grateful that we picked them up and helped them get to Lviv. Thank you very much for your work and support! With gratitude and prayers for you Church New Life Kotelva!

Tserkva Evangelskih hristiyan baptistIv s. Orv'yanitsya

35080451 / 706

We are very grateful to the partners of the Samaritan Bag Service for the financial help that is very important for our local church. The funds are used for volunteer trips, for fuel to Poland and Ukraine, to deliver humanitarian aid to people affected by the fighting in Chernihiv, Donetsk and Kyiv regions. One of the last trips was to the town of Avdiivka, which is on the front line, where there is constant fighting, people are forced to live in basements, and are very dependent on such assistance. There were also trips to the border with Belarus, where dry rations, essentials and medicines were distributed to our military. Food packages were distributed to low-income, large families in our village and families of migrants. We hope that we will continue to be able to help those in need. May the Lord bless you abundantly.

RORG Cerkva PROSLAVLENNYA

24889900 / 707

We truly thank you for the financial assistance we so desperately need during these difficult times of war. We used the funds to meet the needs of needy people: 1. Transport costs for the delivery of humanitarian goods from the Polish border to Irpen, Bucha, Kyiv, Borodyanka, Zagalka, and nearby villages in our area, which are under Russian occupation; 2. Purchased construction materials to cover broken roofs and to smash broken windows and doors in the homes of victims; 3. Fed hot meals to people who had nowhere to go, why, and what to cook for themselves; 4. We deliver assistance to families who are unable to come or go to aid distribution points; A family of ten living in the village of Babyntsi, Kyiv region, survived the occupation by Russian troops. According to grandmother Svetlana, it was very scary when there was a big shooting, which shook the house, frightened children cried. They hid in the cellar, but it was very damp and cold. I had to find a small room where everyone huddled and everyone sat there. A huge column of tankies and Russian armored vehicles stood on their street for a long time. Russian troops entered every house with weapons. The Kadyrovites visited their house three times. The village was under occupation for more than a month. During this time, Grandmother Sveta gave birth to a grandson, Bogdanchik, on March 14. Grandmother Sveta sincerely thanks God for saving their lives. We want to share with you how the Lord works with the hearts of people who have suffered from war and are in dire need of protection and help. Natalia Borysivna, a mathematics teacher, lives in Irpin, not far from our church, but has never attended church and was an atheist. During the war, a shell hit her house and opened the roof. She was terribly worried about what would help her. The youth of our church and their friends repaired the roof and covered it from the rain. On Sunday, May 22, she came to church and repented, accepting the Lord as her personal Savior.

Tserkva Vidrodzhenya

37043757 / 708

Thanks to your support, we were able to purchase 5 tons of products, which were transported to Sumy, to the liberated towns and villages. Hundreds of people gathered there to whom we shared the gospel and provided food aid. In total, we helped about 3,000 people. These are Trostyanets, Okhtyrka and several villages of Trostyanets district. We saw people's tears because it was a time when the state had not yet provided aid, only churches and volunteers. We were able to sow the Word of God in people's hearts, to testify in action of His love. Today, several dozen new people have started attending the local church. We heard testimonies from people who were under occupation and in dire need of food. Our arrival was often a response to their needs. May God bless your work and reward you for your sacrifice so that you and your children will never be in need and will not experience the horrors of war.

v. Tamaryno

36363631 / 720

The village of Tamarine and the surrounding villages have been under occupation since February 28, 2022. Since March 18 there are fences (Kadyrov, Buryats). People's homes were looted, household appliances were looted, and many victims of violence. No one is allowed in the direction of Snihurivka, they fire at once. People who can, get to Kherson for bread, on a dirt road. Elderly people who received a pension by mail no longer receive it. So he has no money for bread or medicine. Your help to the villagers is to evacuate those who managed to escape (mothers take their daughters shaved bald, disguised as a boy, in dirty clothes), as well as to purchase medicine, send food to those residents of the village of Tamarine who were able to escape the occupation. We are constantly in touch with the remaining villagers, trying to provide them with the necessary medicines. Evidence: Russian troops (Kadyrovites) categorically banned entry into Ukrainian-controlled territory for fear of execution. On the 40th day of the war, our sister from the church with. Tamarino, received a certificate in the spirit that you need to go. While they were assembling, 34 cars lined up behind their car. The Kadyrovites blocked their way. The sister went to talk to them. The Holy Spirit gave something to say. Those who blocked the road turned out to be orthodox Muslims who fasted and prayed every day that day. The Kadyrovites parted, opened the way for them and all 34 cars of 7-8 people each, safely left for the territory controlled by Ukraine.

KOVCHEG SPASENIJA

19033551 / 721

Brother Slavik from the city of Khmelnitsky delivers humanitarian aid to cities from the war zone (Severodonetsk, Liman, Seversk, Kramatorsk). He takes the refugees back. Twice Slavik barely escaped artillery and rocket fire. His own VolksWagen T4 minibus was subjected to a lot of wear and tear due to constant overloads and long distances. Once he, loaded with humanitarian aid, broke down right on the highway. Slavik found himself in a difficult financial situation. We compensated him for a significant portion of the cost of the engine overhaul, and together we thanked God that we had Samaritan's Bag funds so timely.

Religiina Gromada Chrystyian Viry Evangelskoi

26208850 / 722

Our church sincerely thanks you for the opportunity to serve people in such a difficult time! We are in the west of our country, where there are currently a lot of displaced people. Many fled their homes without the necessary things, with small children, with old parents, with the sick who needed difficult medicines, etc., hygiene, clothing and other necessary things, food. Our church has visited them all many times, providing them with everything they need and telling them about God, who does not leave us all and worries even in very difficult times. We cried with them and prayed, they sincerely thanked God for their help, because we did not expect such care. Some people fled in large groups, we settled them in schools, where they still live, we helped to arrange their living conditions. Also, our church united with another, made a lot of stews, food kits and more than one car went to the cities where heavy fighting is taking place - Kharkiv, Irpin. People in those areas and cities can survive thanks to such trips and thanks to the help you provide. God works through you, and changes our attitude to service, but most importantly, in such a difficult time, you can see how people repent and seek salvation from God! Thank you for your support in a difficult time! May God bless us!

KOVCHEG SPASENIJA

19033551 / 723

Late in the evening, on May 24, grandfather, Boris Andreevich, aged 94, was brought to the Church of the Ark of Salvation. His house in the village of Ozerny was completely destroyed. Grandfather smelled of artillery smoke and brick dust. He is smart and quite independent. "When he learned that he was being assigned to a nursing home, he begged to be left free to move. Brother Igor responded to accompany him to the Kharkov rehabilitation center. Thanks to the Samaritan's Bag for financial participation in this good cause! God knows your names.

Partial assistance for car repair of volunteers after the accident. To receive and deliver to the army bulletproof vests for soldiers from our village. Also to help families whose parents died at the front or are in the ranks of the Armed Forces.
