/ 731

Dear partners! In the days when our country is going through extremely difficult times, we, for our part, try to take maximum care of people who are in despair and constant fear. Our church has taken on the mission of visiting those who are left alone with their grief. Every day we visited several families raising children with disabilities, trying to calm them down and provide spiritual support. For the most needy, we provided assistance in the form of diapers, nappies, medicines. The strong half of our church has maximally joined in another direction. Thus, from the first days of the war, drivers made evacuation trips from the most affected cities of Ukraine, and transported humanitarian goods to the victims. Service volunteers joined to raise money for our army. A camp for temporarily displaced persons has been set up on the basis of a boarding house belonging to our church. During the twenty days of the war, we were able to help more than 500 people from different regions of Ukraine. I am attaching to this story the testimony of the Trusov family, who lived at the address of the Kyiv region, Makariv village, who, together with other refugees, are under the care of our church. It all started on the 25th. We woke up from the explosions, the children were screaming and crying in fear. For 12 days we lay under fire. They hid as best they could. I ordered the children not to leave the house. Every time I went to the yard, I was horrified to see people and animals killed. It was very dangerous, because bombs and shrapnel destroyed our homes. Life became unbearable when the Russians began to extinguish the houses without disassembling. The military broke into our homes, confiscated phones and equipment, and threatened them with machine guns. On March 9, we managed to get out of this horror. My closest neighbor and I got on a bus that helped us save our children. The road to western Ukraine was not easy. We often stopped at checkpoints, and the exhausted children slept, because we escaped from hell. A few days later we received very painful news: we have nowhere to return - our houses were destroyed. We have six children, my friend is a widow, and I am expecting a child. I do not want to leave my native Ukraine, but I have to take care of the little ones. We plan to cross the border. In a month, God willing, I will have another daughter. Honestly, I didn't expect God to lead me through the people I met at the boarding house. We were dressed, fed and provided with a good room with amenities. I want to express my sincere gratitude to everyone who helps us in these difficult times.

/ 732

The Mykolayiv Rehabilitation Center for Social Rehabilitation and the Salt of the Earth Christian Church continue to evacuate women and children from the war zone from Mykolayiv to western Ukraine. Today, 50 women and children were taken out of the combat zone. Baby food, diapers, medicines, food were delivered to Nikolaev

/ 733

Blessed is the Samaritan Bags team. We are grateful for your support and funds. Our church is located in Kropyvnytskyi on the way to Western Ukraine. Many refugees where hostilities are taking place (Zaporizhia, Mariupol, Kharkiv, Mykolaiv) pass by or stay here near our church. They do not have basic necessities, so we plan to provide them. There are not enough medicines in pharmacies, they went to Romania to buy what they needed. Funds are also needed for fuel. Thank you. May the Lord bless you

/ 734

few days ago, our Church "The Radiance of God's Glory" received material assistance from the "Samaritan's Bag", which is already being received by refugees, simply people without a livelihood, due to the lack of the opportunity to earn these funds, large families and churches in the hot spots of Ukraine where now a humanitarian catastrophe. In particular, the city of Kharkiv, where our church members take food and much more in their personal vehicles. This help also goes to prison churches in many places in Ukraine. We are very grateful to you, without you it would not have been possible, for everything GLORY TO OUR GOD dear friends, with love for you, the pastor of the Church Dmitry Ryabov.

/ 735

Dear employees! Peace to you and your families! We are grateful to God for always, under all circumstances, giving an understanding of His will, helping to understand how to act and what to do. Undoubtedly, it is important to hear His voice and follow it. Our work is focused on the Pyriatyn region, located in the Poltava region. With the start of the war, new, still unfamiliar, worries came into our missionary workdays. Our region is one of the few in Eastern Ukraine that God preserves in peace and relative silence. We are grateful to God for that. At the same time, our region has become one of those where people rush to war. I'm sure you know the horror of this situation. That is why it is important for us today to help sheltered families as much as possible: housing, food, medicine, clothes and more. To date, about 50 migrant families have moved to the city. We, as a church, have gained considerable trust from the city leaders in our previous years of ministry. Therefore, the city first turns to us for help where they do not have the opportunity to do so. So, what can we do for the settlers here now and what are we already doing: - 3 times a week we buy bread (from 200 loaves at a time) and distribute it in the church. Some of those who receive this bread tell us that this bread is dried and eaten throughout the week; - Almost every day we receive addresses from the city with the families of migrants and requests for help: medicines, cereals, food, baby formula, diapers and other minimum necessary for life and accommodation. We pack packages and deliver them around the city. At the same time, we are building friendly relations with these people, learning about their additional needs, and inviting them to join in common prayers for Ukraine in the church. People are now very willing to respond to such invitations; - To have the necessary resources for the formation of food packages, we are looking for volunteers who can bring everything you need from Western Ukraine here. This includes significant sums for the purchase of gasoline and transport services; - purchase of clothes, towels, bedding, outerwear, shoes for migrants; - assistance in further transportation of migrants to Western Ukraine. So far, about 20 people have been deported from the city; - serving in the green corridors - preparing hot meals for refugees for a snack during this trip. Dumplings, sandwiches, mashed potatoes, cutlets, hot weather, coffee - all this is taken to the track or to nothing train in Hrebinka. People are very confused and scared. In response to the help they received, they cried, saying: "We are no longer needed. We have nothing left. We didn't think anyone cared about us. We thank you…". Most of them started attending services and prayed with us for peace in Ukraine. We are grateful to God that since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, He has given us opportunities and resources to serve where there was nothing but our desire to help. Thank God. We thank God for your love for Ukrainians, for your prayers and indifference to everything that is happening. Be blessed! The missionaries of Pyriatyn and Hrebinka regions are grateful

/ 736

24713064 Your funds are directed to the reception of refugees from places of hostilities, their transportation to western Ukraine, as well as the delivery of humanitarian aid to the front lines of the country.

/ 737

Many thanks to the Samaritan Bag Project for financial support for our church. Thanks to your sincere help, our church was able to serve the most vulnerable sections of the population of our village. Food was also distributed to people who did not practice the Christian life, but because of this help, people saw in this gesture that the Lord had not forsaken them and that God loved them. And thus they testified to themselves that they began to sincerely believe in God and His care. Also, our village, as well as the city of Kherson, found itself under occupation and food blockade. There is a big problem in buying food and medicine, so we have not spent all the money yet, but we are looking for different ways to buy food and serve our neighbors.

/ 739

Congratulations to you, brothers and sisters, all partners of the Christmas Child project in the joint work of charity in this difficult time of war. Through your resource, our church in the village. Belokrinichchi was able to reach many families who need help as never before - thank God for that! Together with various help, we try to convey the Word of God, which is able to save and heal people's souls! Our Church is not large, it has 23 members, most of them older people, but young people are actively organized to help people in need during this war period. Thanks to your blessing, we were able to buy a few products from which we make food kits and bless the families in which the men went to war and the children and wife remained at home. They made sandwiches, chebureks and poppy pies, packed them in portions, offered the Our Father prayer and took them to the train station and gave them to migrants fleeing combat zones and were very hungry. and missiles that exploded and caused great damage and ruin in the cities. Photo ¹1 Muzheiko Anatoliy. This man is very God-fearing, kind and polite. Anatoly has suffered a micro-stroke several times already, but God prolongs his life and wants him not to die, but to be saved. In the first days of the war, his son Alexander, took people in his car from the war zone - Irpin, saved lives. Saving the lives of many people, Alexander lost contact and still no one knows where he is and whether he survived. The family is very anxious, but they hope in God and believe that only He can help them find their son. Therefore, pray for this family so that they do not despair of the Lord, but instead entrust their hearts to Jesus as their personal Savior. Photo ¹2 Dmitriev family Oksana and Sasha. This family moved to Bilokrynychchi in 2014, fleeing the war from Luhansk region. God gave them 4 children who cheered their broken hearts. They bought an old house and tried to live forgetting the shooting of Luhansk region. The happy life did not last long, on February 24 the war began in Ukraine, but on a much stronger scale. The Dmitriev family has great experiences, they have repeatedly planned to leave their "nest", but at the moment they are still living in their hut and hope that everything will calm down and peace will come. They were very impressed and grateful for the food set and understand that the Lord cares for them even in such a difficult time of war, especially since Alexander lost the job he had in peacetime! Thank you for being able to serve people with you, to help them with all kinds of help, and at the same time to guide them to Jesus Christ. Bless you from the Lord in your future work.

You also need to refuel cars and buses to transport people, which is also a big help. And still for food of people, providing them with necessary, means were necessary. / 744

From the very beginning of the war, on February 24, our NEW LIFE Church and my family began to host people whom everyone later began to call "IDPs." For the first two weeks of each day we received 5 to 15 people at home, there were a lot of small children. Mostly, they were our friends and acquaintances from other cities: Kyiv, Kharkiv, Zaporizhia, Mariupol. Then their friends and acquaintances came to us, with whom we were not acquainted, but the Lord introduced us in this way. In total, more than 80 people passed through our church during these four weeks of these sad events. We stopped not only in our house, but also in the houses of our church members. Even some of my neighbors - my unbelieving neighbor Oleg, a 50-year-old man - are opening their homes to such people. In addition to transit travelers, we also try to help those people who came to our neighborhood Kropyvnytskyi and settled here for a while, from other major cities of Ukraine - who are fleeing the war, but still can not go further. Yes, the other day we met a young woman - Valentina. Valentina (mother, 30 years old) and her two children - daughter Veronica (10 years old) and son Vladislav (7 months old) were forced to leave their hometown due to heavy shelling. Valentina's family from Chernihiv and this city is now in a very difficult situation: constant rocket fire on buildings. The young woman says that the school and kindergarten in their area have already been destroyed, as well as some houses, no water and heating, and almost no grocery stores. Valentina left with the children, and her husband stayed at home to look after their apartment. At the moment, it is very difficult to leave such cities, because there is shelling all the time and there are no green corridors. We have to go on field roads. With God's help, they got to Kropyvnytskyi and settled here with Olga's wives (according to the state program to support IDPs). Our church, maintaining good relations with the municipal authorities, learned about this family and visited them the other day. We gave them food, children's toys, stationery, hygiene items, Christian literature. Marina talked a little with Valentina and her daughter. We ask you to pray for such families, of which there are hundreds of thousands in Ukraine today. With all our hearts we, the Evangelical Church "NEW LIFE" New city Kropyvnytskyi, Kirovohrad region, we express our sincere gratitude to all those who supported us prayerfully and financially in this difficult time for all of Ukraine. We pray to the Lord God to bless everyone with His Peace and Grace! We pray that through this care and help of our people, the Merciful God Jesus Christ will be revealed to people, that they may seek Him and find Him as their Personal Savior and Lord! Glory and Gratitude to him for everything! Sincerely, Serhiy Teslenko, Pastor of the New Life Church 23.03.2022ð.

/ 745

We organized the production of bulletproof vests, make plates from the springs, shoot, vulcanize, sew plate socks and take them to the front. Too many guys have no protection. At the request of soldiers, we buy equipment, bring food and chance tools. They helped a family from Mariupol and a totally blind girl who suffered a severe stest injury.

/ 746

the church received believers from the town of Ugledar, Donetsk region, bought them firewood to heat the house

/ 747

22.03.2022 Ukraine Kropyvnytskyi city Church of Evangelical Christian Baptists "Christ the Savior" "do not weaken in diligence; fervent in spirit; serve the Lord;" (Rom.12:11) In this period of war, we want to tell you first of all, we have not weakened, we are burning in spirit, we are serving the Lord. Today we testify that the love of the Lord Jesus Christ shines in a special way through evangelical churches around the world. Today, the children of God all over the world do not stand aside and do not leave the Ukrainian churches alone with the problem. From the very first day, our church received immigrants, providing them with good food, good lodging, and warm walls of the house of prayer. No one thought about the costs, we did not expect help, we were burning for the service of God through the acceptance of immigrants, all the glory belongs to the Lord, because we all showed the Name and love of Christ. We assure you that the financial assistance that God has sent through you today greatly supports our ministry. We thank all your National Leadership Team for the project "Children's Child" of Ukraine. And also Franklin Graham, for the fact that you were able to share with us participation in this common ministry, we thank the Lord and you that the Christian family today, more than ever, is driven by love, mercy, compassion and is not limited to church walls, but shows to the whole world We are one in Christ. Thank you for supporting our common ministry. With love and respect, Christ the Savior ECB Church. Pastor - Georgy Nikolaevich Doroshenko Ukraine Kropyvnytskyi city Church of Evangelical Christian Baptists "Christ the Savior" We thank the Lord that He leads His work through our church. And also we thank your team for the located heart to our common service. During the 28 days of the war, our church was able to help almost two thousand migrants, about seventy percent of them were children. The church provided good nutrition, a good warm overnight stay within the church walls. Thanks to your support, we will be able to continue serving further, at the highest level. The finances were directed to: - the purchase of food - the purchase of food supplies - disposable tableware - all utility costs (gas, electricity, water, pumping out the drain pit) - the purchase of bottled gas for cooking for displaced persons) - the removal of women and children to a safe place. - purchase of medicines - purchase of fuel for generators. - Bought a small wood stove. Our church team continues to perform this ministry with zeal and fervor, giving all the glory to the Lord. We testify that unbelieving people, having visited our church, hearing that it was God who organized everything for them free of charge, leave with tears and delight in misunderstanding that our Faith was closed to them, but today they saw in the children of God unity, disinterested care, inexplicable love. Our heart rejoices in glorifying the Lord through this opportunity to serve the people. We also testify that the believers who visited our church admire the work of the Lord, and in these circumstances, seeing how the churches rallied, they say: we see that God has not abandoned us, He still takes care of us. Passing these trials today, we ask God for mercy on our people and thank all those who are not indifferent today in unity cry for us to God.

/ 748

About 300 people passed through this house of prayer, in addition to those who lived and lived in the homes of brothers and sisters. Therefore, we thank God and may all glory be to Him !!!!

/ 750

Our church in Uman receives hundreds of refugees and migrants every day. We provide them with the necessary assistance, shelter, food and basic necessities. Thank God that we can help everyone who needs it thanks to you and all the friends who help us in this matter at this difficult time for Ukraine! May God reward you abundantly for your generosity and care !!!

/ 751

44253060 Church of Jesus Christ. Dear brothers and sisters, thank you for your help! Thanks to you, we can serve with you to serve people who are suffering from war. The photo shows two women and two children. They fled the shelling from the town of Volnovakha. We bought medicines and diapers for them and will continue to take care of them

/ 752

Peace be upon you, dear brothers and sisters. We thank God for peace and the opportunity to serve others. Yesterday (March 23, 22) I was Tarabara Svitlana, I had the opportunity (together with Yulia Shevkova) to visit refugees who currently live in the villages of Koby, Stovbyna Dolyna, Grekopavlivka. In total, there were 5 families with a total of ~ 20 people. Our goal was to get to know each other personally and to encourage people to get to know God. In my opinion, it worked. Apart from the 20 people we told about God's mercy and protection, only one family did not accept us. We gave the children Samaritan packages and children's Bibles, an interesting fact - parents ask for Bibles in Ukrainian. Each child was told that Jesus loved him and wanted to give him eternal life. They reminded that only God's hand can close the sky and stop the enemy, that the prayer of a child has great power, and the prayer of the parents is always heard by the Lord. They also learned about their needs, all these people came with the same clothes, they don't even have change of clothes and shoes. We thank Christians in the United States from the Samaritan Bag Mission for financial support. Thanks to it we can buy basic necessities. Today (24.03.22) I bought bedding, towels, clothes, underwear, home shoes and food worth UAH 4,000. This assistance will be delivered to the family of Oli Lyuklyan with 7 people who left the city of Okhtyrka. (mother, three daughters, granddaughter, grandson and son-in-law) currently live in the village. Koby Poltava region. Friends, we do not know when these trials will come to an end, but we can make it morally easier for people, because they know better than anyone else the price of a clean bed and washed socks. Together they lived for a week in the cellar, sleeping on potatoes and foam, and when they were taken out they prayed to heaven to stay alive! My sincere thanks to all who are involved in this cause, for prayers and finances, for blessings and psychological support. I want to wish you God's peace, be the light that shines in the dark and does not burn the forest. Help God to remain heavenly!

/ 753

When the war started, it caught us by surprise, people stopped going to work, everything stopped. We have the Zorya mission, but at that time we had nothing, no products, no money on the balance, and we announced a fundraiser in our church, a few people donated money, we bought food for them, but it was absolutely a little. And here refugees from hot spots began to come and go to us. At this time, your financial aid came to us on a mission, it was a great blessing, we could not give birth, it caused tears of joy and gratitude for such wonderful friends of our Samaritan Bag, it really fits the name "Samaritan Bag". We were able to buy flour, rice, buckwheat, semolina, bulgur, oil, butter, tea, salt, baby food, hygiene products ... and many other things necessary for the life of refugees. All our team sincerely thanks you, may God bless you abundantly, and give you a hundred times more, may your families, your homes, your children be blessed !!! We love you and pray for you.

/ 757

Thank God. We truly thank you for the financial help of our church, which helped to feed and provide accommodation in our church for migrants from the East, part of the funds went to food, part of the funds to refuel the bus and take women with children to the border with Poland. the door of the bus opened at the border, we said "When it's all over, go back", to which they replied "We no longer have a place to go back" and at that moment just tears in the eyes of both women and in the eyes of our fellow servants, for every one of us has a compassionate heart, I believe that Jesus makes our hearts like that after sincere repentance. The second area where our church was able to focus is the feeding of our compatriots traveling from the East by rail. they said "God loves you" and I thank you for seeing how difficult it was for people to miss words and keep going, but stopped and smiled, which means that some people have these words in their hearts and I believe that this will be the seed that will be to grow. There were also people who did not want to eat, but took the New Testaments, and because it is a conscious decision, I believe that these people will sincerely read the Word of God. For us Christians, this is the time when we can serve and show what is in our hearts, set an example of a Christian. https://youtu.be/DJBOd7lDUBI https://fb.watch/bZAB1sAjjw/

/ 762

As our mission is unable to accommodate refugees, we have earmarked funds directly to help families temporarily living in Rivne due to the fighting in their areas. Find out what they need. This includes food packages, medicines, stationery for schoolchildren, diapers, baby formula, household goods. The work is still ongoing. We convey their gratitude to you. / 763

Dear friends, our church is very grateful to you for your financial assistance. We use these funds as efficiently as possible. Already today in the Territories of the premises belonging to our Church "Ark" we have created places for displaced persons and refugees from the occupied Territories of our country. Church members actively joined and organized meals for all people who come to us. Our church members also actively help with their vehicles to pick up people from places where hostilities are taking place and bring them to our safe place. Today our church has become a great hostel full of love and care. More than 400 people have already benefited from our help. And today we see that the flow of people does not end. Here again I was informed about the arrival of 20 more people. In one of the rooms of our foundation where the orphans whose children we transported temporarily lived in Poland, the workers organized meals for the soldiers defending our city and gave parents and young children the opportunity to live in the rooms of children who lived there before the war. Today, we need passenger buses and minivans to pick up and transport refugees to safe places. We pray and believe that the Lord will help us in this as well. Thank you sincerely for being with us in a very difficult time for our country !!!

/ 764

Dear Samaritan Bag Mission! The Road to Salvation Church in Shepetivka expresses its gratitude to you for your financial assistance in serving the people who suffered greatly from the war. Using the funds you send, we serve at the train station twice a week to people who are forced to move from cities where hostilities are taking place to safer places. We feed them, put them in rest rooms, testify of Jesus. An average of 200-300 people pass through us in one night. Among them are children. Many of them open their hearts to the Gospel, talk about the horrors they had to go through. In addition to the train station, we serve refugees and our own homes, providing them with a place to spend the night, as well as distributing hot food to people who find themselves in difficult life circumstances of our city.

/ 765

They bought medicine. We will be able to distribute painkillers, antibiotics, antivirals, etc. to people as needed. Church of Jesus Christ. 44253060

/ 766

Peace be upon you! We truly thank God for the opportunity to continue working here in Poltava region. We continue our work here with migrants. This week we tried to help everyone in need with clothes. Together, we collected and brought clothes from Lviv for all migrants to Pyriatyn. For 3 days in a row, people could come and choose for themselves everything they needed. During this time, more than 70 people came to visit us - from Bucha, Mariupol, Kharkiv, Kyiv ... The doctors of Chernihiv, who came in their own robes and jackets, were very impressed. People are especially grateful for such help. For those who did not find the right things among the clothes, we bought them separately in our stores. So, the family, temporarily living in the village of Prikhodky, received new shoes 5 pairs. We truly thank you for your support and opportunity to serve all of these people. May God bless you !!!

Your funds have helped us in this difficult time in our country. The church works with people we bring from battlefields. There is a prepared shower sleeping area. We buy food and feed people three times. Our church helps and provides transport to reach the borders of Poland. There is a military base in our area, and the church helps with food for the guys of the Armed Forces. We truly thank you for your open hearts and the disposition of your finances. / 769

Food aid was provided to refugees and Volnovakha who lost their homes as a result of bombing by Russian troops. The village of Nyzhniv, Tlumach district, Ivano-Frankivsk region.

/ 770

The Church of Christians of the Faith of the Evangelical City of Shumsk, Ternopil Region, sincerely thanks you for the material assistance we received during this difficult time for the Ukrainian people. By the grace of God, there is no fighting in our territory, so we are making efforts to help the people, God's people, where the rockets hit, shells exploded and bombs fell. Our church has repeatedly sent aid to such regions of the country, including food, hygiene and other necessities. Our brothers, risking their own safety, set off with the necessary cargo, because not all of them left the war zone, church ministers remain on the ground, and people come to church not only to find spiritual support, but also to receive such simple things as bread, medicine and other vital things. During the whole period of the full-scale war, our church sheltered 200 people, some of whom were able to be placed in private homes of brothers and sisters of our community, some of whom wished to go abroad. Currently, the church is home to 70 people who have been temporarily relocated from the war zone, which is fully provided with food, hygiene, clothing and, if necessary, medicines, and food is prepared for such people every day. Temporarily displaced people attend services, come to joint prayers for peace in Ukraine. Conversations and conversations are held with them, and many of them have nowhere to return to after the war, as their homes have been destroyed by the occupiers. There are also meetings for children, where they have the opportunity to read the Bible, play, draw and at the same time feel safe. We, as the Church of Christ, do our best to serve and support these people, to proclaim the Word of God, and we believe that the Word of God has the capacity to grow under the action of the Holy Spirit! We pray for this and bless all who come to us for help! Once again, thank you so much for your financial help, may the Lord bless and give back to everyone for every dollar donated! God's peace and harmony!

/ 771

Thanks God! I want to testify how God is doing His Miracle in our city, thanks to your financial support. When they called me and said that you want to support our ministry, at that time I had no idea how to do it! The city of Balakleya, Kharkov region, has been under the occupation of Russia and in the ring all this time. Since we have a large military ammunition base and a military repair plant in our city, a lot of Russian equipment drove there and captured the city. People are afraid to leave their homes and basements, explosions are constantly going on, rockets are flying, shootings ... The city is cut off from the region, all bridges are broken, it is impossible to enter or leave the city. People sit in basements and shelters for several days, there is no light, no water, no mobile communications, no heating. There are no groceries in stores and no medicines in pharmacies. No one can bring humanitarian aid to the city, and medicines, too, because. there is a lot of Russian equipment in the city, Russian checkpoints, where cars are taken away and not allowed into the city. The situation in the city is very serious and it seemed we were powerless to do anything at all… but our heart aches for these people and we really wanted to help them… And God is very merciful to us!!! He revealed a MIRACLE and His Glory!!! Just supernaturally began to answer our prayers! As soon as we received your resources, God gave peace in our hearts and we realized that this is God's Answer to our prayers! We felt that if God gave resources, He would arrange everything. They began to pray intensely that God would send volunteers so that we could evacuate people from the city. We do not have such an opportunity, there was no transport to go by ourselves. And thank the Lord, we miraculously found a person who was ready to serve as a transport and take people out. During this time, people are evacuated, 16-17 people are placed in a 9-seater minibus! Isn't it a miracle? People are crying, they do not believe that this happened to them and they were able to leave! It's just a miracle from God! What is impossible for man is possible for God! We have been serving in the city for a week now! It became possible to evacuate people, people walk around the city with bags, walking 10 km to get to the place where the driver can pick them up .. people are in fear, in worry, explosions are constantly heard, but they are ready to go in order to save their life... People are running out of food, sitting half-starved .. But God Supernaturally took care of that too... Thanks to your support, we were able to bring food and medicine to the city. To get them, people go along paths, roundabout ways, on foot through the whole city, how scary they were .. shells are exploding somewhere, planes are flying ... but this does not stop them from going to get food. There is absolutely no way in the city to distribute these products to homes and shelters .. but there is a person from our Team who takes these products, medicines, diapers, baby food, puts it all on his bike and delivers it himself from the outskirts of the city in a roundabout way, to the city in , a safe place where people can come on foot and get . Since there is no electricity in the city and villages, whoever has generators, we help with fuel, because it is impossible to buy it anywhere in the city, there is also no way to withdraw money from the card, the ATMs are empty, they do not replenish, the banks do not work, and there is no cash left at all. There is absolutely no way to take a lot of pictures of the ministry to these people in the city, people's phones are empty, there is no light to charge and there is no Internet. People are afraid to take some pictures, because. the Russian military take away, check and smash phones from people, so people hide phones, they don’t go anywhere with them, turn them off and can only turn them on if they find a place where they catch the network, this is basically somewhere on the outskirts of the city on a hill. People are very grateful, with tears in their eyes and praise God for help from Him! Thus, we can serve not only Christians, but also unbelieving people, neighbors to speak the Good News about Salvation !!! Praise the Lord for His Miracle in this city! And many thanks to your team for their sacrifice and financial assistance! May the Lord reward and bless you! We continue to work, support these people, may God lead the way!! Pray for our city and work, may the Lord open the doors, may humanitarian corridors appear and God's protection be on all of us!!! Glory to Him!!!

/ 772

Medicines for the elderly

Shops and pharmacies are closed, there is no connection! You can find food..but very expensive! We managed to evacuate several people with your help! Buy, cook and feed our citizens! Thank you for your care !!! Your Sincere and Good Heart !!! We cry together with the Country, but we really believe in Our VICTORY with you !!! May God reward you for your ardent Faith in the Lord Jesus Christ and your love for our people !! ??????

Also bought flour, for making dumplings with potatoes, for baking bread, cutlets in the dough. Everything prepared is delivered to us by the Holy Trinity Church, from where help is sent to places of urgent need (Kyiv, Kharkiv, Luhansk regions). We are sincerely grateful for the support of the people of Ukraine during the difficult time of war ... May God's blessings be upon you!

/ 776

Thanks to the Samaritan's Bag, refugees from the cities of Kharkiv, Kyiv, and Mariupol received heat, purchase of briquettes for (stove heating), food, and electricity.

/ 777

The Church of Christ the Savior thanks you for your financial support! At the moment we accept refugees in our own houses and apartments, and we were also given the opportunity to use two halls where people practiced yoga before the war. Mattresses are laid in these halls, and refugees are accepted. Meals were organized in the church premises for people who left the places where the war is being fought.

/ 778

Peace to you. I am Marina Danilchenko, Vinnytsia, Staromiska Church. We are in Vinnitsa with the whole family, with all six children (the youngest is 3 years old). On the first day of the war, we had thoughts of leaving, but then we prayed and made a decision. We will be together with everyone, because not every family can leave Ukraine. Someone has no money, someone is liable for military service, someone has a child with disabilities, and we decided to stay. But to stay not for fear and fear, but in order to do what God expects from us! You know, we were all waiting for the "summer of the Lord", but we pictured it differently. And now, right now, this time has come for the Church in Ukraine! I value my church, I am proud of our team, people who quickly united and began to serve the refugees. We (starting from February 26) accept people who flee from their cities, we receive more than 300 people every day, in the building of our church, we receive those with small babies at home, we pray with them, we eat, we run to the basement when the sirens they shout, we take them to the hospital if necessary, we look for diapers, insulin, gasoline, spare parts for the car ... .. and in a day or two these people learn about God and about Christians more than hundreds of evangelizations. They become family during this time, they learn the prayer, although no one teaches them. They make a promise never to have abortions, but to give birth to children after living a day in a large family. They call and write until they reach their destination. They send photos, report their joys, that they gave birth to a baby and named it after the son or daughter of the family where they lived ... They write that we will definitely meet after the war and eat not in the basement, but in a restaurant in Poland, Israel, USA…. What stories we have not seen and heard during this month of our ministry. I can't describe everything... And now our activities have expanded: in the dining room of our church, we cook and vacuum ready-made meals up to 2000 servings per night. We make stew from purchased meat. We form boxes with the first necessary products and hygiene products. We buy medicines for people. And in the morning we load cars and deliver it all to the oculated areas of the country, where people do not have the opportunity to cook food, buy food and medicine. We are very grateful to God for this time! I know that there are no guarantees that we will wake up tomorrow on earth, so we are now living life in a very concentrated way, we have mixed goodness, love, faith and hope in large doses!

/ 779

I, Marina Danilchenko. Our Old Town Church, Vinnytsia, has received significant financial support from the Samaritan Bag. This is very important in this difficult time, it is very valuable for us to feel support and prayer and financial, it helps us to do good in the name of the Lord to those people who need it. I have already written a preliminary certificate (in Russian) about our ministry to the church, but I want to thank you again for these funds. We bought a lot of rice, buckwheat, oil, dry instant soups, meat, detergents, hygiene products, medicines. We need all this every day to prepare food for refugees, whom we accept and provide temporary housing, as well as for delivery in areas where active hostilities are taking place. We deliver to Kharkiv, Kyiv, Nikolaev, Kherson, Poltava, Chernihiv. We truly thank everyone who is financially involved in this assistance. Together we can do a lot of good, mercy, show true love!

/ 787

During this time, thanks to your funds, we have made 30 bulletproof vests and more than 50 unloadings. We try to deliver all this to the guys who are defending Ukraine on the front line. There is cooperation with the military. At the same time, we deliver household orders for the military and military defense. Our bulletproof vests are tested before shipment and are much cheaper than the ones sold, they cost us from 5200 to 6000 UAH / piece. We spend from 500 to 750 UAH / piece on unloading. Thanks to your money, we have started to work more efficiently.

/ 788

Now the guys on the front line are asking for protective raincoats. Already purchased about 200 pieces. Tomorrow, the day after tomorrow, we will deliver to the forefront together with food, unloading and other orders. The family received a small amount of financial assistance, men work part-time and women are members of our community.

/ 792

We are the Vifezda Mission Charitable Organization. The main direction of our activities before the war was working with children with disabilities and disadvantaged families. But the war crossed everything out and at the moment we are helping refugees from different cities (Kyiv, Kharkiv, Sloviansk ...). Our team is working to ensure that people who come to us can calm down as soon as possible from their worries. We provide them with psychological, humanitarian and material assistance. In total, more than two hundred people with children visited us during the war. Special work is given to work with children, because they have the most emotional anxiety. We have fun with them, walks in the fresh air, English lessons and needlework, but most importantly, we try to bring them the message of Jesus through Bible lessons. Your help is an important contribution to charity in order to help people in need at this difficult time, food, housing, clothing. This contribution helped us to purchase the necessary things and materials.

/ 793

Congratulations on the love of the Lord Jesus Christ. EHB Church of the Renaissance in Hlynsk is very grateful to you for your financial assistance. Photo 1- We bought food for refugees living in our village - about 200 people Photo 2, photo 3 - We bought food and formed food packages for low-income families of our community who lost their jobs as a result of the war. Photo 4, photo 5 - as a result of natural disasters in our village, on Semigrana Street, which is located on a hill, the water in the wells disappeared, they became silted up and people were left without water. Children are forced to go for water to neighbors who have been able to drill wells (it costs a lot of money). So we decided to provide financial assistance to two families to drill wells.

/ 794

As a result of full-scale hostilities in Ukraine, we have a large influx of IDPs from cities that have come under fire and bombing, which remain in Slovyansk, Donetsk region, or are heading to the Western regions. Every day we receive up to 60 people from the cities of Severodonetsk, Popasna, Rubizhne, Izyum and other cities in our region. All our actions are aimed at alleviating human suffering and helping people left without housing and basic necessities. Thanks to your support, we provide shelter, hot food, personal hygiene products, medicines, etc.… We also provide, if possible, food for the population of the city of Slavyansk, who as a result of hostilities, found themselves in difficult life circumstances. We truly thank you and bless you.

/ 795

Sincere gratitude for your help to our Church. Thanks to you we are able to serve every day. Each story is difficult in its own way, but in each one the Lord is glorified. I will probably write this: and their mother were under siege for 19 days in the city of Mareupoli. The Russians destroyed their house. Miraculously escaped from there, they drove towards the border. We had the only car (1993). And we decided to give them our car even though they were left without transport. The Lord put it in my heart. We also gave them food and money on the way to the border. We also take care of people from Kharkiv and other severely affected cities of our Ukraine. Thank you for your support, we do everything to be useful to others ¦ ???????

We express our sincere gratitude to the Samaritan's Bag project for the funds we have used to provide humanitarian assistance to people who are temporarily displaced from the fighting zone in eastern, southern and northern Ukraine. Our church accepts people both for long stays and provides shelter and accommodation. We try to provide people with everything they need: food, clothing, medicine, etc. In this difficult time for Ukraine, with God's help we do everything possible to alleviate suffering and with faith and hope in our Lord Jesus Christ to go through this difficult path! / 804

We truly thank the Samaritan Bag team for their financial assistance. It is used to help refugees, including many children, and to volunteer for them. In particular, the funds were used to ensure the departure from the Chernihiv region to our House of Prayer for a group of 34 people, including 21 children. And also for their food, organization of household issues and creating comfort. For some time they were offered a separate house to live in and organized a move there. We continue to provide them with food, medicine, clothing, personal hygiene products and provide space heating (firewood). Also contributed to inpatient treatment for acute illness of a two-year-old child. Thanks to your help, we continue to be active in volunteering, accepting new refugees from different parts of Ukraine.

/ 805

Dear Church, Friends and partners in the ministry, Thank you for your sacrificial heart and for your service. Thanks to your help, we were able to send products and medicines for our people to the combat zone. We also have the opportunity to evacuate in several stages. Today our churches and our homes are full of people. Thanks to your ministry we have food, clothes and necessary medicines. Your and our ministry is more relevant today than ever. That Sunday, at the end of the service, an old woman came out, she said that she went through Kyiv for 2 days, then at night she found herself in the church in Vinnytsia, 2 days later late at night she found herself in the Church in the village of Ruske Pole, When they woke up in the morning, they saw again that they were in the Church, p. Ruske Pole, Zakarpattia region - she cried and said that the Church is something incredible, here people are accepted here, well here. And this is true, our brothers go at night to the nearest cities in Romania to bring food, then we transport them to the Central cities of Ukraine from where we take people to safe places. We may not have been prepared for such circumstances, but thanks to your prayers and extraordinary support, we can do what Christ is called to do! Church of Russian Field "Renaissance" Thank you brothers and sisters for this great help! Pastor Melanchuk Mykhailo, Church of the BCE Russian Field "Renaissance"

/ 806

Congratulations dear friends! 35 day of war… We are alive. Moreover, God gives us the privilege and opportunity to be His hands and care for refugees and the needy. During all the days of the war, the Church of Grace in Dubrovytsia, together with our daughter churches, serves the needy. Serves those who moved to our lands from dangerous places of hostilities, large and poor. Serves the ministry of the Good Samaritan in word and deed! Thank you to the good people who prepared us for this in this difficult time for us. We pray with tears and thank God for YOU, thank you for being with us. Every day we have contacts with many needy people. People come without special invitations and announcements. Some escaped and ran out of the house. Therefore, for them such help is very valuable and important. God simply gives us the honor to manifest His ministry in these days and to be the transmitters of God's love. In addition to material concerns, we are very excited to be able to speak the gospel of salvation. Anyone could receive the New Testament or the Bible. People come and go in tears, but with great gratitude for their care. Knowing the gospel, we understand more and more deeply - love will overcome evil, and light will overcome darkness.

/ 807

First of all, we would like to sincerely thank you for your generosity. In difficult times of war, funds are needed more than ever. Your gift is very valuable to our church. Our church was able to receive refugees and provide them with food and shelter. We have heard many stories from the settlers about what they experienced at the epicenter of the fighting. My heart rejoices that we can share in the needs of migrants. Our church is located in the west of Ukraine, God bless us with the opportunity to serve for those who have moved from the central and eastern part of our country. We also had the opportunity to buy the necessary food to have a stockpile at the church. We use this stock to help people in the church who are in need. Also with these products we serve for people outside our church - for people who need food. The war continues, so we try to meet the needs of the people around us. We also pray for God's guidance in our work at this difficult time. May the Lord abundantly bless your life and ministry!

We were able to help about a hundred migrants, receiving them on the territory of the community (at home, on a Christian base), partially arranged several ranks in the catchment, provide people with food, hygiene, firewood. Thank you for your contribution.

Volunteer work from the church continues every day.

/ 816

/ 817

The Church of the Living God was founded and is a direct sponsor and curator of the orphanage, which operates in the village of Onufriyivka. It is a non-governmental institution and exists only through donations. Disaster came to our country and our war began. It changed our usual lives. The children switched to distance learning (online school). Constant air alarms. But the help of people like you has done everything possible so that they do not feel the full force of the war: the child lives in a wonderful place (it is a protected area, pays utility bills, warmth and comfort, we have improved some showers, replaced bedding, bought a new one) , they are constantly cared for: developmental classes, music and sports classes, English classes, Bible lessons and communication. Children have new clothes, medicines, regular food, decent treatment. In such conditions we do not change our traditions. We celebrate birthdays, give an individual cake (children blow out candles and make a wish). We give gifts and we pray that God will preserve them and our country. Children should not feel in danger even during the war and you and I make it possible!

/ 818

Mother and children, refugees from the city of Mariupol, moved to the city of Mirgorod. As mother Natasha Bondarenko says: - The children and I sat in the cellar for a long time during the bombing and now our family has been evacuated to a safe place of residence. We reported about God's love. We managed to give them gifts for the children and our mobile phone number, at home the children unpacked the boxes and sent the photo to our phone (since it was handing in the queue where they stood to register at the TsNAP.)

/ 833

We greet you! We are from the city of Berdyansk, the Church of the City of Refuge. We are very grateful for your financial contribution to our ministry. On February 24, war broke out in our country. Since March, we began to accept refugees from Mariupol in our church, people were bombed and many lived in basements. People came hungry and exhausted. We were able to take in 130 people a day, take care of them, feed them 3 hot meals a day, provide them with warm rooms and hot showers. With your finances, we were able to buy an electric stove to cook food, since the gas was turned off in our city. We were able to buy a large freezer in which we can store food and prepare preparations for the future. Purchase food to help refugees and needy local families. Because the city is now in a deep crisis, there are no jobs. We bought fuel and were able to take about 200 people from Berdyansk to Zaporozhye. Since March 15, we have received and fed about 700 people. We continue to help and take care of IDPs, large families and the elderly. We continue to take refugees from Berdyansk and Mariupol to Zaporozhye. Thank you very much for your concern and support.

/ 834

Thank Jesus Christ, it is difficult and even impossible to describe what is happening in the heart, what words can describe the eyes of people who fled from death and saw death near the explosions, those who saw the shot cars with families, children in the middle and thanked God, it's not their family. The eyes of people who have nowhere to go because they were hit in the house, the property they collected all their lives disappeared or stolen, these are the views that look into the void, I do not know if there is a phrase in your dialect "gray faces", which shows hopelessness and helplessness in which there is no desire to live on. We have seen such eyes of people since the first days of the war. For me, the first days were shocking, I woke up to the news that the war had begun, and explosions could be heard very far away outside the window. My five-year-old son slept soundly nearby, his wife was pale with fear, what happened in the first hours could not be described in words, it cannot be called fear or panic, it is something deeper and more uncontrollable, something incomprehensible is happening to your body, your mind is not can perceive nothing adequately. I do not know how people who do not have God in their hearts survived these first days. I have been serving in the Church for 15 years and only in those days I felt the special presence of God, who gave me the strength to calm myself, to calm the family, the church, to start making some decisions. In the days to come, our Church became exhausting, we helped set up a bomb shelter by donating church property with mattresses, benches, utensils, bedding, and food. In the House of Prayer were organized 30 places for migrants who came, Gostomel, Bucha, Vorzel, Irpin, I think these cities echo in every country along with Mariupol, Kharkiv, Chernihiv and others. Since we held teen camps every year, we prepared summer rooms, there are about 100 more places to receive people, these places could serve as hospitals for our soldiers, we counted the most difficult events and prepared for the worst. It's amazing how local entrepreneurs came out to meet us, we bought boilers, showers, washing machine, for a comfortable stay with us, local people brought food, enveloping the care of everyone who came. During the month of the war, we sheltered 30 people, and they live with us, and many people come by road to rest, eat, wash and continue on the road. Thanks to our large Christian family, we help families, migrants with children who came to our village, people lost their jobs, and the need for baby food, medicine, diapers for children remains, from the stress of the mother lost milk, children from stress sick, and men at war, or in defense. And the Church here has been able to help the local OTG in helping such families as never before. Delivery of diapers, purchase of medicines, baby food, fruit, food, this is what we are doing now. The Bible says that strong people are born in difficult times. We now have no fear, neither in preaching the Word of God, nor in working with people, all the doors are open, there is no such family, institution, organization where we are not waiting. The eyes of the people who came to us in the first days were changed by hope, strength, faith in God and people who serve each other. In our village, wherever our members of the Church come, for weaving nets, cooking, baking for soldiers, first of all, prayer and the Word of God are heard. Thank you for your help so that our children can live!

/ 835

Thank you for your money. We helped many migrants, photo. There is still video, but does not upload video, writes a large file size.

The help has helped in situations of people with asthma, thyroid and other diseases. In general, people with tears met with every help, there are cases of repentance before God. Glory to Jesus Christ for you, for everything you are doing at this time for Ukraine!

/ 837

Having no relatives, not knowing the city, they were left alone with adversity, but there is a God who always leads where we are needed. The family was provided with everything necessary (care items, food, medicine). I heard the news of God and His mercy.

/ 841

Your funds are a good material foundation for the work of the church. To serve in places where people have nothing to eat or drink. Our young volunteers deliver food prepared by the sisters in the kitchen three times a week ... Thank you. ¦ ?Together we are strength.

/ 842

Today we had the opportunity to buy and assemble 20 food kits (potatoes, oil, pasta, cereals, sugar, flour, salt, tea) and hygiene products for people from the village of our area. It is a small village and is home to many single grandparents. They do not have public communication with the city, shops do not work. So there is a great need for help. We are sincerely grateful to the Samaritan Bag project for financial support. Because now we have the opportunity to help not only in our city and nearby villages, but also to travel around the area with help. We want to tell about one grandmother who touched our hearts in this village. Approaching one yard, we called the hostess. An old grandmother came out to us. When she saw us, she was embarrassed at first, but we met and told her who we were and what help we had brought. She began to cry, hugging us with the words: "kids, I'm so glad we're not abandoned, I was so afraid that we were forgotten." She said that she had no potatoes, no oil, no cereals in the house ... her neighbor shared a little with her, but there was a family there and there was not much wealth. She cried and hugged us with the words: that God heard her and looked after them once they came and brought exactly what she did not have.

/ 843

When we hear stories of evacuation of people from hot spots, our heart sympathizes and we stand in prayer ... But a much greater range of feelings, more prayers, more tears when you need to evacuate your friends, family, friends and you are powerless ... My name is Yana , I am a member of the regional Nikolaev PRD team and I want to tell the certificate. My relatives lived in the settlement near the city of Nikolaev, about these inhabitants in news there was no word. But on February 24 in our region they were the first to receive blows, because the airfield that was shelled is 3 km away. From the first day of the war, they left their homes and lived in cellars, because the shelling did not stop day or night ... and then foreign troops came to them, brought order. From the first day we tried to keep in touch at least sometimes, but it was a few words every few days ... the connection was turned off ... there was no light, the phone was sometimes charged from the car battery ... We were ready to follow them , but the road between New Odessa and Nikolaev was closed for two weeks, it was also seized, there were shellings. And people trying to break through were fired upon. So we prayed and God did what He promised in His word: And to Him Whose power works in us, and Who can do much more than we ask or even think, Ephesians 3:20 NRP He did more than we asked. Our relatives were without electricity, without delivering food to the store, they lived in a damp cellar, but He took care of health, life, children ... On March 18, a bomb was dropped in the village, 500 meters from my aunt's house. And the yard was destroyed by air shelling. There is no connection, they gather and run to leave the village, and God at the same time gives us the idea to gather and follow them. Approaching the city of Nikolaev, we saw clouds of smoke, God showed His mercy, because the explosion from which there was smoke did not happen when we passed nearby, hit in half an hour in the building near which we go ... in the settlement we could take away an elderly woman left alone and in need of care, a family with a visual impairment who had no way to evacuate, the family of my aunt and uncle with children ..and all this time we gathered people in the village was quiet, the shelling began when we went out and heard the sounds of shelling again ... God is wonderful ... He is incredible ... He always answers in time. We thank the project for financial assistance for our church. Thanks to the help we received, we were able to buy the necessary medicines and care and hygiene products for Galina's grandmother. She lives in the family of our co-coordinator for Ludmila's education. We were also able to provide visually impaired families with clothing and food, and deliver them to the center where people with visual impairments live. They were also able to pick up two families of their relatives and help them with clothes, because they ran out of their houses only with documents ... On this day 5 more families were able to leave this village. We were able to buy everything they needed for the first time and find families sheltered them in their homes. May the Lord bless you for your hearts open to help

/ 849

Our church has 22 members of the church, a quarter of them are elderly and disabled, a couple of families with many children. When a brutal war broke out in our country, which destroyed cities and villages, ruthlessly killing people and children. People hid in basements without means of subsistence, without products. Our churches began to work fruitfully, brothers did not spare their transport, and even sacrificing their lives carried food and various assistance, and took people back. We also did not stand aside, preparing food for the refugees who moved to our village. And because our church is small and our financial situation is not great, we asked God for financial help. Having applied to you for help and received an answer, we were very HAPPY that we will be able to continue to serve more and more for the victims. We began to prepare more finished products, stack food packages. We thank you and God for such help. May God bless you that your sacrifice was a blessing to the people. After all, you not only helped to feed people, but also to save human life, because having many stories that people died of hunger and thirst. God bless you !!! We work non-stop. God stop this war??

/ 856

date: 03. 04.22. In the amount of: 195.20. Bought products for migrants Solnechnogorskaya st., 78, Kharkiv, Kharkiv region date: 04. 04.22. In the amount of: 168.50. Bought products for migrants Solnechnogorskaya st., 78, Kharkiv, Kharkiv region Certificate. When this family fled from Kharkiv 2 cars, there were 10 of them, including 3 small children and a paralyzed man, they fled, still did not know where to go, just to get away from the bombing. But it so happened, not so far from our city of Myrhorod, their cars broke down, and now they have settled in our city. We testify to them about God's protection and His protection, and they accept our words because they are very scared. They decided to be in our city. Some members of this family are already coming to the meeting. We bought them products. Asked about their needs. Since they have children, and they do not have any baby carriages. We asked the Lord in prayer for their needs. We turned to other churches, and now we were able to give them a pram. They also need drugs that are not available in our city now, and there is already an answer. In another city already bought, will be delivered by mail soon. We see how soon God hears and answers. We are thankful to God that the money received from the Samaritan Bag has helped us to serve these people. Thank God!

/ 857

“Since the first days of the war, the Christian Mission“ Hope for the People ”(Rivne) has been making every effort to evacuate people from particularly dangerous combat zones (Kyiv and Kyiv region, Chernihiv, Mariupol and others). To date, more than 800 people have been evacuated by our staff and volunteers. We bring products and necessary things to the needs of the people in these regions. It is difficult to describe the travels of our brothers in a few sentences, more detailed information and testimonies can be read on our website in the service news section, here is a link to the latest publication http://hopetopeople.org/uk/newsletter/%d0%bd%d0%b0%d1 % 88% d1% 96-% d0% bd% d0% be% d0% b2% d0% b8% d0% bd% d0% b8-04-04-2022 / http://hopetopeople.org/uk/newsletter/ http://hopetopeople.org/uk/caring-for-refugees/ http://hopetopeople.org/uk/a-completely-new-ministry/ Thank you very much for your help in supporting the ministry for the Glory of God! May the Lord and our God Jesus Christ bless you abundantly !!!

/ 858

God's peace to you. Thank you very much for your financial support. We want to share the story of one woman. "Olena is 52 years old with cancer, the disease is progressing, metastases in the spine and bones. The poor woman suffers from constant pain every day, almost does not get up, because every movement brings unbearable pain. And the worst thing is that So an old friend took her in. To care for such a patient requires many different special items, one of the most important was the anti-decubitus mattress. We decided to bless her and testify to God's love for her. Tears of gratitude came to Elena's eyes God probably loves me very much, because he sends me good people in life. "

/ 862

The help received by our church is aimed at helping IDPs who temporarily live in our community, which is 397 people, as of April 4, 2022, we expect another 150 people. First of all, in the first stage (the photo report of which we submit) we purchased and formed food kits, personal hygiene kits, detergents for 80 people living in our dormitory. The next step is to direct funds for the purchase of household appliances (microwave ovens, multicookers, refrigerators, washing machines, electric kettles), utensils (pots, cups, plates). And in the third stage, we will provide assistance to IDPs who rent private buildings and also need our support. Among IDPs, we have about 50 children under the age of 16. At the individual request of parents we buy diapers, baby food. Many IDPs seek help in purchasing medicines. We truly thank you for your help. This is a great support for IDPs, this is a great work that you have helped us to deal with. May the good you have done return to you a hundredfold. Peace, good to you and God's blessings !!!

/ 863

Dear partners We greet you, glory to the Lord Jesus Christ! First of all, we would like to express our gratitude to you all for your open heart in understanding our tragedy in Ukraine and for your support of our people! Thank you very much, only real people who have love and faith in God in their hearts can do this! We have received your financial blessing, which every day serves to help those in need and people in difficult situations in Ukraine. From the very beginning of the war and the invasion of the Russian army, ordinary people began to leave the combat zones as well as the cities, which the enemy fired from heavy equipment, bombed with planes and rockets. Our city of Korosten was no exception, and many women and children began to run away from the city in the hope of leaving for countries neighboring Ukraine. Poland has become such the closest friendly country for our citizens, for which we are very grateful. At this difficult moment, we, the church, began to take women and children to the border with Poland in private cars. It was very difficult, because the city has a curfew from evening to 6.00 in the morning, which meant that we could take people out only after this time. There were always more people than we could seat, then we opened the trunks of the cars and carried people in the trunks. People were in disarray, and when they found themselves in the car or in the trunk, there was a certain joy in front of people that they would not be left behind and they would go to the border. For one trip, we took out about 50 people - women and children. In total, during the active export, we took out at least 250 - 300 people, although this is not the whole number, we did not count .... Today, there are also trips, but single ones. The road took in one direction and the other almost 900 km. Already on the way, in cars, we passed many military posts, where we were constantly checked who we were taking and where, and rightly so! We were then recognized at the posts and treated more loyally. All the people in the cars prayed sincerely, some accepted Jesus and confessed Him as Lord and Savior! When we arrived at the border, everyone had a sense of security and joy, everyone thanked and promised everyone to return home to Ukraine! During transportation, we did not photograph anyone, especially transport, as there was always information of sabotage that the enemies were looking for and hunting for people who were leaving Ukraine. Yes, and it was very painful to see the separation of husband and wife, father and children, with tears in their eyes, who saw off their relatives and friends, while they themselves remained at home .... In addition to the fact that people were always taken out, I remember another case that left a big imprint on my heart for me. This incident happened when, once again, we delivered a batch of people to the border, I was returning home. That time we drove back empty, although we always tried to take humanitarian aid to the city along the way. At one of the checkpoints, after checking, the military asked me to bring one person who had to go another 20 kilometers. And this is on my way. I agreed and this man got into the car and we were driving. We talked, got acquainted, his name was Andrei, he was 65 years old. After a short acquaintance, he began to tell where he was and the reason that he was away from home. But he expressed this in the phrase - I have three sons, one in the land, one in prison and the third with a machine gun at a checkpoint .... As it turned out, a tragedy occurred in his house. At the beginning of the war, two brothers quarreled and one killed the other in a litter. The one who killed was buried, and the one who killed in prison. So Andrey's father went to his son in prison to give food - all the same, fatherly love. The third son defends our homeland Ukraine, and now, the heart of father Andrey, overflowing with grief and worry for each son, pours into my car .... At this moment I understand and I myself am filled with experiences together with Andrey, at this moment I feel how the Holy Spirit fills the car, and He begins to console Father Andrey in his grief. God gave special words of consolation to him, we prayed, Andrey, in a prayer of repentance, accepted Jesus Christ, and when we were already approaching the crossroads, where Andrey had to get off, I knew for sure that Andrey was no longer alone, he was in his heart with Jesus, but this means that for Andrey there will always be consolation and peace in any difficulties. When Andrei got out of the car, I was driving and crying, Andrei's pain was transferred to my heart, but I rejoiced and thanked the Lord that I could serve Andrei, that the Holy Spirit could comfort him, support and reconcile with Jesus. On that day, I realized that my main task was not just to once again deliver people to the border, but to meet with Andrey! In addition to the expenses associated with the transportation of people, and this is refueling cars, repairing and servicing cars, we serve: - we purchase medicines for the sick, pensioners, the disabled - we purchase food for those who stayed in the city and are unable to eat. - we buy food for people in our city who stayed and are in places of deprivation of liberty. (these are people who are part of our church who accepted Christ and the church serves them) - we buy food for gypsies who, due to lack of documents, cannot leave Ukraine. (these are also people as part of our church who accepted Christ and the church serves them) - we purchase food for people who remained in the rehabilitation center With great gratitude and respect for your ministry Pastor of the Pobeda Church in Korosten Mikhail Marinets

/ 864

Thanks to them we were able to prepare food, bake rolls for migrants from Mariupol, Kharkiv, Irpin, Energodar and other cities of Ukraine ... We also brought food to the border with Moldova where we treated refugees who stayed for a long time. queued with the children and were hungry. One boy David was bought clothes and shoes (he is an orphan, lives with his grandmother). We truly thank God and you for your financial help that we can help our brothers and sisters in the faith (refugees), as well as many unbelieving Ukrainians in such a terrible war ... May God bless you abundantly !!!

The finances are spent on food, medicine, hygiene products, clothes, various things for children, which are delivered to the places of residence of those people who need it in our region. / 875

We help people in need in the name of Jesus Christ and with your help. These are food kits and medicines, assistance with housing for displaced persons, payment of utility bills. / 876

Welcome. We thank God and the Samaritan Bag for the funds that came to help set up refugee families in our area. Since most families arrived with almost nothing, all families who needed clothes, products, some utensils, electric stoves, etc. were provided for. Some families could not even buy bread, let alone something else. In this difficult time, helping people, testifying to them about Jesus, we invite them to serve in the House of Prayer. People come with their children to watch and then have communication, give children gifts, some New Testaments. Everyone thanked them, and the children waited until they got home, opened the presents and were very happy that they got what they needed. People are surprised that complete strangers treat them so well and help in this difficult time. Currently, we are going to arrange another family. Thank you very much. God's blessings.

/ 877

Evidence of assistance provided to IDPs 1 family - Semenyuk Lyudmila Andreevna, Semenyuk Julia Dmitrievna - 10 years, Semenyuk Veronika Stepanovna - 2 years, Semenyuk Vladislava Stepanovna - 4 years, from the city of Brovary near Kiev. Julia Semenyuk's husband is in Brovary in the defense. The family fled the shelling and the war. On March 5, 2022, they found shelter in the residential building of our charity organization "Promise Society" in Mukachevo. Members of this family dream of returning home. 2nd family - Sytnyk Inna Mykolayivna, 49 years old (has 4 children and 5 grandchildren). Her husband, Serhiy Yuriyovych Molchanov, 42, serves in the Armed Forces near Uzhhorod. Daughter and mother lived in a residential building of our charity organization "Promise Society" in Mukachevo - Gubenko Elizabeth Stanislavovna, 21, was forced to go abroad to earn money to provide for his family. Her husband, Vitaliy Mykolayovych Gubenko, 26, is serving in the Territorial Defense near Konotop. 3rd family - Sodel Valentina Nikolaevna, 35 years old, her daughter - Sodel Anastasia Leonidovna, 10 years old, came from the village of Belogorodka in Kyiv region. They saw how they shot down rockets, planes, lined up tanks, survived rocket attacks, saw how people died, houses were destroyed. Currently, when the occupiers leave (have already left) Kyiv region, they plan to return home in 2 weeks. Sodel's husband Valentin was not taken into the defense because he had already taken the required number of defenders. He takes care of his parents after a stroke in them. 4th family - Yutkina Victoria Alexandrovna, 26 years old, daughter 4 years old, refugees from Donetsk. They fled the shelling in the city. In Mukachevo, they were sheltered by their grandmother, who is raising two children whose mother has died. Yutkina's daughter Victoria is ill, so our organization helped her financially. Victoria's husband serves in the defense.

/ 878

Congratulations brothers and sisters! First of all, I would like to thank you for the funds you have sent to the Light of Life Church in Zhashkiv. Thanks to your support, we were able to help many people, support them financially and spiritually. We very much appreciate your support at such a difficult time for Ukraine. From the very first days of the war, our church did not sit still. Together with our mother church, we began to work actively to help the military. From many individuals and entrepreneurs, we received products and basic necessities, which were transferred to the front. We were actively involved in cooking stews and porridges for the military. However, we later saw that there was a great need for migrants from the temporarily occupied and frontline zones. According to rough data, between 2,000 and 3,000 people arrived in Zhashkiv. These are internally displaced persons. More than half of these people were from Kyiv and the surrounding area, namely Boyarka Vyshhorod, Irpin, Bucha, Boryspil, Brovary, Vasylkiv, and Chernihiv. Also people who came from the eastern and southern directions of Ukraine. On March 12, we started distributing food kits to IDPs in Zhashkiv. It was when you provided the funds that it was a good impetus to increase the amount of assistance in this area. From March 12 to April 6, we distributed 580 food kits. We did not stop there. Twice a week we distribute food kits in the amount of approximately 140-150 pieces. for migrants and needy locals. We also provide the opportunity to receive clothing and spiritual support from the church. With the onset of warming in Ukraine, many people approached us and asked for spring clothes, because many people left the war zone in warm, winter clothes, taking nothing with them. We also help people when they need food and hygiene. In addition, we decided to make a little surprise for women and girls, together with a local entrepreneur who partially donates flowers to us. We understand that we are doing the right thing when we see smiles and tears of happiness in people who have gone through war, who have seen destruction, death, thus giving them a little ray of hope and peace. Also, we do not forget to please the children by giving them gifts from the Samaritan's bag, which we could not distribute before the war. It is very nice that many local people provide us with various products so that we can then distribute them to people. One of the directions of our church was to support the families of local soldiers who are at war. According to the people to whom we passed these food kits, this is a great support for their families and children who do not see their husbands and fathers. Today, our church actively cooperates with the local administration, which provides us with lists of IDPs so that we can help them. We do not plan to stop our work and are ready to serve God and people. Thank you very much for your support. We will definitely win! May God bless you! I threw you only five photos, but they are not enough to describe all our activities. If you need, I can download additional photos and stories of people who experienced the occupation or evacuation. Sincerely, Kuts Oleksandr, a minister of the Light of Life Church.

/ 879

Thank you for the money (which is very necessary for us) at this difficult time for the whole country. Our church has been accepting refugees since the first day of the war, and the conditions in the rented premises at the beginning of the war were not very good. Thanks to good people like you, we were able to buy the necessary things to meet the refugees. At the expense of the Samaritan's Bag, we bought a clothes dryer and a washing machine. Thank you very much for your care and concern for us! People who leave the hot spots of Ukraine are in great need of love and peace, getting to us they get love and care! Bless you in your work!
