Many children have left the fighting and are in our area. Also we, (my family was able to receive people who came to us, Live… were able to serve them, home, bathroom, food that we bought, and continue to buy.) We continue to serve in the future, here in the place where we live. Together with you, with the Lord Jesus Christ, we will defend our freedom. The freedom that Russia wants to steal, to kill our enemy. Be blessed. May the Lord bless you in your ministry.

/ 882

22-24.03.2022. Departure to Kharkiv. This was the first trip since the start of a full-scale war in Ukraine. We left in three cars, took different things - diapers, baby food, food, blankets, sleeping bags, medicine. They brought it all to the Catholic community - the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary in Kharkiv, where our brothers delivered food and things to different areas for local residents of the city. When they returned, 12 women and children were taken out of Kharkiv, mattresses were laid on the floor of a cargo bus, and so they were taken to Bar. Unfortunately, the photos were few because they were unloaded quickly that day because it was a bit dangerous, the artillery volleys were well heard. We left the city in the evening, and at night we bombed Merefa, a suburb of Kharkiv, through which we drove in and out of the city.

/ 887

date: 03.04.22ð. in the amount of: 179.00. Bought products for migrants Solnechnogorskaya ul., 78, Kharkiv, Kharkiv region for the Yurchenko family date: 04.04.22 in the amount of: 24.00. Bought products for migrants Solnechnogorskaya ul., 78, Kharkiv, Kharkiv region for the Yurchenko family date: 04.04.22 in the amount of: 630.00. Bought Medicines, diapers and more for migrants Solnechnogorskaya ul., 78, Kharkov, Kharkov region for the Yurchenko family (the purchase was made in the Dnieper city, checks for payment they did not keep, we gave them 630 UAH for gasoline, although the drug cost much more). Testimony We want to add another family fleeing from near Kharkov 2 cars, there were 10 people, including 3 small children and a paralyzed man, they fled, still did not know where to go, just to get away from the bombing. They settled in the same house, but as Yurchenko Raisa testifies: "--When we arrived in Myrhorod, we could not find housing for our large family, because 10 of us came. I just sat on the asphalt near the road, I cry and beg God for help. And one woman saw that I was crying. She asked me, "What's the matter?" you will live in my house, and I will live in my children. And so we live I0 people all together. " But this is not all God's mercy for this family. Yes, as her husband is paralyzed and he needs medicine, ointments, diapers, and the pharmacy does not, and the money ran out, but thank God, if God gave a stroller for their family, we were able to find out that in the city of Dnieper diapers and medicine, and there was a volunteer who bought it all and brought it at his own expense, we just blessed him and gave him 630 hryvnias for gasoline. When we brought them medicine, diapers and food, Raisa and their whole family were very grateful. But we know that God does it all. Glory to Him!

/ 889

In our village, thank God, there was no concrete fighting, so we do our best to help those who need help. With your help, we also took away 8 tons of potatoes for refugees, which were accepted by churches in Lviv and Lutsk. For the children of migrants, we give gifts from the Samaritan Bag and, if necessary, buy them clothes and other necessary things. / 890

Glory to Christ for your good hearts. We, the Church of the Renaissance in Kropyvnytskyi, financially supported the families evacuated to our city: the Ryazantsev family from Mariupol, the Tarusina and Ogurtsov families from Kharkiv, and the Pinchuk family from Chernihiv.

/ 891

After the war, we opened a volunteer center on the basis of our church and converted some rooms for his needs (the library became a food warehouse, etc.). Our first services were to take mothers and children abroad and to help the soldiers of the Armed Forces. Then we were able to serve food and hygiene products to families with young children, large families and children with disabilities, migrants and the elderly with small pensions. We also had the opportunity to buy medicines and disinfectants for hospitals and hospices in our region. These days we have imported food to the villages of our region that were under occupation or were fired upon by the enemy. Preaching the gospel is an important part of our ministry. We are grateful to God for the opportunity to serve our people at such an important time. It is a great blessing to see how open people are now to the Good News. We still have many photos and testimonies from our ministry, but due to lack of space and ethical reasons, not all of us can show yet. We also organized several meetings for children, where gifts from the Samaritan's Bag were given and a Bible lesson was given. We are planning several more such meetings. We are sincerely grateful to everyone who helps us financially in these ministries!

/ 892

Dear friends, ministers of the Samaritan Bag Mission. Your help was very timely - we had the means to help refugees and churches, it was a great blessing from the Lord. Our church is located in the city of Kropyvnytskyi, it is the very center of Ukraine and therefore we were almost not under fire, but could serve as a transshipment base for those who fled the horrors of war. With the money we received from you, we equipped a special shelter for refugees, could buy medicine and food for a large number of people who passed through the church, low-income people from the church received food kits, which helped a lot, we repaired cars of refugees who broke down. road to the west. And we were able to refuel cars that brought humanitarian aid. We are very grateful to you, may God bless you abundantly!

Were it not for your help, we would not have had such an opportunity. And this is only a small part, there are still many needs and wants, because many people who have lost their homes, sick, widows. / 899

Evidence of two families who had to be evacuated several times from the Russian bombing. This is the family of Manukyan Mikhail and his wife Arevek and Mazelevsky Sergei and his wife. For the first time in 1989. from Nagorno Karabakh to Gorlovka, then these families together in 2014. fled from the bombing of the same Russia in Constantinople. And now they have children, and they had to flee to us in Myrhorod. And they already know what war is, they don't want and they don't want their children to go through what they had to go through. They are grateful that their children received gifts, and they were grateful for the food for their families, which we led, they came to the service. They reported that they felt the love of Jesus through fellowship. They have a Bible that they read and believe in God. Thank God for everything!

/ 900

Hello, the Samaritan's Bag team came on time and it's a miracle at a time when many people need help. We helped Nina Tsarenko's mother from Smila, Cherkasy region. She has cancer oncology. Many children and their mothers live in poverty, and we brought them food, and blessed their mother with money for medicine and MRI and treatment, as well as for children. when they called Marina's mother, Oli because her father had died, their grandfather asked how they were doing, they found out that their mother had only 50 hryvnias left after her father's funeral, and she told about her daughter and granddaughter Sunday they lived on the same porridge, there was no money, no payments came and she has not found a job yet and we sent her and her mother $ 100, they cried and thanked God that it was so timely that they could go and buy for themselves bread and food, we also brought food to my mother in Cherkasy, we thank the mission Samaritan's bag for the money they help people in people see the real help of God in their lives, also helped the family Zubenka Peter and Natalia have three sons and after the illness there were large debts for treatment, and even during the war their father lost his job, the furniture factory where his father worked stopped and wages were not paid and it was very difficult financially and thank God and the fact that the Samaritan Mission Bag sent money this money for people give hope that God is alive, We also helped Kovtun Margarita and we thank God to all who took part in the Samaritan Bag mission

Although there were some incidents because one of the four cars broke down a bit - the rear shock absorber broke due to the load and the broken roads in some places, but thank God everything went well little by little)). Unloaded cars and back home, you need to leave early because the city is curfew.

/ 904

Thank God for the Samaritan's Bag project for supporting the Ukrainian churches during this difficult time of war. The funds we have received are a great blessing to many people whom the church has been able to serve with your support. Our people from the east often took to leaving their homes taking only the most necessary things, so when they are with us, they are not given the opportunity to rest, eat, need clothes for personal hygiene. Many people stay abroad for several days. There are families who stay for a long time, we look for housing and help with food and other things. At this time, people were left without finances and could not buy even the most necessary medicines, there are families where young children and parents are now out of work, there are seriously ill people who need money for treatment, so part of the money was transferred to families need. We cooperate with the local military enlistment office and, at their request, provide lunches for conscripts, fuel and hygiene, and socks. One thermal imager was transferred. Thanks to your support, many people have experienced God's love in action. Thank you, may God bless and preserve everyone who is part of your team. May the Lord give you and fulfill our heart's desires.

family N. Natalia and Dmitry thank you for your help) left Borodyanka district

/ 923

Anyuta and a colleague went home after the Russian troops withdrew. The elders of the village of Borodyanka district were handed over. We were very grateful for your help.

/ 924

Greetings friends and co-workers in the cause of God. We inform you that in the period from the beginning of hostilities on the territory of Ukraine from February 24, 2022, the Ark of Salvation Church in Alexandria accepted, accommodated, provided food, accommodation and necessary assistance to 115 people from the East of Ukraine + 14 pets. Basically, these are families and individuals from Mariupol, Melitopol, Slavyansk, Zaporozhye, Kharkov. People are forced to flee from hostilities in order to find a safe place for themselves. Our church personally took part in the evacuation of 10 people from Mariupol. This happened on the 20th day of the war, when the city was already under constant shelling, and many people lost their homes and were forced to stay in the basement. For the evacuation, we were able to organize and refuel the transport, which first took 2 families from Mariupol to a safe place in Berdyansk. And then, a few days later, the transport was sent for the other two families, who were also evacuated to Berdyansk, then to Zaporozhye, then to the Dnieper, and from the Dnieper we were able to take these people to Alexandria. This is an elderly couple who are 73 years old. The war deprived these people of their apartment, in which they had lived for 45 years, and of all their property. We were able to accommodate these people in one of the rooms of our house, provide them with psychological and moral support, pay for their treatment and provide them with everything necessary for later life. Today, thanks to your financial support, the Church is working in several directions. 1. Work with immigrants who left the East and stopped in Alexandria for an indefinite period. Basically for such people - we provide assistance in the formation and distribution of food packages, diapers and baby food to those who have small children. 2. Work with migrants who are transiting through Alexandria to Western Ukraine and further to Europe For such people, we mainly provide accommodation, meals, and help some of them to refuel transport. 3. Working with military people We try to provide medicines to such people. 4. Work with the local population who find themselves in difficult circumstances and below the poverty line. Basically, we try to help families with food packages. Dear friends, we are very grateful to you for your prayers, care and financial assistance to serve the people who suffered in the war from Russian aggression on the territory of Ukraine. We will be glad to continue to do the Work of God together with you! With respect and prayer, Pastor Alexander Lysov

/ 925

/ 926

With your funds, we purchased and delivered to the battlefields 4 tons of food, 250 food packages, 1,000 loaves of bread, provided food aid to temporarily displaced persons from the east to our area, including the Church of the Renaissance in Bucha and some families. ÿì. 450 cans of stew were made. Some products and medicines were handed over to the military. Part of the money was spent on fuel for cars delivering cargo. Bought 1 monocular, unloading, reloading bags for two soldiers. Thank you for your contribution to the struggle of our people. God bless you !!

/ 927

They brought potatoes, flour and other food products for the parishioners of the church

/ 928

sincerely greet you, dear brothers and sisters, with the love of our Lord Jesus Christ! Thanks to your financial support, our organization buys products for cooking and baking bakery products within a month, where our friends can transfer them to places where people need a piece of bread! Every day, our team prepares and bakes products to support people who have been left without food. Our brothers take it away and give it away! We are extremely grateful for such help and believe that God will give you a hundredfold for all your good deeds. Thanks to you, we are able to feed thousands of people! May God abundantly bless everyone involved. We pray for you and bless in the name of the Lord!

/ 929

Many thanks to the Christmas Child Project for providing financial assistance at this difficult time for Ukraine. A volunteer team from our church works with refugees. who came to our city of Ostrog, and also received people who continued their way further to the West. Now on the basis of the church they can receive humanitarian aid: clothes, food packages (photos) temporarily displaced persons, also prepare dinners for them. We took people from Kharkiv (photo), and also brought humanitarian aid (photo) and medicines (photo) to Kharkiv. Of course, we do not stop there, we plan to hold a children's camp for refugee children. We pray for this and for God to expand our possibilities. May God abundantly bless you !!!

/ 930

Dear brothers and sisters! Thank you very much for your prayerful and financial support. We used the funds you transferred for transportation and reception of refugees. They bought them groceries and basic necessities. They also bought and handed over products to our citizens who are in the territory where the hostilities are taking place. Unfortunately, the war in Ukraine continues, the needs have not decreased. If you have the desire and opportunity to help more, we will be grateful. God bless you!

/ 931

We are in the rear, so we accept a large number of refugees from Donetsk and Luhansk regions, Kharkiv, Trostyanets, Mariupol, Chuguev, Okhtyrka. But they did not forget about their fellow villagers who one day found themselves without work and without means of subsistence. Before the war, we took care of socially vulnerable families with children who were registered with the social services. We had 30 such families in the district, with up to 100 children. Therefore, having received funds from the Samaritan's Bag, we took the products to such families.

/ 932

Victory Church Nizhyn continues to feed people. There are many more people than photos, here are some of them.

/ 933

They bought flour, oil, cereals, and potatoes in small quantities, and at home they packed a kilogram and created such food kits so that people would have enough for at least a few weeks until they register and receive help from the state.

/ 934

Some families live in remote villages. If before they could travel by bus to the city, now the buses do not run, and they have remained completely "cut off" from the world. Also, goods in rural stores stopped coming. This turned out to be a huge problem. Since we have a car, we used the Samaritan Bag to refuel and deliver food to distant villages.

/ 935

We moved this large family from the village to the city to look for at least some part-time work and live among the people. And then there are a few families left in their village, the shop is closed and they don't have a car. Even before the war, they lived below the poverty line, but the man went somewhere to make money. And now they are left naked, barefoot and without money. When we came to them with food, they had one onion and half a pack of rice on the table. That was all they had left of the food! God sent us very timely! We brought them food, and a few days later they moved to Poltava. Every week we go to Poltava for shopping, then we go to them - we ask how things are. They brought them groceries several times, washed their jackets and bedding, and took the children on weekends to distract and bathe them. One day we just got to the girl's birthday!

/ 936

For the first three weeks we were afraid to come to church, but then we decided to get together, because the children already missed each other and our regular meetings on Saturdays. Everyone was very happy, we sang, prayed, did patriotic deeds and gave gifts to those who did not receive on the holiday.

/ 937

This family is from Kharkiv. One of the first refugees we started helping. Products, hygiene products, detergents. And most importantly - the drugs they needed and which were very expensive, as for me, not to mention those who really need them, and there are no funds for them!

/ 938

This woman comes from our village, but has lived and worked in Kyiv for years. I sat there until the last, until it "flew" too close. She fled to her homeland to her relatives. After a while, a friend with a small child also came to her from Kyiv, because there was nowhere to go. Now they live here together. And we helped them with food, diapers and baby food.

/ 939

This is a large family of 6 children, registered in the social service. They live very poorly, because parents not only allow themselves to drink often, but also can not provide for adult children. While they were all small, the state paid for each of them, but now it's hard. We have been going to them for more than a year, mostly before September 1, to bring stationery to school and bring fruit and sweets for the New Year. And now we got acquainted, we visit more often. Because the parents lost their jobs, as a result - hunger!

/ 940

We made business cards and put them in the village council. Refugees came there to register, and they were given our business card. So the calls started to literally "pour"! I didn't have time to record and buy everyone! But to all who called, we took away a set of products and household goods.

/ 941

woman from the village who took in the refugees called. Nobody lived in the house for 10 years! Two women, each with three children, sat in a basement in Kharkiv for two Sundays, and then they were given 5 minutes to run for documents and evacuate. Therefore, they had no choice: where they settled, there they went. We had a hard time getting to their house in that village, we were afraid that the car would get stuck in the swamp. They don't have water - they go to take neighbors, because the well is silted up. Heat the stove to heat water and cook food. There are thickets around the house, so there is enough firewood. The children ran to the car and began to literally pull everything out and grab everything in a row, shouting: "My name is Nadia, and then Kostya ... and what's your name?" We took the cylinder to refuel it so that they could cook on gas. I wrote about this family on Facebook so that people could help. On the same day, utensils, pots, things, toys, products for this family were brought to my work! What kind, generous, responsive people we have! God encouraged them to sacrifice. Then my peer called me and asked to give him a family he could take care of. And I gave him these people. He took the balloon from us, the next day his mother baked cakes for the children and he and his friends went to them. They refueled and connected the cylinder, cleaned the well and threw the pump in there, brought the refrigerator! and did much more men's work. And then we realized that we can connect fellow villagers to our good cause, and not take it all on. Because physically they couldn't stand this cycle anymore: buy, pack, deliver to each family.

/ 942

Thank God. Thank you for your help. We buy and import diapers, baby food, hygiene products in the sanatorium where there are now IDP children in the number of 150 children aged 2 months to 15 years. We bring help with an interval of 7_10 days. We also collect social packages for people who have been temporarily relocated to our region. We provide assistance as needed to those who need it. We pray that God will help you in your work.

/ 943

We are very grateful for the money you have given to serve God and people, in such a difficult time for our country, we bought the equipment on which we started baking bread and send it to those cities who need it, we also help people in need it is like widows, widowers, the sick, children, families from disadvantaged families, may the Lord bless your ministry

/ 944

There is now a great need to help others. The Church of the Holy Sepulcher in the village of Ploska partially uses funds for the production of porridge (stew) in eastern Ukraine. A certain part was donated to families who came from hot spots and do not have the opportunity to earn a living and what to live for (this is both food and finance). The church also prepares (dumplings, cakes) for people in a mental hospital, there is a very urgent need for help. It is clear that a clear statement of the expenditure of these funds was needed here, but you will not spend all the funds at once. We try to use them as needed. We truly thank the Samaritan Bag Mission for financial assistance, we pray for you and your sincere sacrifice and help at a difficult time for us !!!

/ 945

/ 946

Glory to our Lord! During the war, the Church of the Holy Spirit of Mlyniv hosted 13 families from Kyiv and the region, 7 families from Kharkiv with a total number of 100 people. 75 people passed through the church in transit (stop, overnight stay and further departure abroad). The funds received from the Samaritan's Bag were used to provide the IDPs with food kits and basic necessities. Also, food kits are formed on a regular basis and taken by the brothers of our church to Kyiv; Okhtyrka, Lebedyn (Sumy region); Kharkiv.

/ 947

With the funds received, the Church of the Salvation (Ternopil) purchased 7,970 kg of products, which were sent to victims of the war with Russia in Kharkiv, Zaporizhia, Kyiv and Chernihiv regions. Humanitarian aid (clothes) was also given to migrants in Uzhhorod. 30 food packages were formed and handed over to refugees from Kyiv region, Chernihiv region, Zaporizhia region and Mykolayiv region, who stopped for temporary residence in Ternopil

/ 948

Mother and children, refugees from the city of Mariupol, moved to the city of Mirgorod. As mother Natasha Bondarenko says: - The children and I sat in the cellar for a long time during the bombing and now our family has been evacuated to a safe place of residence. We reported about God's love. We managed to give them gifts for the children and our mobile phone number, at home the children unpacked the boxes and sent the photo to our phone (since it was handing in the queue where they stood to register at the TsNAP.) Later we met by chance with this family , since they temporarily lived with the people who sheltered them, but they were offered a job with accommodation in the city of Krivoy Rog, we managed to talk with them for just a couple of minutes, only managed to buy sweets for the children on the road. Date: 05.04. 2022., in the amount of 57, 30. bought sweets for the children for the Bondarenko family, refugees from the city of Mariupol.

/ 949

Congratulations to the entire Samaritan Bag team! Peace to you! I express my gratitude on behalf of the Church of the Annunciation in the village of Novi Sanzhary, Poltava region, for your tangible support and assistance you have given to our church in its service to needy people and children in difficult times of our state. Thanks to your help, we were able to purchase food, medicine, and pay for the transportation of humanitarian aid for refugees. During this time, we provide assistance to all those who find themselves in a difficult financial situation due to the war. People receive the necessary clothes and things, as well as medicines and food packages. And most importantly, along with material assistance, we talk about the Good News and that everyone needs to make the most important choice of their lives. Thank you again for this tangible help. We pray for you and for God to strengthen you and bless you abundantly. Yours faithfully, Brother in Christ Jesus Tymoshenko Alexander

/ 950

Hello, I want to provide a photo report for the money spent, and that's not all the money spent. These are families of refugees from Mariupol, Sumy, Chernihiv, Kharkiv, Severodonetsk, Lysychansk, Lozova, Barvinkove, Izyum. At the discretion of the Pastor, meetings were held every Sunday for refugees, each member of the family received meat and cereals, and at home will cook what they want. The following week, food kits for oil, sugar, 4 types of cereals, pasta and tea were prepared. Refugees from the orphanage and rehabilitation home, MULTIPLE FAMILIES also received special assistance, including diapers, sweets, eggs, meat, cereals, sugar, pasta. This is only 1/3 of what we have received, every Sunday we do charitable help thanks to you, pray for YOU and Bless, thank you and the Lord. This help is very important, people are extremely grateful. on the other hand, a fire broke out because a shell hit, and the men in the basement somehow cleared the passage on the side where the blockage was, because a fire was approaching on the other side, and they helped save this mother and children, miraculously she escaped. God really is! Thank you for being able to be closer to people and to be Jesus Christ in their lives at this difficult time. ”

/ 952

Dear friends, employees of the Samaritan's Bag, on behalf of the Church of Christians of the Faith of the Evangelical Faith in the village of Staryi Oleksynets, Kremenets district, Ternopil region, I express my sincere gratitude for your support in serving temporarily displaced persons, especially children. Our village and the adjacent villages of the Lopushne territorial community became a refuge for many people who were forced to leave their homes, fleeing the war. Since the beginning of the war, about 70 gifts illustrated by the New Testament and the books The Greatest Journey have been distributed to immigrant children. The funds provided by you are used for the delivery of humanitarian aid and food, for the arrangement of housing in abandoned houses. Necessary things, household appliances and other things necessary for living are purchased. Thanks to you, we can give comfort to the sad, support to the underprivileged, and tears to the weeping. A ray of joy in children's eyes, when receiving toys, gives hope that the Lord will surely help all of us and soon the long-awaited peace will come. In doing this work, we communicate with people, listen to their stories, encourage them, and invite them to worship. I would like to share one testimony given by one woman. She and her family arrived safely from Pokrovsk in our own car with children. And her niece and her two children were to follow them by train from Kramatorsk. Being at the station among the crowd, the children immediately forced their mother to step aside to the nearest shop to buy sweets. As they did so, they heard a rocket explode that landed where they had just left. God miraculously saved their lives. Thank God. In conclusion, I want to wish you all health, well-being and all the best. And to all Ukrainians - a peaceful sky over their heads. May God's blessing be with you all. And with the coming feast of Christ's Resurrection. May it be joyful and, of course, peaceful! Sincerely, Church Minister Vitaliy Malanyuk. (!)

/ 954

Congratulations, dear brothers and sisters! We are very grateful to everyone who is involved in this, for your help in difficult times for Ukraine and members of the IWG SEE "Salvation" Vinnytsia. The assistance you provided was used to purchase food kits, medical care and evacuation. May the Lord bless you abundantly and reward you a hundredfold !!!

/ 955

posted an ad on Facebook so that anyone who wanted to donate something to refugees could come to work for me (I have a large hall). People brought vegetables, canned food, utensils, things, bedding, blankets, toys, etc. Refugees make copies of my documents at work to help me. I see the postscript in the passport, do it for free and communicate. I ask where they fled from, if they are in need. And right in the lobby I give them help.

/ 956

This woman came to work for us. My husband played with the child while she made copies of documents. He asked how old he was and said that we would come to them and bring the child a present. We brought them children's things, gave the boy a present, and he said, "Is this me? And for a hundred (what)?" It was so cute ...

/ 957

It is good that there are caring people who want to help. A woman from a nearby village called me. She told how many families of migrants in their village, we arranged a meeting, went there, she went to the village council on a bicycle, met us, took us to each family. I thought she was the head of the village council, but it turned out not to be - she is the head of the kindergarten! Well done, not indifferent! We brought help to five different families. One: a son and a lying mother with broken legs, the second - five friends of retirees gathered and ran away, the third - teachers, even wrote a thank you - so nice, the fourth and fifth - ordinary people who sat in the basement for two weeks, thought that everything would end, and then they realized that it would not happen so quickly and left.

/ 958

give help at home right during working hours!

/ 959

I organized a kind of "reception point for the distribution of humanitarian aid to refugees." Fellow villagers bring everything they are willing to share with the needy, and I give it to them right in the lobby. One woman was so surprised that she exclaimed: "Can I kiss you ?!"

/ 960

Some people have a car - it's good because they can take food and things from me. And for those who do not have a car, we take the address and bring it straight home, because they will not deliver in their hands - everything is heavy: potatoes, beets, cereals, flour, oil ...

/ 961

Some we go home, some pick up at work, and some give right next to the store!

/ 962

Today there were two grandmothers from Lysychansk, one lying 92 years old, and the other said that she cried all night because a shell hit her house at night, now she is left without a roof over her head! They also brought help and sweets to a young widow with a 5-year-old son, and she has not yet told him that her father was killed in the war because she does not know how to do it.

/ 963

Fighters from fellow villagers called. They said that a 12-year-old boy Sashko, an orphan living with his grandmother, went to the checkpoint. They feed him, teach him to shoot. We gave him two bags of things, sweets, a gift and baked cakes. The guys dropped a photo where he was already in our things. I asked to take a picture of him with your gift, but they replied that he had already been evacuated from there.

/ 964

The woman wrote, asked for help. This is a grandmother. The children's mother died of cancer, the father does not need them. He does not receive financial assistance for them. They live in the village, heat in winter with firewood, which they pull themselves from planting. Children play right in the ground because there is no sand.

/ 965

The funds received from the Samaritan's Bag helped the EHB church in the village of Brest actively serves the people during the war. We accept migrants, provide them with food and basic necessities. We help food packages to families with children left without material support as a result of the war. Funds were allocated for the repair of minibuses, which evacuate people from "hot spots". As a result, some of the displaced people began attending our services. Praise the Lord for the fact that in such dark times the Church of Christ has the opportunity to bring light to the people and to show God's love for people in a tangible way.

/ 966

Difficult times have begun in our country. But despite this, our church tries to help the needy in every possible way. Many people from the destroyed cities of Ukraine came to our area. They came with nothing. We use the Samaritan Bags to prepare charity dinners for people in need. Also, we use this money to purchase products and hygiene products for the affected residents of Chernihiv and Zaporizhia. We truly thank all the people who help with finances, prayer for our country, our people in this terrible time for us!

/ 967

For us, support in financial assistance is a great blessing, during the difficult situation in Ukraine. As soon as the war began, we immediately began to act as a Church, and it was at this time that the Church had the opportunity to serve and testify even more about Jesus. And on the basis of the local Church, we created a charitable fund for humanitarian aid. People and refugees began to turn to us. We have seen that it is a great blessing to those around us. God is very blessed, help came from all over the world. Our Church is small, so we would not be able to do that. Financial support from the Samaritan Bag is a miracle and an answer to prayer. For this whole amount, we could buy products and pack "food kits" for a long time. Thank you very much and your team. May the Lord bless and reward to a great extent. May the peaceful sky be above you. God's grace to you. It's been more than a month of war. We are serving people, there were hundreds on our way, thousands of people we helped and testified of Jesus Christ. Every Sunday, new people come to our Church. Every Sunday there are people who repent. The time has come when there are not enough chairs in the church to sit on, this is a miracle for us. We are experiencing God's great grace. With God's help, we continue to serve. With love and gratitude New Life Church Dnipropetrovsk region

/ 968

we continue to buy local stores in bulk and distribute them directly at the workplace

/ 969

Good day. The North Church in Kryvyi Rih reports to you. We would like to express our gratitude to you for coming to our aid during such difficult times for us. $ 5,000 was transferred to our church, which amounted to UAH 145,689.4. Our expenses: 1) UAH 43,189.4 - food kits for refugees arriving in our city, large families, and families of SJO who visit our Christian club. 2) UAH 5,000 - for packages for food kits (products were packed and given to people) 3) UAH 2,100 - payment for medical care 4) UAH 11,000 - payment for fuel (delivery of products to places), 5) UAH 12,000 - payment for transportation of products by truck to our city 6) UAH 11,300 - purchase of fabric for bulletproof vests for our SRW fighters who protect our city from the enemy 7) UAH 2,900 - purchase of thermal underwear, socks for SRW fighters 8) UAH 3,200 - repair of washing machines in the center, which accepts up to 100 refugees 9) UAH 25,000. - billboards with passages from the Holy Scriptures (for bringing the Gospel to the people, instead of billboards with abusive words). We believe that these are very important actions when a person does not know what to hope for and where he will be after death. 10) UAH 30,000 - Easter billboards. In general, all funds were spent on purpose. Now I want to describe in more detail how you and I were able to help with these funds. Food kits: cereals, canned food, vegetables came in handy for people who came to our city without anything. It is a great joy to see the spark of gratitude and hope for humanity in their eyes. You understand that this will help them just survive the first, most difficult stages of their resettlement. Part of the funds was transferred to the church in Tsyuryupynsk (which was under siege at the time) for the purchase of food. They even sent a video of their thank you message. I will attach a photo. Our brothers took cookies to the checkpoints for our defenders, the guys are also people and sometimes, especially in cold weather, cookies become a godsend. The guys are very grateful. Products were purchased for refugees (about 100 people) living in the school. They are fed there 3 times a day. There, in this institution, they helped financially repair two washing machines, which could not cope with the work of such a large number of people. Unfortunately, many guys with SRW were understaffed even with just warm underwear, bulletproof vests, etc. When the pastor bought thermal underwear and said it was for the defenders, we were given a good discount. People are coming to meet us, everyone understands that we need to help each other, otherwise we simply will not survive. We bought fabric, threads for sewing bulletproof vests (they are made in our city) to somehow help those who protect us at the cost of their own lives. The central church of our city, together with our brothers and sisters, serves the people who come to the registration point for internally displaced persons. Together with the tent, they organized a tent free of charge, offering people waiting for their turn tea, coffee, cookies, cakes, listening to someone, testifying to someone about the Savior, and inviting them to church. The fact is that there are a lot of people who come, and sometimes they stand in line for registration for several hours. You would see their eyes looking gratefully at the people who cared for them. Since we understand that daily bread without spiritual bread is nothing, the brothers decided to spread the Word of God on billboards. Unfortunately, there are now many billboards with abusive words addressed to the Russian army and Putin. But we understand that curses are the devil's weapon. We fight with you with the weapon of our Lord - His word. Once again, we are very grateful for your help, it was a blessing for a very large number of people. May the Lord bless you and give you 1000 times

/ 970

man from Kharkiv, Volodymyr, a shell fell 100 meters from him! At our work, something rumbled somewhere, he turned "what was it ?!" - he is afraid. As I gave him everything, tears came to his eyes! I took photos underground, because it's inconvenient to harass some people ... and I continue to distribute food and household kits right at work during breaks between clients.

/ 971

Your funds have helped us do a lot of help to people who are in combat zones. We mostly made finished products and imported them to cities and villages that were at the epicenter of the war and needed help. And also contacted military units and bought them essentials and medicines. And at the moment about 20 tons of aid have been sent from our church. Thank you very much for your financial support. God bless you!

/ 972

Many thanks to all the staff of the Samaritan Bag Mission, to all those who joined this good cause, in very difficult times for Ukraine, the money received was spent mainly on procurement and delivery, and food distribution, especially in the occupied territories, where the real trouble is where there is no possibility to bring, we transfer funds to people in need, a large part goes to food that people come to daily prayer and then can eat, also help with medicines for those in need, a lot of help for children on nutrition and hygiene, and adults can get hygiene , and part of the funds for fuel for cars involved in this good cause. Thank you very much and thank God.

/ 973

Congratulations to our Samaritan Bag partners! The religious community of the Christian Church of the Evangelical Faith "Heavenly Gift" expresses its sincere gratitude to you and thank you for your help to our church during the war with Russia. Your help is an invaluable contribution to the development of charity and, of course, tangible support to the needy and needy, people who have been forced to move to other cities, or those who lost their jobs at such a difficult time. Good deeds do not go unnoticed - they shine like beacons to those who are waiting for help. By providing help, you give not just material values, but give joy and hope for a peaceful life. May your kindness and generosity return to you a hundredfold. We wish you all the best, health, prosperity and more warmth in your life. Thanks to your financial support, people received material help and most importantly prayed the prayer of repentance, you accepted Jesus Christ into your hearts. Thanks to your support, we helped about 80 families in need of financial support. Most of these families are internally displaced persons who are forced to leave their homes. People fleeing from Donetsk, Luhansk, Kyiv regions had only documents proving their identity. An interesting testimony of the Incredible God. A family of six people: grandmother, grandfather, mother, father and two children left the Donetsk region, under God's protection they reached the Dnipropetrovsk region of Nikopol. We prepared a house with three rooms for them, where we could arrange everything, bought a device for heating water, replaced the unusable unit in the house. The family did not expect that they would be accepted like that, now we are helping with food for the family, because no one in the family is working yet, they are not receiving help from the state yet. After such help and preaching of the Gospel, the family visited churches and accepted Jesus Christ into their hearts. Thanks to your help, we were able to buy a large number of foods such as vegetables, fruits, cereals, flour, sugar, oil and more. We distributed all the products to the needy, who have now lost their jobs due to the war. A large number of large families were forced to leave Nikopol, they asked for help and asked for help because in another city where they stayed, they could only find a place to spend the night and could not buy food, so we transferred funds to families in need. It should be noted that your material support has helped people to understand not only their physical bodies but also their souls. At such a difficult time for our country, people really need basic things such as a roof over their heads, food, clothing, hygiene products, which is why your support is extremely important. Today the hearts of men are open to Christ, and in the preaching of the Gospel we are greatly helped by your financial support. Thanks to your help, the church was able to purchase the necessary equipment for the bomb shelter, which is on the territory of the church, these are: electric stoves for cooking, generator, refrigerator, necessary utensils, microwave. Unfortunately, the emotions of the people who received help cannot be conveyed in words. One 19-year-old girl who lost her job and has no support, could not believe her eyes when receiving help, cried very loudly and thanked God for your sensitive hearts. Our acquaintances told us about people who desperately needed help from Nikopol, Pokrova, Chervonohryhorivka, then we collected food packages and New Testaments and went to their home, people accepted Jesus into their hearts, some of them then attended Sunday services. , some have opened their homes to Christ and now we can come to their homes and serve their families. Thus, internally displaced persons, persons with disabilities, large families, and people who have now lost their income due to unemployment have received financial assistance.

/ 974

Our ECB church in Busk, Lviv region, is small, and we gladly serve the Lord by helping others. In the bitter times when Russia invaded Ukraine, many people lost their homes without any means or means of subsistence. With the help of the Samaritan Bag, we were able to help families with food and hygiene items. For example, a family from Chernihiv received such a coveted package and sincerely thanked the Samaritan Church and Sumy for their care. They sincerely rejoiced at the food and clothing they had unfortunately lost in the war. Also, we have people with disabilities who are not immigrants, but who lost their breadwinners due to Russia's aggression. They also received food kits from us. Thanks to the funds, we support people in need at this time. Thank you and praise the Lord for your tangible help.

/ 975

We bought body armor and materials for tailoring uniforms at the request of the military unit.

/ 976

Gratitude from sister Zakharovka

/ 977

With your help, we were able to help and will continue to help many families who were forced to evacuate from Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson regions. Transportation, accommodation, food were organized. Many people stopped temporarily and continued on their way. The pastor's family (near Melitopol) was taken out of the occupied territory of Zaporizhia region. A convoy of cars carrying the pastor's wife and three children came under fire while driving through the occupied territories. All people began to pray, the shelling stopped, people were able to evacuate. Thank you, God, for saving your life! Now this family is abroad. Organized trips by our transport with food and medicine to the villages where it is needed. There are also street meals for the needy twice a week. We help to organize accommodation and meals for people from evacuated areas who have decided to stay in our city. Thank you to your organization for your help and for your caring hearts, your prayers. May the Lord bless you! We believe in victory!

/ 978

The Church "Restoration of the Tabernacle" expresses its gratitude to the "Good Samaritan" mission for the assistance provided with food, which we were able to distribute in the city of Nikolaev and Odessa. Thanks to your participation, many families, the elderly, orphans and widows, as well as families with many children, were provided with basic necessities. Good deeds will not go unnoticed - they are like beacons, shining on those who are waiting for help. We are sure that your example is indicative for other philanthropists. By helping, you give not only material values, but also joy and hope. We wish you all the best, health, more warmth on your life path. May the Lord bless you!

/ 979

Peace to you! Dear friends, please tell me how you can send photos and videos, we are not loading.

/ 980

Thank God, our church, and I personally, as the person responsible for the Samaritan Bag, thank you very much for the money you have sent us. In these difficult times, we have the opportunity to support each other. Our church takes in accommodation, feeds people leaving the occupied cities, buys and sends food to cities where they are needed now, as well as prepares dumplings, porridge with meat (rice, buckwheat, pearl barley), stews, lard , lard, bread… Thank you again, it was a great financial support, thanks to it we were able to join the help of such cities as Irpin, Bucha, Trostyanets, Kharkiv… May God bless you!

/ 997

Congratulations! We truly thank everyone who donated money for our church! Since the beginning of the war, about 1,500 refugees from Kyiv, Kharkiv, Luhansk, Sumy, Odesa, Chernihiv, and Poltava oblasts have been admitted to our church. etc. Our sisters make blanks in the kitchen, bake various pastries. We also pack food packages, take them to the east of our country and distribute them to people! Thank God that even in this difficult time we can serve! May God bless and reward everyone who will help in this difficult time for Ukraine!

/ 998

The Church of the Divine Revival of Kropyvnytskyi thanks you for your support. Due to the war in our country, many people can not find work, and therefore are unable to rent housing and are forced to stay in a social center for the homeless. Our church helps such people with food. We also financially supported the family of Roman Sementsov, a volunteer who died at the Kramatorsk railway station during a rocket attack.

They bought food for refugees from the city of Kharkiv, for the family (Krupinina Oksana and husband Serhiy and their mother Nelly Kishinets, and their children of three boys). Date: 11.04.22. In the amount of 16.37. They bought food for refugees from the city of Kharkiv, for the family (Krupinina Oksana and husband Serhiy and their mother Nelly Kishinets, and their children of three boys). Date: 11.04.22. In the amount of 23.09. They bought food for refugees from the city of Kharkiv, for the family (Krupinina Oksana and husband Serhiy and their mother Nelly Kishinets, and their children of three boys). Date: 11.04.22. In the amount of 22.63. They bought food for refugees from the city of Kharkiv, for the family (Krupinina Oksana and husband Serhiy and their mother Nelly Kishinets, and their children of three boys). Testimony When we saw a family waiting in line for registration near the CNAP, we asked them: --- Are these your children? ---So! We left them our phone number and said: --- If they need any help, call. The next day, they called and invited us to their place and said that they ran out of money and the children want to eat, but all the money we got to rent the house in which they now live. We brought them food and gifts for the children. Witnessed to God. We talked to them several times a day, and they themselves wanted to come to our meeting. Although they were reluctant to hear about God at first, they were interested in my testimony of how I came to God, and they wanted to know more about God. Thank God!

/ 1003

Dear friends and partners, we truly thank you for your care for our church at this difficult time for our country! We wish you God's abundant blessings, may the Lord reward you for your sacrifice! Our village Stepnogorsk is in the "gray zone" almost from the very beginning of the war, there is no water from the very beginning, light and heat disappear very often. Many people lost their jobs and social benefits due to the war, so we organized the distribution of food aid, which was a significant and timely support to many people. Many unbelievers came to church not only to receive help, but also to hear the healing words of God's love, which they were able to receive in a tangible way through the help they provided. We pray that the Lord will touch the hearts of these people and that these difficult times will help them to save their souls. The funds provided were also used to order, purchase and deliver medicines from other cities, as the village has very limited access to the necessary medicines. People were very grateful, because many elderly people need constant medical support. Assistance was also provided to the elderly with diapers and nappies, the supply of drinking water, transportation of people and assistance to soldiers with food. Thank you again for the opportunities and pray for peace in the country and in the hearts of the people!

/ 1010

From the first day of the war, EHB Kalynivka opened the doors of DM as a bomb shelter for locals and refugees from Chernihiv who were provided with food, medicine, and comfortable living conditions. The ministers of the Church, having funds, supplied medicines to Chernihiv and evacuated people back. The church also provided assistance to the Ter Defense Forces uniform, clothing, gloves, socks, field, cauldrons, medicines, flashlights. Many thanks to the Samaritan Bag Mission for financial support. May the Lord bless your ministry.

/ 1011

We are looking for abandoned houses where no one lives, tidying up and settling refugees. We provide food and everything you need. These people come to church grateful to us and to God, listening to the message of salvation. We also prepare loads of food (pies, bread, stews) and take them to areas where there are fights.

/ 1012

Dear parterres. Thank you, Jesus Christ, for your generous contribution to the ministry of our Church. 1. The youth of the Church served the refugees in cars on the road, making hot tea and food. Also preaching the gospel. 2. During the service of our headquarters for displaced people, we served about 900 people. Taking them, providing food and shelter. In addition, we talk about spiritual topics. Already 8 people from the settlers were baptized. 3. We send products to Kharkiv and Kyiv. 4. We periodically deliver products to the kitchen, which prepares lunches for migrants living at the base, about 15 km from Ternopil. (90 people). On this basis we hold services, at dinner, after the service of our church. 5. Today, 7 people live on the premises of the Church on a permanent basis. Food and services at our expense. Bible studies are underway. 6. We supply food kits to people who have lived in the Church and now live with our brothers and sisters. We take care of about 8 families. They began to attend services. 7. Every week we decided to give an additional blow to 10 more refugee families who will come to the headquarters. 8. We have a day center for children from Ternopil and children who have moved from hot spots. 9. The Church has organized a Football Club for teenagers and young people from displaced families. May the Almighty bless you. Sincerely, Igor Belorus Ternopil RO ECB "Evangelical Church of Jesus Christ"

And our chefs and volunteers are dedicated to this front. Last week alone, almost 900 people were fed. 88 of them will be transported through social services for the seriously ill. Thank God for giving each of us the strength today to cope with the challenge before us. Thanks to the donors of Samaritan's Purse International Relief, thanks to you, our common cause continues to grow and bear good fruit for the glory of God.

/ 1022

Sometimes people are ready to donate something, to share something, but they do not know how to do it, to whom and where to take it. When we started helping refugees, I posted a photo on Facebook, fellow villagers started writing and calling - offering their help. Now I have a kind of mini volunteer center at work. People bring everything they want to share, and those who need it come and get it.

/ 1023

My friend brought a lot of baby food, diapers. She was sent by her mother, who is in Italy. I bought products at your expense and took them all to young mothers

/ 1024

My friend's mother is now in Italy. In connection with the current situation, she sent here baby food, medicine and diapers. I bought more products at your expense and took it all to young mothers.

/ 1025

Thanks to your support, we can help people who have left their homes due to the war with Russia. This includes accommodation and meals, personal hygiene and clothing. And also, if necessary, we take our own transport to the border with Poland. Also, the sisters from our church of Golgotha bake buns every day and we distribute them at the train station and in the schools where the refugees are.

/ 1026

From the second day of the war, our small church began to actively help the Armed Forces of Ukraine. On the second day of the war, Russian forces attacked a military unit 21 kilometers from us. The remnants of the military unit of soldiers and equipment arrived in our village in the evening. The next day we were already gathering food for the soldiers and everything we needed. We had $ 1,500 to renovate the House of Prayer. So we decided to help the army, territorial defense, refugees, because if the Russians come to us in the village, it will not need repairs. So I bought food for soldiers and defense, clothes for volunteers, food for refugees.

Namely, the supply - clothes, shoes, food, hygiene products, mattresses and medicines. Many left without anything, some do not even have documents. Once again, thank you so much for helping us not lose heart and see the hand of God through you. God bless you all!

/ 1030

Youth Creative Center and churches in Razdelnaya and Razdelyansky district of Odessa region are very grateful for your help and support in such a difficult time for all of us. Your help was very timely, in the first weeks of the outbreak of hostilities, we evacuated mothers from their children abroad. Our churches are located in close proximity to the border with Transnistria. Also, our family-type shelter and large families were transported to the interior of the region. Razdelnaya is a major railway junction in Ukraine and a strategically important point. We are engaged in the delivery of food and medicine to those in need. We have organized a help point in churches, we distribute food, things, we provide accommodation for the night, we gather children and teenagers, we conduct classes with them, meals are also organized. Organized assistance in sending abroad, mainly mothers with children. Now our shelter is preparing to accept children, there is a large family in which two children died during a fire, because. the state orphanage was taken abroad, and the children arrive on the spot and they need to be identified. Our volunteers sew first-aid kits, which we fill with medicines and distribute to those in need, and sent to Kherson when we had the opportunity. Many of our parishioners are at the forefront as the Ministry of Emergency Situations, doctors, volunteers, we support them with everything they need. We continue to work and trust in our God, we pray for the speedy end of this war, we ask God for strength. May the Lord reward you a thousandfold for your support and kindness. We believe that everything will be fine. With gratitude, Chairman of the Youth Creative Center, Pastor and minister of the churches of the Razdelyansky district Mishchenko R.V., Mishchenko V.I., Bezhenar A.V..
